channel.title: IocmAgent (JIRA)
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [IP-103951] IocmAgent: Does not send manualCorrections if sendImages is disabled.
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.14.1.P433-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client : xxxx - <client code>

RDS

Clinical Impact:

Delayed sending of images if unable to use this feature.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Configure IOCM with sendImages = false, and sendManualCorrections = true

Expected behaviour:

IOCM doesn't route new images but if a user does a correction it sends the corrected copy of the images

What happened instead?:

Study corrections aren't processed.
"Skipping because this study was validated and sending is disabled by policy"

RDS is mentioning that due to the way IOCM sends they are seeing image delays and this is outlined in CS0130652. Since Autoroute would be sending out SOPs as they become ingested it is actually faster to autoroute than to use IOCM.

IOCM inserts a bunch of series send events as it ingests and those get skipped when another exists. So when a large CT series comes in that takes 7 or so minutes to send over the wire and is subsequently ingested in batches by LDS, we end up only sending the final series_send and loose the time we could have been routing images,.

To circumvent this we were going to try to turn off sendImages and use AutoRoute, but it turns out that turning off sendImages we loose the corrections through IOCM as well. Arguably we could attempt to rely on route Corrected images but depending on Autoroute configuration and the fact that this would also route all ris corrections this isn't preferred.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Does not send manualCorrections if sendImages is disabled.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: requesting LOE.

A few examples traced after we turned on Autoroute. End result is it performs better than IOCM for sending images most of the time

Traced a few series and here are some findings.

Series 1.3.12.2.1107.5.1.4.105066.30000019041711352096900033797
First received imaged at 19:03,
Last Image received at 19:13
Last Image autorouted at 19:14
IOCM logged that it kept deferring due to another activity until the final attempt at 19:17 which logged it was already on the "VNA"

So this means not only did we save the 3 mins of dead time, but IOCM actually DOESN'T do a double send as I had previously thought (good news!)

Next looking at an entire study
Accnum 8600182.001SAH
First image received 19:02
Last Image received 19:10
Last Image autorouted 19:12
On the IOCM side of things, it appears by the time it got to 8/20 series they had already made it to RDS Central.
Looking at one of the other 12:
1.3.12.2.1107.5.1.4.105066.30000019041711352096900029586 sent by IOCM at 19:12:06, and took about 4 seconds. The Same series was sent at the following timestamps for the 35 images
19:03:15.363
19:03:15.536
19:04:51.563
19:04:51.641
19:04:51.750
19:04:51.812
19:06:03.815
19:06:03.920
19:06:04.005
19:06:04.100
19:06:04.172
19:06:04.255
19:07:39.370
19:07:39.439
19:07:39.585
19:07:39.667
19:07:39.856
19:07:39.945
19:09:23.706
19:09:23.775
19:09:23.849
19:09:23.939
19:09:24.042
19:11:05.097
19:11:05.189
19:11:05.254
19:11:05.316
19:11:05.377
19:11:05.446
19:12:21.829
19:12:21.911
19:12:21.967
19:12:22.039
19:12:22.210
19:12:22.286

So basically the last 6 images were sent in later than it's IOCM counterpart,

This plays to the comment I made to Jeff that sometimes IOCM is working quickly but overall we seem to have the bulk of the study being sent through autoroute before IOCM even got to attempting it.

RDS is going to want this prioritized as in their eyes, IOCM just isn't getting the job done. So if we reject this we need something to go back to them with.

RDS is at R50. R59 has very significant performance improvements. I believe that they are enough to go back from AutoRoute to Iocm. This lowers the importance of this bug. But it would still add more flexibility in the future.

Proposed Solution:

Create a new config key to control the corrections and have sentImages only apply to SERIES_SEND activities.

Hi George

In the meantime, do you suggest to update RDS to 4-14-1-R59?
What kind of performance improvements can have a significant impact on the current issue? RDS will ask.

Thanks for your time and help

Martin

From what I can tell these are all the fixes:

IP-102927 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: Image Resent when it failed to do "Signaling Storage Commitment Handler to wake up" IocmAgent
IP-102953 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: Loading all SOPs in a Series causes OutOfMemory IocmAgent
IP-97104 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: Worker threads stop responding due to suspected OutOfMemory error IocmAgent
IP-97235 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: retries to delete a study (or a serie) that no longer exists on the VNA IocmAgent
IP-97236 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: Series that get rejected with a permanent failure get retried IocmAgent
send_image
IP-97237 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: Series is sent to VNA when it is not routed to the IocmAgent host and the study does not have a VNA location IocmAgent
IP-97386 MAJOR CLO/DON IocmAgent: Worker Thread timeout not configurable IocmAgent
IP-97424 MAJOR CLO/DON IOCM: add StorageCommitQueue table lock before any updates or inserts IocmAgent
IP-97648 MAJOR CLO/DON IOCM: sendSeriesToArchive should un-reserve series on LDS and the reservation time-out should be de same used to send images IocmAgent

I don't believe any of these affect the behavior that IOCM waits until all images are completely ingested prior to sending. Which means as seen through investigation and comparing to Autoroute performance, Autoroute woudl still "win" the race of routing images sooner (partial or not) which is the behavior RDS is complaining about.
Full list of IOCM enhancements can be found here
This issue has been prioritized on the top of the backlog

John Tournas I believe that you are mistaken in how IOCM works. LDS creates a SERIES_SEND operation for each ingested batch and sends it to IOCM. IOCM will compress multiple consecutive SEND_SERIES operations into a single one, but if the images are coming in super-slow, IOCM will send partial series just like Autoroute.

We have made a number of improvements to IOCM to optimize the compression of operations and general IOCM behaviour, which should also help get rid of the "deferring due to future activity" you were seeing. Once RDS receives their FRU, I expect that this bug will become unnecessary.

Mark Groves The logs on site evaluated showed that a large series deferred several times, and was 100% sent by Autoroute before IOCM even processed the first series send since it kept deferring. I agree that the FRU is needed to evaluate if this is still the case. I suspect there are still optimisations to be made but I will be happy to be proven wrong.

Changeset:
We bypass the check policy (sendImages config) when processing a study correct.
Like this, when a correction is requested on a study, we send the correction to the VNA even if the sendImages config key is set to false.

Local Tests Performed:

  • Request a correction when sendImages is set to false

Review changeset

Code review ( code, Intelerad coding conventions )
Code commit message ( Kallithea/Forge )

Verify Jira

Release notes
Canned response 'Dev: Resolve'
RPM Upgrade List
Fix versions
Release impact info
TestRail

Others

Documentations ( If any )
Update Trunk env devX created for reproduction. Reproduction to be done.

Update :
Reproduction successfully done
Testing in progress
Test cases to be done for the ticket are documented in this document. 7/9 tests executed so far.

Adil Faiyaz How about this for the release notes:
The IocmAgent is skipping manual corrections when the sending images to the VNA option is disabled in the archiving policy; therefore, corrected images are not being sent to the VNA.

Kathleen Jette
Hi Kathleen,
Yes, that's what the bug was. If you're putting in the release notes what the bug was, then it's correct but please do change the archiving policy to Iocm policy 

The IocmAgent is skipping manual corrections, even though it's enabled, when the sending images to the VNA option is disabled in the Iocm policy; therefore, corrected images are not being sent to the VNA

Reproduced with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.18.2.A2-ims01.noarch

Steps for Reproduction

  • Set the keys in MpiDicomDomains.cfg as the following 
    • [IocmIntegration_QATOOLS]
vnaAeTitle                                       = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy                                = INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED
participatingAeTitles                            = MST1
delayInHours                                     = 0
  • Send a study and verify it reaches the VNA i.e QATOOLS
  • Request a couple of study corrections and verify that those corrections reach the VNA
  • Make the following config change in IocmAgent.cfg and restart IocmAgent after that 
    •  Looking at the integrationPolicy set in the MpiDicomDomains.cfg as INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED.., change the set of keys in the section [IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED] of IocmAgent.cfg like follows


[IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED]
sendManualCorrections                            = true
sendValidationCorrections                        = true
sendRisCorrections                               = false
sendImages                                       = false
sendUnvalidatedImages                            = false
sendDeletions                                    = true
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName                    = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/rejectionNote.dcm
dicomOperationLevel                              = SERIES
  • Send a correction to the IocmAgent host
  • Notice that this time, unlike before, the correction was not sent to the VNA.

Verified with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.18.2.P000-ims99.noarch

Verification steps:

Test1

Verify that the corrections are sent to the VNA for the study when sendManualCorrections = true & sendImages=false

  • Repeat the steps for the reproduction
  • After making the config change to set sendImages = false and keep sendManualCorrections = true, request a correction to the study again
  • Verify the correction was sent to the VNA 
    • * A STUDY_CORRECT operation should be created for the study_uid in the iocm_activity
* Correction should be propagated to the VNA
  • Verify by checking the logs of IocmAgent that the RouteImage was invoked

Test2

Verify that a correction having no changes is not propagated to the VNA

  • Repeat the above test
  • Do a requestCorrection but donot change the value of the tag, i.e execute the requestCorrection command but keep the value of the tag the same as before
  • Ensure that LDS detects that the value of the tag has not been changed

Test3

Verify that the corrections are not sent to the VNA if sendImages = false & sendManualCorrections = false

  • Repeat the steps from Test1
  • Change the config in the IocmAgent.cfg to have sendImages = false & sendManualCorrections = false
  • After restarting IocmAgent, request a valid correction to a tag i.e StudyDesc
  • Verify that the correction has not been sent to the VNA
    • Verify that no record has been inserted for the STUDY_CORRECT in the iocm_activity
  • Verify that you see the following log in IocmAgent_localhost.localdomain.log 
    • [2019-05-07 15:44:42.560 HttpServer_5136_IOD_2_0000000000000000 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] IocmAgentService correctStudy invoked with studyInstanceUid [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.24838.1557255338.294265] triggered by requests [[1-369-2-7]] and requestors [[adil]]
[2019-05-07 15:44:42.563 HttpServer_5136_IOD_2_0000000000000000 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Skipping because the policy is not configured to send manual corrections

Test 4

Verify that the corrections are not sent to the VNA if sendImages = true & sendManualCorrections = false

  • The behavior should be exactly the same as Test 3

Test 5

Verify that the corrections are sent to the VNA if sendImages = true & sendManualCorrections = true

Test 6

Mapping confirmation between MpiDicomDomains.cfg.integrationPolicy to sectionNames in IocmAgent.cfg

  • Set your MpiDicomDomains.cfg with the below config 
    • [IocmIntegration_QATOOLS]
vnaAeTitle                                       = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy                                = INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED
participatingAeTitles                            = MST1
delayInHours                                     = 0
  • Set sendManualCorrections = false and sendImages = false in all the sections in IocmAgent.cfg except the one section which is specified in MpiDicomDomains.cfg.integrationPolicy i.e INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED
  • For the section INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED, set both the keys to true
  • Verify that the correction is sent to the VNA

Test7

  • Cover all keys below that can be specified for the integrationPolicy
    • INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED
    • INTELE_VNA_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED
    • M7_WITH_RIS_FEED
    • DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED
    • INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_AND_IMAGE_OPERATON_LEVEL
  • For each of the config key, set the sendManualCorrections = true & sendImages=false and verify that the corrections are sent to the VNA
  • Scenarios for all the keys mentioned passed.

Note: Looking at the code in IocmAgentServiceImpl, it seems clear that the sendImages key does not effect sendRisCorrections or sendDeletions

End Result : All tests passed. Assigning the ticket to dev.

item.title: [IP-103464] Fix unit tests and re-enable intermediaries unit test after openjdk11 is merge to trunk
item.description:
RPM Version

N/A

ISP - Client :

N/A

Clinical Impact:

N/A

Minimal steps to reproduce:

execute scons

Expected behaviour:

intermediaries testall is executed

What happened instead?:

We had to disable the test
./components/dbintermediarieslib/src/test/java/com/intelerad/db/intermediaries/lib/TestAll.java
since it would time out the build.(Buildbot would stop test all after 600 seconds of inactivity) - see BC-4532 for more details.

Fixing this bug should re-enable the TestAll and fix the timeout issue.
item.summary: Fix unit tests and re-enable intermediaries unit test after openjdk11 is merge to trunk

comments.comment:
Released by pzhan to master at 2019-04-02 09:54:57 (push 72229):
PACS-4-18-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-18-1-P3)
trunk (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-18-2-A3)

Relevant changesets in this release:
intelepacs:7a009255c5db pzhan PACS-4-18-1 IP-103464 fix: reduce blocking in CloseableListeningReactor.close(); enable dbintermediarieslib test cases
intelepacs:7aed1ea670e5 pzhan trunk IP-103464 fix: reduce blocking in CloseableListeningReactor.close(); enable dbintermediarieslib test cases

Simulate el6 environment:
1. download attached scripts - initcontainer, launchcontainer - to root of PACS code, for example ~/repos/trunk
2. launch the container by run "./launchcontainer"
3. now you are in el6 container, you can prefix your commands with xvfb-run, for example "xvfb-run scons". The command will run under el6.

Example:
[pzhan@pzhan trunk]$ ./launchcontainer
-2019-04-02 10:15:14- http://forge.intelerad.com/hg/docker-utils/raw-file/default/launchcontainer
Resolving forge.intelerad.com (forge.intelerad.com)... 10.90.129.8
Connecting to forge.intelerad.com (forge.intelerad.com)|10.90.129.8|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 Script output follows
Length: 2363 (2.3K) [application/binary]
Saving to: ‘/home/pzhan/repos/trunk/build/launchcontainer’

100%[=========================================================================================================================================================================>] 2,363 --.-K/s in 0s

2019-04-02 10:15:14 (202 MB/s) - ‘/home/pzhan/repos/trunk/build/launchcontainer’ saved [2363/2363]

creating group id 513 (pzhan_g) to match current user
creating user id 10671 (pzhan) to match current user
set /etc/localtime symlink to '/usr/share/zoneinfo/America/Toronto'
[pzhan@pzhan-ims-buildbot-el6-20180501-1 trunk]$ xvfb-run scons components/dbintermediarieslib/

The timeout is caused by com.intelerad.db.intermediaries.lib.http.CloseableListeningReactor.close() which is called 7 times in the test suit.
After this method being called, it should be allowed existing socket to complete IO and disallowed new socket open.
To achieve the goal, ServerSocketChannelImpl should be killed; this depends on the key to be de-registered from selector. De-registration should be done by a selector.select() call.
AbstractMultiworkerIOReactor has infinite loop to call selector.select(); to ensure select() is called before CloseableListeningReactor.close() exit, CloseableListeningReactor.close() has to call selector.selectNow() explicitly.
However, selector.select() has synchronized code on the selector. The results in selector.selectNow() from CloseableListeningReactor.close() having to waint indefinite time - could be couple of minutes - to get monitor of the selector.

Solution:
Instead of going to synchronized code, CloseableListeningReactor.close() can wait for the key being de-registered so that channel.close() can kill the channel.

fixed.
Since the code change is in library. Too many RPM could be involved. "RPM Upgrade List" could not be accurate.

item.title: [IP-103195] IOCM: a failure to send one series processing a study correction could cause IOCM to insert repetitive SCH requests for acknowledgment
item.description:
IOCM: processing of study corrections does that:

        // At this point, all series are present locally
        for ( String seriesUid : localSeriesUids )
        {
            mThreadMonitor.refreshCurThreadStatus();
            DicomTansferResult sendSeriesToArchive = mDicomCommunicator.sendSeriesToArchive( studyUid, seriesUid,  Duration.ofSeconds( mConfig.getThreadTimeToLiveSecs() )  );
            queueStorageCommitHandler( seriesUid, sendSeriesToArchive );
            
        }

I suggest having a loop to send and another to queue SCH.
item.summary: IOCM: a failure to send one series processing a study correction could cause IOCM to insert repetitive SCH requests for acknowledgment

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Story Description:
Business Value is clearly articulated.
Reduce the load on SCH
Details of the WHAT are sufficiently understood by the Team.
Dependencies are identified.
All enabling items are present.
AC: Functional Scope are defined
Don't queue up SCH events for activities that are failed
ⁿ/ₐ AC: Performance criteria are defined, if any.
Demo strategy. No demo
Documentation Flag

INVEST:
Independent
Negotiable
Valuable
Estimable
Small
Testable

Context:

Each time we try to send a series to the VNA, we queue up a SCH request for each series.
When one series fails, we start the process from the beginning and queue up again SCH requests that causes repetitive and useless inserts.

Changeset:

We wait for all the series to be sent, and only at that moment, we start queuing up SCH requests. Like this, if one series fails in the middle of sending, no useless or repetitive SCH requests are produced.

To Reproduce:

  1. Send a study to the VNA with a lot of series
  2. Make a correction in study
  3. While sending the series again for correction, make one series fails

Local Tests Performed:

I tested the case where we have a network problem while sending a correction to the VNA.

For QA:

It will be good if you test a case where there is a permanent rejection by the VNA on a specific series.
The behaviour should be:

  • the IocmAgent bypasses the rejected series without failing
  • the SCH request should not be inserted for that permanent rejected series because it has never been sent.

Branch name / Impacted App:

PACS-4-18-2-trunk-ambaye-sch-repete-req
App: IocmAgent

Review changeset

Code review ( code, Intelerad coding conventions )

  • See my comments in ReviewBoard

Code commit message ( Kallithea/Forge )

Verify Jira

Release notes
Canned response 'Dev: Resolve'
RPM Upgrade List
Fix versions
Release impact info

Others

Documentations ( If any )

Successfully reproduced the issue.

  • For the reproduction, sent a study with 1000 series & verified that all the series have reached the VNA.
  • Ensure that the DicomImage.StorageCommitQueue has all the 1000 rows associated with this.
  • Make a correction to the study and as soon as you see the StorageCommitQueue table being updated with the rows, kill the network connection .
  • Enable the network connection after a bit of time and observe the StorageCommitQueue table. You can notice that the rows which were inserted atfter the network connection got lost, are updated again leading to more rows.

Bug was not reproducible for the SERIES_SEND operation. Disabling network connection in the middle of the SCH being updated does not have repetitive SCH activity

Verified with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.18.2.P000-ims99.noarch, send_image-4.17.2.A195-ims01.i386

Env used : devX and QATOOLS

Verification steps:

Pre-requisite

  • Ensure you check the "Update SeriesLocation for this AE" for the Central AE in the satellite IB

Test1

  • Send a study ( 2000 series ) to the VNA & verify it reaches the VNA
  • Wait until the SCH is updated for all of those series --> DicomImage.StorageCommitQueue
  • Make a correction to the study
    • As soon as the STUDY_CORRECTION is processed as seen in the iocm_activity, the SCH is updated all together and not sequentially.
  • The SCH took into account the Correction count accurately.

Test 2

  • Send a study ( 2000 series ) to the VNA & verify it reaches the VNA
  • Wait until the SCH is updated for all of those series --> DicomImage.StorageCommitQueue
  • Trigger a study correction but have the study correction fail in the iocm_activity but not permanently.
  • Ensure that the SCH rows are not increasing or updated with the correction rows since the STUDY_CORRECT operation is not processed successfully yet.
  • Observe as the STUDY_CORRECT operation is retried and when it's retried and the result is successful, the SCH is updated.

Test 3

  • Send a series which is not accepted into the VNA as a permanent rejection.
  • Verify that the series is permanenty reject by checking in the iocmagent.iocm_activity 
    • activity_id |                        study_uid                        |                        series_uid                         | status |   operation   |        retry_after         | num_executions |                                                                                                                                            last_failure                                                                                                                                            |      timestamp_inserted       |       timestamp_updated       |      triggered_time       |  identifier  |              attributes               
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------+--------+---------------+----------------------------+----------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------+-------------------------------+---------------------------+--------------+---------------------------------------
        6784 | 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.915.1553718140.959047 | 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.30558.1553718087.913386 | FAILED | SERIES_SEND   | 2019-03-27 16:22:26.256-04 |              1 | FAILED: Unsupported service                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       +| 2019-03-27 16:22:26.257881-04 | 2019-03-27 16:22:26.668222-04 | 2019-03-27 16:22:21-04    | NULL         | {"isValid": true, "hasChanged": null}
             |                                                         |                                                           |        |               |                            |                | com.intelerad.iocmagent.IocmAgentException: Failed to send images from series path [/usr/local/PACS/images/20190327/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.915.1553718140.959047/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.30558.1553718087.913386-v/1] because routeImage returned a non-zero status code [-3]+|                               |                               |                           |              | 
             |                                                         |                                                           |        |               |                            |                |         at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.handleRouteImageResponse(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:677)                                                                                                                                                                      +|                               |                               |                           |              | 
             |                                                         |                                                           |        |               |                            |                |         at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.sendImagesFromPathToArchive(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:635)                                                                                                                                                                   +|                               |                               |                           |              | 
             |                                                         |                                                           |        |               |                            |                |         at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.sendSeriesToArchive(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:556)                                                                                                                                                                           +|                               |                               |                           |              | 
             |                                                         |                                                           |        |               |                            |                |         at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmProcessorDefault.processSeriesSending(IocmProcessorDefault.java:165)                                                                                                                                                                            +|                               |                               |                           |              |

(2 rows)
  • Verify that the StorageCommitQueue is not updated with the rows.
  • Trigger a requestCorrection
  • Verify again that the StorageCommitQueue is not updated with data related to the permanently rejected study

Test4

  • Trigger a normal SERIES_SEND and a STUDY_CORRECT operation and ensure that the StorageCommitQueue is updated

End result:
Tests passed. Assigning back to dev for commit.

item.title: [IP-102953] IocmAgent: Loading all SOPs in a Series causes OutOfMemory
item.description:
RPM Version

Found 1 RPM(s) out of sync with installed releases:
IocmAgent-4.15.1.P239-ims99 [ 15d] U!

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
++++++++++++++ PACS Release: PACS-4-15-1-R33 +++++++++++++++
++++++++++++++++ IV Release: IV-4-15-1-R11 +++++++++++++++++
+++++++++++++++++ Atlas Release: 1.13.P35 ++++++++++++++++++
++++++++++++++++ intelerad-cds-swl: 1.6.P7 +++++++++++++++++
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

ISP - Client : MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

IocmAgent becomes unstable. Can cause OutOfMemory errors across different threads.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Have a large study with lots of SOPS. Enable ProxySeriesLocation so that StorageCommitHandler is called by IocmAgent.

Expected behaviour:

IocmAgent is able to queue the all SOPS that have been sent into StorageCommitHandler.

What happened instead?:

IocmAgent runs out of memory while loading Sops to be queued into StorageCommitHandler.

item.summary: IocmAgent: Loading all SOPs in a Series causes OutOfMemory

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: A suggestion is to batch the loading and queuing into SCH.

This is one of the reasons why image was resend to VNA repeatedly .

we bumped the memory from 128 to 256Mb, so KB1190 is added 

 2583  2019-02-21 00:31:51 vim  /usr/local/tools/run_IocmAgent.sh

it seems we don't see this OOM so far

[admin@qhrbhdeppac01] {/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent} less ./filed_logs/run_IocmAgent.log.1.gz
....
Exception in thread "routeImage STDERR" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
Exception in thread "routeImage STDERR" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
Kill application 'IocmAgent' called at: Thu Feb 21 00:33:11 AEST 2019

    Killing IocmAgent pid 12705...
Run application 'IocmAgent' called at: Thu Feb 21 00:33:12 AEST 2019

Proposed solution 1

Instead of parsing the DicomObjects, we could read the Sop and SopClass UIDs from DicomImage.
Instead of querying DicomImage, invoke the new LocalDicomSearch streaming service.

Solution 2

Change SCH to receive only the series UID and do the look up itself
Pro: we will insert less rows.
Con: diskmon also checks this table and may need to be looked at.

Solution 3

Batch the parsing of the SOPs.

Description of the solution:

IocmAgent loads sops and storage commit in batches. The flag storageCommitBatchSize is added to IocmAgent.cfg with a default batch size of 100.

Tests executed:

  • Reduce memory for IocmAgent, around 9m.
  • Send sops in range of 500 and observe if IocmAgent is going out of memory.

Unit tests added or modified:

TestIocmProcessorDefault.testSendSeries_seriesPresentOnVna_newSops_proxyEnabled
TestIocmProcessorDefault.testSendSeries_seriesPresentOnVna_newSops_proxyEnabled_alternativeStorageCommitAe

Reproduced with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.14.1.P484-ims01.noarch

Verified with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.14.1.P484-ims99.noarch.rpm

Verification steps:

  • You can modify the run_IocmAgent.sh in the cdt to give it less memory to reproduce the issue or to test the fix
  • The default value of the storageCommitBatchSize is 100, confirm that in the IocmAgent config
  • Send a series with a lot of sops and observe when you get the Out of memory exception

Below are the tests which were done in a table format, we can compare how many sops gave a Out Of Memory error with and without the fix

Without fix

No. of Sops Batch Size Memory given for IocmAgent Out of memory triggered ?
700 NA 9Mb Y
500 NA 9Mb Y
400 NA 9Mb Y --> cutoff
300 NA 9Mb N
10,000 NA 128Mb N

With fix

No. of Sops Batch Size Memory given for IocmAgent Out of memory triggered ?
850 100 9Mb Y
750 100 / 500 9Mb Y --> cutoff
700 500 9Mb Y
700 100 9Mb N
500 100 9Mb N
10,000 500 128Mb N

So, the Out of Memory is getting triggered at the ~750 sops instead of ~400 sops before the fix, thereby, increasing the threshold for that. However, Out of Memory still happens when considerable amount of sops are sent.

No difference noticed in the performance of IocmAgent in the processing of the sops after the fix.

Not directly related to this bug, but note that an error happens if huge number of sops are given for the series leading to an IocmException. The bug has been documented in https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-103223

End result: Test passed

item.title: [IP-102927] IocmAgent: Image Resent when it failed to do "Signaling Storage Commitment Handler to wake up"
item.description:

Clinical Impact:

client is complaining many series are resend to their VNA repeatedly , daily
This is one of the reasons

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Have IocmAgent sending image to archive server for correction
During the sending, stop Storage Commitment handler

Expected behaviour:

IocmAgent doesn't resend image as it's completed already

IocmAgent resend image again

item.summary: IocmAgent: Image Resent when it failed to do "Signaling Storage Commitment Handler to wake up"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Muwei Li how many times this issue happened? now many series are resent by day?
the re-sending of series might be due to a more fundamental problem. and we should investigate here : MAINT-9259

Fortunately, it's not seen daily ,
see the recent SCH restarted logged by Ipmon 

[admin@qhrbhdeppac01] {/var/log/PACS/Ipmon} zgrep -h "StorageCommitmentHandler.*restarted"  filed_logs/runIpmonLocal.log*| sort -rk1,2

[2019-01-22 21:14:52.391 runIpmonLocal qhrbhdeppac01.local {9994}]   StorageCommitmentHandler: Timestamp expired - restarted

why SCH went down? See IP-102928

Bruno Da Silva

so far , we've listed 5 different reason/scenario which caused image resend to VNA, see CS0110462
let me know if u have other reasons. Thks.

Suggested Solutions:
Absorb the error and move on, SCH will wake up and process the database rows eventually.

Context:
IocmAgent tries to wake up storage commitment handler but fails because SCH is down. Instead of bypassing the error, IocmAgent keeps trying to perform the activity.

Changeset:
I catch the exception and mark the activity as done.
When SCH comes back, it will perform the operation.

To Reproduce:
I killed storage commitment handler and asked for a serie to be sent to the VNA.
Brian Leung Alioune Mbaye Would you add a draft of the release notes text (summary of the problem that the customer saw), please?
Done

Alioune Mbaye How about:
IocmAgent continues to repeatedly send images to the VNA despite receiving acknowledgement messages.

Perfect.
I updated the ticket
I did not know that I could use "IocmAgent" term.
These release notes are for PACS Admins ?
Yup. The intended audience is PACS admins.

Reproduced with RPMs: IocmAgent-4.17.2.A180-ims01.noarch.rpm
Verified with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.17.2.P000-ims99.noarch.rpm

Verification steps:

Pre-requisites

  • Setup Iocmagent env with VNA

Test1

  • Stop SCH
  • Send an image to the satellite
  • Observe the iocm_activity DB
  • Unlike before the fix, the activity is done even though the SCH is down 
    • activity_id |                         study_uid                         |                        series_uid                         | status |  operation  |        retry_after         | num_executions | last_fa
-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------+--------+-------------+----------------------------+----------------+--------
          21 | 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.28053.1552512891.312561 | 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.28053.1552512891.312560 | DONE   | SERIES_SEND | 2019-03-13 17:34:55.473-04 |              1 | PROCESS
  • Go to the IocmAgent logs and check for the below logs 
    • INSERT INTO StorageCommitQueue (Organization, SerInsUID, SOPInsUID, SopClassUid, AE_Title, InsertDateTime, LastModifiedDateTime, EventName, Status) VALUES ('IMSDEMO', '1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.2574.1552
513019.698904', '1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.346817280.2574.1552513019.698903', '1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2', 'QATOOLS', '2019-03-13 17:37:05.022', '2019-03-13 17:37:05.022', 'AttemptStorageCommitment', 0)
[2019-03-13 17:37:05.030 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Signaling Storage Commitment Handler to wake up
[2019-03-13 17:37:05.030 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Failed when waking up the Storage Commitment Handler
[2019-03-13 17:37:05.030 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Activity was sucessfully completed. Marking it as DONE.
[2019-03-13 17:37:05.035 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] releasing lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@7883d5[Locked by thread IocmActivityWorker_2]] for study [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.2574.1552513019.698905]
  • Now, run SCH and after it starts, it processes the pending series for storage commit.

Test 2

  • Send an image to the satellite
  • Ensure the image go to the VNA and the storage commit is successful
  • Stop the storage commit
  • Now do a request correction on the study
  • Unlike before, the STUDY_CORRECT operation does not keep retrying bcoz SCH is down.
  • Verify that the logs in the IocmAgent happen as below 
    • [2019-03-13 17:37:05.030 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Signaling Storage Commitment Handler to wake up
[2019-03-13 17:37:05.030 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Failed when waking up the Storage Commitment Handler
[2019-03-13 17:37:05.030 IOCM_WORKER_2 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Activity was sucessfully completed. Marking it as DONE.
  • After running SCH again, it should be able to resume its operations and work on the pending storage commit tasks.

End result: Tests passed.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: IocmAgent continues to repeatedly send images to the VNA despite receiving acknowledgement messages.

RPM Version

ISP - Client : xxxx - <client code>

Clinical Impact:

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Expected behaviour:

What happened instead?:

item.title: [IP-97648] IOCM: sendSeriesToArchive should un-reserve series on LDS and the reservation time-out should be de same used to send images
item.description:
While trying to send images IOCM should make the timeout to send images the same as the LDS reservation and it should also un-reserve the reservations as soon as it finishes send the images.

Also IOCM leaves the routeImage process orphan if or when iocm get's killed. the timeout implemented now on IOCM uses thread monitor that kills IOCM leaving routeimage process running.
item.summary: IOCM: sendSeriesToArchive should un-reserve series on LDS and the reservation time-out should be de same used to send images

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
more information :

com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl --> sendSeriesToArchive
I also recommend adding metrics around the time spent to send images to the VNA as part of this fix.

I suggest this way to run routeimage iocm agent needs to control the timeout and kill the routeimage subprocess if needed.
also it needs to extend the path reservation on LDS 

package test;

import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;

public class testCommandWait
{
    static String bashWait= "for i in {1..30}; do sleep 1; echo 'running2' >> /tmp/running.txt ; done";
    public static void main( String[] args ) throws IOException, InterruptedException
    {
        Process exec = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(new String[] { "/bin/bash" , "-c",bashWait });
        for ( int i = 0 ; i < 5; i++)
        {
        exec.waitFor(1,TimeUnit.SECONDS);
        System.out.println("1 sec");
        }
        if ( exec.isAlive() )
        {
        System.out.println(" time out kill!!");
        exec.destroyForcibly();
        }        
        
        System.out.println(exec.exitValue());
    }

}

the way it does now 

        DebugUtilities.printTrace( "Invoked routeImage with process pid: %d", getProcessPid( shellProcess ) );
        
        int exitStatus = shellProcess.waitFor();
       
        if ( exitStatus != 0 )
        {
            throw new IocmAgentException( "Failed to send images from series path [" + seriesPath + "]" +
                                          " because routeImage returned a non-zero status code" +
                                          " [" + Integer.toString( exitStatus ) + "]" );
        }

also.. if iocm agent gets killed it will leave all routeImage processes running.
so it needs to keep track of all running routeImage and call a destroyForcibly in all before the exiting.

New metrics:

# HELP ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_duration_seconds iocm send series operation to archive duration seconds
# TYPE ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_duration_seconds summary
ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_duration_seconds{quantile="0.5",app_version="PACS-development",} 60.0
ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_duration_seconds{quantile="0.95",app_version="PACS-development",} 60.001
ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_duration_seconds_count{app_version="PACS-development",} 9.0
ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_duration_seconds_sum{app_version="PACS-development",} 540.014
# HELP ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_total # series send operations to archive total
# TYPE ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_total counter
ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_total{outcome="failure",app_version="PACS-development",} 9.0
ims_iocm_send_series_operation_to_archive_total{outcome="timeout",app_version="PACS-development",} 9.0

Summary of changes:

IOCM agent uses threadMaxTimeToLiveSeconds to timeout the call of routeImage.
IOCM agent extends and unreserve the LDS reservation.
When IOCM process exits it kills all routeImage subprocesses.
new metrics to tell how long is taking to routeImage.
how many routeImage invocations with success and failure, and how many times routeImage was killed by timeout.

Tests executed:
Using com.intelerad.integrationtesting.iocm.TestIocmSingleServer, and the script to cause trafic restrictions.
I was able to cause IOCM to kill routeImage due to timeout. and kill all routeImage after the IOCM process was killed.

I was able to reproduce using the limit.sh script and a series with 1000 images. I killed IocmAgent, but I still see 2 routeImage calls in flight.

[admin@mst1] {/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent} kill_IocmAgent.sh 

    Killing IocmAgent pid 24561...
[admin@mst1] {/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent} ps waux | grep routeImage| grep -v grep | wc -l
2

I installed the fix. I see that there are 4 routeImage calls in flight. I kill IocmAgent, and I see the routeImage calls get terminated along with IocmAgent

[admin@mst1] {~} ps waux | grep routeImage | grep -v grep | wc -l
4
[admin@mst1] {~} kill_IocmAgent.sh 

    Killing IocmAgent pid 28893...

[admin@mst1] {~} ps waux | grep routeImage | grep -v grep | wc -l
0
I was able to reproduce the bug, but once the fix was applied I see that routeImage gets terminated when IocmAgent gets terminated. Testing is done and issue is ready to be committed.

Testing the code path where a timeout kills routeImage. I limited the number of threads to 1, and set the timeout to 60s, and then sent 3 studies where the series has 1000 images. I see that routeImage gets killed because of the timeout

[2019-02-21 16:31:02.733 IOCM_WORKER_0 mst1.intelerad.com] 
*************************
ERROR: RouteImage will be killed due to timeout process pid [8177]
*************************

I see the following reservation in the DB

item.title: [IP-97424] IOCM: add StorageCommitQueue table lock before any updates or inserts
item.description:
IocmAgent does not follow the proper protocol.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • add StorageCommitQueue table lock before any updates or inserts
item.summary: IOCM: add StorageCommitQueue table lock before any updates or inserts

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
[admin@qhrbhdeppac01]

{/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent}

rpm -qa | grep -i iocm
Database-IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.noarch
IocmAgent-4.15.1.P235-ims99.noarch
comment removed.
the fix should use : UPDATE StorageCommitQueue SET TransactionUid = TransactionUid WHERE 1 = 2 to perform any inserts into StorageCommitQueue.

Extract of logs with new table locking :

[2019-01-29 14:22:33.964 IOCM_WORKER_9 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] DicomImageInterface: insertStorageCommitmentRequest Executing: UPDATE StorageCommitQueue SET TransactionUid = TransactionUid WHERE 1 = 2
INSERT INTO StorageCommitQueue (Organization, SerInsUID, SOPInsUID, SopClassUid, AE_Title, InsertDateTime, LastModifiedDateTime, EventName, Status) VALUES ('IMSDEMO', '2.25.256831532639629048780344590620478494867', '2.25.171896840242304372934587378220489440956', '1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.6.1', 'ODARCHIVE', '2019-01-29 14:22:33.964', '2019-01-29 14:22:33.964', 'AttemptStorageCommitment', 0)
[2019-01-29 14:22:33.967 IOCM_WORKER_9 mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Signaling Storage Commitment Handler to wake up
So change of plan. the dev rpm on mnhhs was build on top of 4-15-1 tip. so I will generate a iocm agent rpm on the tip to avoid any regression.

Tara Martyres Mark Groves

I have finished my end-to-end testing and we can release this bug.

Bruno brought up a good point in that our end-to-end test blocks the whole table, but the original issue is that multiple IocmAgent workers are able to write to the table concurrently, and would eventually lead to deadlocking. What he suggested instead to replicate this behaviour is to try to perform an insert in a transaction and then send an image.

I performed the INSERT

{sqsh}.rdc@QA4151MOD2.DicomImage.1> begin tran lockWhatever
{sqsh}.rdc@QA4151MOD2.DicomImage.2> go
{sqsh}.rdc@QA4151MOD2.DicomImage.1> insert into StorageCommitQueue (TransactionUid,SerInsUID,SOPInsUID,SopClassUid,AE_Title,InsertDateTime,LastModifiedDateTime,EventName,Status,Organization) values ('TransactionUid','SerInsUID','SOPInsUID','SopClassUid','AE_Title',getdate(),getdate(),'EventName',6,'Org')                                                                           
{sqsh}.rdc@QA4151MOD2.DicomImage.2> go
(1 row affected)

I sent some images, and I see that the unfixed code is able to update DicomMaster with the location (the QA4161MOD1 entry denotes the 'VNA')

[admin@qa4151mod2] {~/CT} listLocsforStudy.pl -s 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.1510635650.3180.1548865065.801807

item.title: [IP-97386] IocmAgent: Worker Thread timeout not configurable
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client : MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

MAJOR - Images are either slow to or repeatedly send to the VNA

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Have a series send to the VNA that takes longer than 1200 seconds (20 minutes) to complete

Expected behaviour:

The timeout is configurable to handle slow send speeds.

What happened instead?:

The timeout is not configurable so Ipmon restarts IocmAgent when a SERIES_SEND takes longer than 20 minutes, due to it thinking the thread has hung.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Worker Thread timeout not configurable

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
From Notify.log

===============================================================================
2019-01-11 07:24:11.809  qhrbhdeppac01.local                          IocmAgent
Notification Id: THREAD_MONITOR_1
Type           : INTERNAL
Severity       : MAJOR
Description    : Thread [IocmActivityWorker_39] has exceeded the specified timeout of [1200] seconds. Please check the thread specific log file for the reason.
===============================================================================
2019-01-11 07:26:58.954  qhrbhdeppac01.local                          IocmAgent
Notification Id: DEFAULT_NOTIFICATION_ID
Type           : INFORMATION
Severity       : MESSAGE
Description    : Application exiting.
===============================================================================
2019-01-11 07:26:59.973  qhrbhdeppac01.local                      check_process
Log Id         : INFORMATION
Severity       : MAJOR
Description    : IocmAgent killed using /usr/local/tools/kill_IocmAgent.sh (Timestamp expired)
NotificationId : IPMON_1
===============================================================================
2019-01-11 07:27:00.500  qhrbhdeppac01.local                          IocmAgent
Notification Id: 
Type           : INFORMATION
Severity       : MESSAGE
Description    : IocmAgent coming up...
===============================================================================

Worker thread log shows it was sending this series and hadn't completed

[2019-01-11 07:00:47.563 IOCM_WORKER_39 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Calling routeImage for series path [/usr/local/PACS/images/dev16/20190107/1.2.840.114202.4.779661574.1470654393.1728733576.2626324062/1.3.12.2
.1107.5.1.4.11016.30000019010700120063800024533-v/1]
[2019-01-11 07:00:47.802 IOCM_WORKER_39 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] About to invoke routeImage using: CommandLauncher[ '/usr/local/tools/routeImage' '-a' 'QHRBHDEPPAC01' '-c' 'QHMNRADPACSIN' '/usr/local/PACS/im
ages/dev16/20190107/1.2.840.114202.4.779661574.1470654393.1728733576.2626324062/1.3.12.2.1107.5.1.4.11016.30000019010700120063800024533-v/1/1.3.12.2.1107.5.1.4.11016.30000019010700120063800026294.dcm
...
[2019-01-11 07:27:10.257 IOCM_WORKER_39 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmActivityWorker_39' started
Tara Martyres - MAINT created as requested.
Added to the Rapid Response team board

The timeout is already configurable in IocmAgent.cfg as 

threadMaxTimeToLiveSeconds                       = 500

It is odd that even with this set to 500 that IocmAgent starts up with the wrong configuration value.

manageIocm.log.20190201_011544.log:[2019-02-01 01:14:58.885 CLT qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Thread Monitor Started.  Thread to live time: 1200  Thread monitor period: 600

Context:

  • ThreadMonitor was marking a thread as hung after 1200 seconds instead of what was being configured in IocmAgent.cfg. 
    threadMonitoringPeriodSeconds                    = 500
threadMaxTimeToLiveSeconds                       = 500

[2019-01-22 13:35:14.173 IOCM qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Thread Monitor Started.  Thread to live time: 1200  Thread monitor period: 600

Changeset:

  • In this case, the code in IocmAgentConfiguration which read those configuration fields were not being called due to a mismatch in method name. The configurations were then being pulled from AbstractControlData which is configured to: 
    getMonitoringPeriodSecs() = 600;
getThreadTimeToLiveSecs() = DEFAULT_MONITORING_PERIOD_SECS * 2;

To Reproduce:

  • set the threadMonitoringPeriodSeconds and threadMaxTimeToLiveSeconds to any value. If you restart IocmAgent, you will see that the thread monitor will keep using 1200 amd 600 when initializing the ThreadMonitor. 
    [2019-01-22 13:35:14.173 IOCM qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Thread Monitor Started.  Thread to live time: 1200  Thread monitor period: 600
  • If your thread takes longer than 1200 seconds, ThreadMonitor will notify like above.

Local Tests Performed:

  • Setup IocmAgent
  • Set the threadMonitoringPeriodSeconds and threadMaxTimeToLiveSeconds to 1 and 2.
  • Checked that IocmAgent, during startup, initializes the ThreadMonitor, to the right values. 
    [2019-02-01 14:52:20.719 IOCM mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread Monitor Started.  Thread to live time: 1  Thread monitor period: 2
  • To get the IocmAgent to stall, i overwrote routeImage to simply sleep for 10 seconds.
  • Send an image.
  • Notify.log should show that the Thread has timed out. 
    ===============================================================================
2019-02-01 14:39:52.902  mst1.intelerad.com                           IocmAgent
Notification Id: THREAD_MONITOR_1
Type           : INTERNAL
Severity       : MAJOR
Description    : Thread [IocmActivityWorker_8] has exceeded the specified timeout of [1] seconds. Please check the thread specific log file for the reason.
===============================================================================

For QA:
Does this issue need to be in the release notes?

I figured out how to limit the bandwidth so that the image send would trigger the timeout

tc qdisc add dev eth0 root handle 1: htb default 10
tc class add dev eth0 parent 1: classid 1:1 htb rate 10000mbps ceil 15000mbps
tc class add dev eth0 parent 1:1 classid 1:10 htb rate 5000mbps ceil 7500mbps
tc class add dev eth0 parent 1:1 classid 1:11 htb rate 1kbps ceil 2kbps
tc filter add dev eth0 protocol ip parent 1:0 prio 1 u32 match ip src 10.90.130.70 flowid 1:11

To clear the traffic shaping you run

tc qdisc del dev eth0 root

I tested it with a 1000 image series using straight routeImage, and it took 25 minutes

[admin@qa4151mod2] {/usr/local/PACS/images/20190201/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.1510634370.12693.1549039335.450190/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.1510634370.12693.1549039335.450191} time routeImage -a QA4151MOD2 -c QA4161MOD1 *.dcm
[...]
[2019-02-05 17:04:16.259 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE) {653}] (handleSendImagesResults) Successfully sent SOP class [1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2] SOP [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.1510634370.12720.1549039340.712522] (1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.1510634370.12720.1549039340.712522.dcm)

real    25m4.361s
user    0m32.828s
sys     0m2.798s

I will try using IocmAgent next.
Maximiano Francisco George Laza Does this issue need to be in the release notes?

Hi Kathleen Jette.
This might be important for MNHHS as they've been struggling with these IOCM issues.

This bug fixes the issue where IocmAgent does not obey configured timeouts causing large series to timeout while sending to a VNA.

Added the traffic shaper script I am using.

Running the clean test to reproduce what was found in the field

2019-02-06 11:45:09.519  qa4151mod2.intelerad.com                     IocmAgent
Notification Id: THREAD_MONITOR_1
Type           : INTERNAL
Severity       : MAJOR
Description    : Thread [IocmActivityWorker_9] has exceeded the specified timeout of [1200] seconds. Please check the thread specific log file for the reason.

I will apply the rpm and retest.
Maximiano Francisco George Laza Does this issue need to be in the release notes?

Hi Kathleen Jette,

I posted above.
Brian Leung Ah, yes. Thanks!

I applied the rpm, and upon restart we see that IocmAgent is now using the configured value:

[2019-02-07 14:07:24.249 IOCM mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread Monitor Started.  Thread to live time: 500  Thread monitor period: 500

And we see that it times out at the configured 500s

Description    : Thread [IocmActivityWorker_8] has exceeded the specified timeout of [500] seconds. Please check the thread specific log file for the reason.

I changed the settings to:

threadMonitoringPeriodSeconds                    = 250
threadMaxTimeToLiveSeconds                       = 100

I see the change reflected in the logs

Description    : Thread [IocmActivityWorker_8] has exceeded the specified timeout of [100] seconds. Please check the thread specific log file for the reason.
I can confirm that the configuration change is reflected in the timeout. This is ready for release.

item.title: [IP-97237] IocmAgent: Series is sent to VNA when it is not routed to the IocmAgent host and the study does not have a VNA location
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client - MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

HIGH - Images are sent to VNA when they were not intended to be.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Send a study to an IntelePACS server that does not host IocmAgent and that AutoRoutes the study to a VNA using an aliased AE. Have the study automatically validate.

Expected behaviour:

IocmAgent does not send the study to the VNA.

What happened instead?:

IocmAgent sends the study to the VNA when LDS syncs the validation correction and finds the StudyUID on the VNA after issuing a C-FIND
item.summary: IocmAgent: Series is sent to VNA when it is not routed to the IocmAgent host and the study does not have a VNA location

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Environment

IocmAgent running on qa4151mod2
IocmAgent configured with VNA AE of QA4161MST1
AutoRoute rule that routes studies from qa415mod1 to VNA using an aliased AE QA4161MST1A

Procedure

Send study to a server that doesn't host IocmAgent

[admin@qa4151mod2] {~} listLocsforStudy.pl -a 2019B0008038-CR

Study is sent to the aliased VNA AE via AutoRoute

[2019-01-15 03:23:05.703 AUTOROUTE qa4151mod1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {8048}] (LocalDicomSeriesRequestsService::applyPendingCorrections) Deserialization complete.  versionedSeriesPath=[/usr/local/PACS/images/20190115/1.2.840.114202.4.1473007339.790699947.2602446369.3630674181/1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.49.21030.2.201901151719210390]
[2019-01-15 03:23:05.704 AUTOROUTE qa4151mod1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {8048}] (AutoRouteWorker::sendImages)  Calling send_images with destination [QA4161MST1A]
[2019-01-15 03:23:05.704 AUTOROUTE qa4151mod1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {8048}] (send_images) Attempting to process file [/usr/local/PACS/images/20190115/1.2.840.114202.4.1473007339.790699947.2602446369.3630674181/1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.49.21030.2.201901151719210390-v/1/1.3.12.2.1107.5.3.49.21030.11.201901151719210390.dcm]

LDS syncs the validation correction and inserts the following rows in iocm_activity

(cmdline@qa4151mod2) [iocmagent] > select * from iocm_activity where study_uid='1.2.840.114202.4.1473007339.790699947.2602446369.3630674181';

Iocm_Worker thread issues a C-FIND to the VNA and the study is found.

[2019-01-15 03:23:11.856 IOCM_WORKER_0 qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Working on [IocmActivity 1452

The result is that the images are send to the VNA via IocmAgent when they weren't intended to be. Additionally there are now two VNA locations

Tara Martyres George Laza High priority bug logged for MNHHS as requested.

IocmAgent performs a C-FIND after it failed to find the location in DMS. Since we are using an alias AE title, the VNA responds positively and the IocmAgent considers this study on the VNA, and thus updates it.

Description of the solution

Added a configuration key in MpiDicomDomains.cfg to control:

  1. Whether IocmAgent performs a C-FIND when looking for the VNA location
  2. Whether IocmAgent queues up a straight UMDB update instead of a storage commitment request.

Changeset

MpiDicomDomain documentation:

#     updateLocationDirectly
#         When true,  this boolean option disables the storage commitment feature and forces the IocmAgent
#                     to inform the UMDB directly about the new series location.
#         When false, the IocmAgent reads the ProxySeriesLocation flag in the VNA's AE title and sends a
#                     storage commitment request if it is true.
#         Logic:      Send storage commit = ( UpdateLocationDirectly == false && VnaAeTitle.ProxySeriesLocation == true )
#         Default: false
#
#     cfindVnaForLocation
#         When true,  the IocmAgent attemps to determine if the study or series has already been sent to the VNA,
#                     it first checks DMS Locations. If not found, then it performs a C-FIND to the VNA.
#         When false, only the DMS Location check is done and no C-FIND will be sent to the VNA.
#         Default:    true
#

Tests executed

Toggled the config keys and observed the application initialize properly.
No images were sent during this test.

    20090716         39968.000000 ACCADIL30691                                     006626441344170  1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.1510634370.29321.1547764533.340345      
	^ROMAN^DWIGHT^CLYDE                                              ABDOMEN                                                          078Y                                              100          100
	   20190117         63346.335938 QA4151MOD1       ADIL3227024898                                                   CT        ADIL23471                                                       
	                                                                                                                                 IMS          NULL                   1                                5
	                                 PACS-4-15-1-P234                

(1 row affected)
  • Verify that all the Studies have been AutoRouted to the alias AE
  • Verify the total count of the study_uid is 100 in iocm_activity 
    • (cmdline@qa4151mod2) [iocmagent] > select count(*) from iocm_activity where study_uid='1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.1510634370.29321.1547764533.340345';
 count 
-------
    96
(1 row)

it showed only 96 rows instead of 100, don't know what happened to the other 4
--> the Above is expected since sometimes LDS takes multiple corrections in a batch if there are multiple and hence, there's not exactl amount of records for STUDY_CORRECT and always a bit less.

Note that the logs in StorageComittmentHandler only show processing on the storagecommit when the cfindVnaForLocation is set to true regardless of the updateLocationDirectly.
Had a discussion with George & this is expected behavior

End Result : All tests pass.

item.title: [IP-97236] IocmAgent: Series that get rejected with a permanent failure get retried
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.src.rpm

ISP - Client : MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

These resends contribute to the churn of the application that continuoslly reprocesses activities what will never succeed. It is wasting CPU cycles and network bandwidth.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

  1. Configure the VNA not to accept a particular transfer syntax/SOP class
  2. Send a study to the PACS that includes the rejected presentation context
  3. IocmAgent forwards it to the VNA

Acceptance Criteria:

  • IocmAgent should detect the permanent rejections from VNA and never retry to send
  • In case of a study correction, skip the failing series and update others
  • Add notification for permanent failures

Following is the error:

Failed to send series [1.2.840.114202.2.20180309080035803.540380041] to archive                                                               
com.intelerad.iocmagent.IocmAgentException: Failed to send series [1.2.840.114202.2.20180309080035803.540380041] to archive                   
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.sendSeriesToArchive(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:537)                       
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmProcessorDefault.processSeriesSending(IocmProcessorDefault.java:148)                        
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:154)                                                            
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:38)                                                             
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)                                                                           
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)                                                    
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)                                                    
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.runCommand(LoggingThreadFactory.java:134)                                  
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.access$000(LoggingThreadFactory.java:19)                                   
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory$2.run(LoggingThreadFactory.java:98)                                        
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)                                                                                              
Caused by: com.intelerad.iocmagent.IocmAgentException: Failed to send images from series path [/usr/local/PACS/images/dev5/20180801/1.2.392.20
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.sendImagesFromPathToArchive(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:596)               
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.sendSeriesToArchive(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:525)                       
        ... 10 more

What happened instead?:

It continuously postpones the activity and retries later.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Series that get rejected with a permanent failure get retried

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
One idea is to return a specific error code from routeImage for different rejections.
Then IocmAgent would detect the fatal error and stop retrying.
Does this issue need to be in the release notes?

Speaking with George and Aswin. Our idea here is to return more error states from routeImage to IocmAgent so that we can catch more conditions.

For this particular case we would catch the fact that the Presentation Context was rejected, and mark the request as FAILED. The request would then stop being processed, and will not get retried.

The issue we see with this solution is the case when we fail to re-generate PXLs from the J2C. This will require some investigation to see what error is returned by routeImage.

The other issue we see with this solution is that IocmAgent will stop retrying this series once we make the fix, but diskmon will reinsert the image into the AutoRoute queue because it does not satisfy ArchivePolicy. I will check with DIT to see if the ArchivePolicy can be extended to filter out LJPGs. If not we will need to open a new bug to support this kind of filtering, or the other option is to make sure that Lossy JPEG images never make it onto the IocmAgent server. If the Lossy JPEG does not exist on the IocmAgent server then it will not be sent to the VNA. We will need to check with the client to see if this workaround would be acceptable.

I spoke with John Tournas, and asked him if there was currently a way to filter out Lossy JPEGs. He said there was no way to do this currently, and we only support Org level filtering. He did mention IP-80140 where Option 2 suggests adding filtering on SourceAE.

I think this may be a great solution. We could filter out CD Imports, which seem to be the source of our Lossy JPEGs.

Hi R&D,

Regarding Lossy JPEG images, MNHHS plans to change their image flow so that we no longer receive them. It has not been implemented yet, and I am following up on the image flow change.

Thanks,
Honey

Aswin Gangadharan Thanks for adding the release notes text! I have a question, though. What was the problem that the customer saw? Was it a performance issue? Or were they seeing the same errors repeatedly?

Kathleen Jette Yes this is more of a performance issue, in case of MNHHS they are seeing this series failing to get sent to VNA (which is actually supposed to fail). But we should be catching it in the first place and then stop retrying and client won't see such errors.

OK, so how about this:
A series that is rejected from a VNA because it contains unsupported formats is being resent to the VNA repeatedly.

Use case: mixed study correct

  1. Create a study with 2 series
    1. Series 1 with a SOP that is not accepted by the VNA
    2. Series 2 with SOPs that are.
  2. Send the study to the PACS
    1. IocmAgent will receive 2 SEND_SERIES activities.
    2. Series 1 will Permanently fail
    3. Series 2 will successfully send
  3. Correct the study
    1. IocmAgent will receive one STUDY_CORRECT activity
    2. If Series 1 is sent fist, the activity will be marked as permanently failed and Series 2 will never be sent.

This use case will cause all series of the studies to not be updated just because one of them fails.

Use case: skipped good series send

  1. Create a study with 2 series
    1. Series 1 with a SOP that is not accepted by the VNA
    2. Series 2 with SOPs that are.
  2. Turn off IocmAgent
  3. Send the study to the PACS
  4. Correct the study
  5. Turn on IocmAgent
    1. IocmAgent will receive 2 SEND_SERIES activities and one STUDY_CORRECT activity
    2. Both Series sends will be skipped because the study will be corrected later
    3. During the sending based on the correction, series 1 fails permanently and series 2 was never attempted and is never sent to the VNA.
It's decided that for study correction, the failing series will be skipped in case of a permanent rejection from VNA and other series will be updated.

Description of the solution:

  • IocmAgent catches all error code returned by routeImage and the ones defined as permanent rejections are marked FAILED and will never be retried. For all other codes the iocm activities will be marked PENDING and will be retried.
  • Notifications are added to IocmAgent for permanent rejection failures.

Tests executed:

Tests performed to reproduce the issue and the above mentioned use cases.

Unit tests added or modified:

None.

IocmAgent considers the following routeImage exit codes as permanent VNA rejection:

  • SI_ERROR_1 = -1
  • SI_ERROR_2 = -2
  • SI_SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED = -3
  • SI_NO_FIND_FILENAME_FROM_SOP = -4
  • SI_DATABASE_MISMATCH = -5
  • SI_PARSE_ERROR = -6
  • SI_AETITLE_NOTFOUND = -7
  • SI_DUPLICATE_SOP_INSTANCE = -8
  • SI_DATA_CORRUPTION = -9
  • SI_CANNOT_UNDERSTAND = -10
Attached 4-15-1 rpms for Adil to test on 4-15-1 QA servers

Verified with RPMs:
IocmAgent-4.15.1.P241-ims99.noarch,
Database-IocmAgent-4.15.1.P241-ims99.noarch,
send_image-4.15.1.P241-ims99.i386

Description

  • Tests were done to verify that the scenarios which are supposed to fail permanently do fail permanently and are not retried.
  • The following scenarios were tested for this ticket
    • SI_SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED = -3
    • SI_DATABASE_MISMATCH = -5
    • SI_AETITLE_NOTFOUND = -7
    • SI_DUPLICATE_SOP_INSTANCE = -8
  • The following types of errors were not tested for being permanently rejected since it was too time consuming to try to find out how to reproduce the following scenarios. Eventually, it was not considered worth it to test the following coz more probably of them getting rejected due to the code structure and low risk in case it doesn't get permanently rejected.
    • SI_ERROR_1 = -1
    • SI_ERROR_2 = -2
    • SI_NO_FIND_FILENAME_FROM_SOP = -4
    • SI_PARSE_ERROR = -6
    • SI_DATA_CORRUPTION = -9
    • SI_CANNOT_UNDERSTAND = -10

Verification steps:

  • For each of the types of errors that should give a permanent failure, do the tests to reproduce that error. 
    ** i.e for SI_SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED = -3, send a study to IocmAgentHost with the SOPClassUID being EnhancedMRImageStorage & changing the acceptEnhancedMRSopClass  = true. The VNA rejects the image leading to a  SI_SERVICE_NOT_SUPPORTED = -3 error
** for SI_DATABASE_MISMATCH = -5, have a series in the VNA and attempt to send a study to the VNA having multiple series & 1 of those series being the one which is already present in the VNA
** for SI_AETITLE_NOTFOUND = -7, remove the AE title of the IocmAgent host from the VNA
** for SI_DUPLICATE_SOP_INSTANCE = -8, have a sop in the VNA and attempt to send a series to the VNA having multiple sops and 1 of those sops being the one which already exists in the VNA

Note that the return codes that are specified with the scenarios are not supposed to be accurate. For eg, SI_DUPLICATE_SOP_INSTANCE which is supposed to return a -8 as error code returns -5 & SI_AETITLE_NOTFOUND returns a -3 error code instead of -7. But, the behavior being correct, the error code have not been given that much importance, so tests pass with respect to functionality.

End result: Tests passed.

item.title: [IP-97235] IocmAgent: retries to delete a study (or a series) that no longer exists on the VNA
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.src.rpm

ISP - Client : MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

These deletions contribute to the churn of the application that continuoslly reprocesses activities what will never succeed. It is wasting CPU cycles and network bandwidth.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

  1. Send a study to the PACS
  2. IocmAgent forwards it to the VNA
  3. Delete the study from the VNA
  4. Delete the study from the PACS

Expected behaviour:

IocmAgent should not try repeatedly to delete this study forever.

Following is the error:

Couldn't find the study [1.2.124.113532.6313.1384.9258.20180314.153244.16676258] on the VNA                                                  
com.intelerad.lib.vnaclient.DicomClientException: Couldn't find the study [1.2.124.113532.6313.1384.9258.20180314.153244.16676258] on the VNA
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmProcessorDefault.processStudyDeletion(IocmProcessorDefault.java:254)                       
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:164)                                                           
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:38)                                                            
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)                                                                          
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)                                                   
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)                                                   
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.runCommand(LoggingThreadFactory.java:134)                                 
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.access$000(LoggingThreadFactory.java:19)                                  
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory$2.run(LoggingThreadFactory.java:98)                                       
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

What happened instead?:

It continuously postpones the activity and retries later.
item.summary: IocmAgent: retries to delete a study (or a series) that no longer exists on the VNA

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Proposed solutions

  1. Configure a number of retries and after this threshold, consider not finding the study on the VNA a success and move on.

The reason is that the VNA may have an ingestion delay and there could be 30s before a study is available to C-FIND.

At MNHHS, there still 2 such failing rows

set it to failed to stop being process, 

[admin@qhrbhdeppac01] {/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent} psql-intelerad -D iocmagent -xc "update iocmagent.iocm_activity set status='FAILED' where last_failure ~ 't find the study' and status != 'FAILED'; "
UPDATE 2

In the solution, after discussion with George Laza and Maximiano Francisco we finally added :

  • the serie deletion in the scope
  • the way we are calculating the delay for all activities type before attempting to retry from a failure:
    • ( 1 + numberOfExec ) * vnaErrorDelay TO ( ( 1 + numberOfExec ) power 2 ) * vnaErrorDelay
Does this issue need to be in the release notes?

yes It does, I flagged it as required
I will write it during resolution

Alioune Mbaye Thank you for setting the flag, but I made a change. If the issue should be in the release notes, please set the Release Notes drop down to Required not the *Documentation *drop down. The Documentation drop down is used for changes to the user guides and admin guides.

Context:
When a study got deleted from the VNA before the PACS, IocmAgent keep trying to delete it indefinitely.

Solution:
After three unsuccessful attempts to delete it, the iocm activity is flagged done and skipped.

To Reproduce:
Same as in the description.

For QA:
I recommend to check if the calculated time delay between failure is not longer linear but exponential.

I set up a VM with an Iocm integration to qa-tools. I sent an image to the VM, and I see that the location gets registered

Hi,
To reproduce it, you need to have DMS returning the location pointing to the VNA for the study, like this for example:
DMS returned [[MST1, QATOOLS]] as location for study [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.10874.1550072435.294529]

In the test case where you failed to reproduce it, we have :
DMS returned [[]] as location for study [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.31240.1550074708.169253]

Because, in the code, when DMS does not have the location in the VNA, we do not try a "useless" CFIND and we mark it as done immediately, assuming that it has already been deleted before.

Based on what Alioune found my suspicion is right. When we use requestDeletion we follow a different code path, because DCD will delete the study first and then IocmAgent will try to delete the study from the VNA.

I think we may be able to reproduce this condition by using SeriesEditor according to
IOCM Support at Intelerad

Description of the solution:
