customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The network and the worker CPU are overloading due to the IocmAgent continuously attempting to delete a series or study that is no longer available in the VNA.

RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.src.rpm

ISP - Client : MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

These deletions contribute to the churn of the application that continuoslly reprocesses activities what will never succeed. It is wasting CPU cycles and network bandwidth.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

  1. Send a study to the PACS
  2. IocmAgent forwards it to the VNA
  3. Delete the study from the VNA
  4. Delete the study from the PACS

Expected behaviour:

IocmAgent should not try repeatedly to delete this study forever.

Following is the error:

Couldn't find the study [1.2.124.113532.6313.1384.9258.20180314.153244.16676258] on the VNA                                                  
com.intelerad.lib.vnaclient.DicomClientException: Couldn't find the study [1.2.124.113532.6313.1384.9258.20180314.153244.16676258] on the VNA
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmProcessorDefault.processStudyDeletion(IocmProcessorDefault.java:254)                       
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:164)                                                           
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:38)                                                            
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)                                                                          
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)                                                   
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)                                                   
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.runCommand(LoggingThreadFactory.java:134)                                 
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.access$000(LoggingThreadFactory.java:19)                                  
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory$2.run(LoggingThreadFactory.java:98)                                       
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

What happened instead?:

It continuously postpones the activity and retries later.

item.title: [IP-97155] IocmAgent: slow query from Ipmon plugin check_queue_iocm_activity_age
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client : CS0100783 - MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

one of the reasons contributes to the performance issue found on site:
Big backlog is seen in IocmAgent activity queue
Images not being sent to the VNA in a timely manner

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Run plugin check_queue_iocm_activity_age, and check pg log for the query duration,

Expected behaviour:

should be quick

What happened instead?:

kind of slow on big and bloated table

The plug in does this query 

[2019-01-11 00:10:51.082 AEST] 10.225.99.118(39468) {5c375266.3a16} iocmagent LOG:  duration: 4584.026 ms  execute <unnamed>: select extract (epoch from now() - ( select min(timestamp_inserted)  from iocm_activity where status = 'PENDING' ))::int / ( 60 * 60 )

run explain 

(sa@qhrbhdeppac01) [iocmagent] # explain(analyze,buffers) select min(timestamp_inserted) from iocm_activity where status = 'PENDING'  ;  
                                                                           QUERY PLAN                                                                            
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Aggregate  (cost=649143.62..649143.63 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=1384.026..1384.026 rows=1 loops=1)
   Buffers: shared read=59033 dirtied=358 written=195
   ->  Bitmap Heap Scan on iocm_activity  (cost=421528.87..648445.74 rows=279153 width=8) (actual time=275.471..1243.322 rows=164576 loops=1)
         Recheck Cond: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
         Heap Blocks: exact=30725
         Buffers: shared read=59033 dirtied=358 written=195
         ->  Bitmap Index Scan on iocm_activity_retryafter_status  (cost=0.00..421459.08 rows=279153 width=0) (actual time=268.190..268.190 rows=167790 loops=1)
               Index Cond: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
               Buffers: shared read=28308 written=56
 Planning time: 0.144 ms
 Execution time: 1384.267 ms
(11 rows)

Time: 1387.255 ms

try making a index for timestamp_inserted 

(sa@qhrbhdeppac01) [iocmagent] # CREATE INDEX concurrently CS0046717_timestamp_inserted on iocmagent.iocm_activity (timestamp_inserted) ;
CREATE INDEX
Time: 209972.634 ms

explain again 

(sa@qhrbhdeppac01) [iocmagent] #   explain(analyze,buffers) select min(timestamp_inserted) from iocm_activity where status = 'PENDING'  ;   
                                                                             QUERY PLAN                                                                             
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Result  (cost=5.67..5.68 rows=1 width=0) (actual time=0.932..0.933 rows=1 loops=1)
   Buffers: shared read=4
   InitPlan 1 (returns $0)
     ->  Limit  (cost=0.43..5.67 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=0.921..0.928 rows=1 loops=1)
           Buffers: shared read=4
           ->  Index Scan using cs0046717_timestamp_inserted on iocm_activity  (cost=0.43..858602.02 rows=163824 width=8) (actual time=0.919..0.919 rows=1 loops=1)
                 Index Cond: (timestamp_inserted IS NOT NULL)
                 Filter: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
                 Buffers: shared read=4
 Planning time: 0.539 ms
 Execution time: 0.963 ms
(11 rows)

Time: 2.925 ms
item.summary: IocmAgent: slow query from Ipmon plugin check_queue_iocm_activity_age

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
correct the index name to match current case# 

(sa@qhrbhdeppac01) [iocmagent] # ALTER INDEX cs0046717_timestamp_inserted rename to CS0100783_iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted ;
The new index should be added to the schema file and as a post availability task.

• Queued up 14k rows on iocm_activity, all in pending state and then killed IocmAgent
  • Query plan before creating the index: 
    cmdline@mst1) [iocmagent] > explain(analyze,buffers) select min(timestamp_inserted) from iocm_activity where status = 'PENDING';
                                                                       QUERY PLAN                                                  
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Aggregate  (cost=1653.98..1653.99 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=35.959..35.960 rows=1 loops=1)
   Buffers: shared hit=44 read=684 written=107
   ->  Bitmap Heap Scan on iocm_activity  (cost=796.82..1617.96 rows=14411 width=8) (actual time=3.327..22.022 rows=14411 loops=1)
         Recheck Cond: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
         Heap Blocks: exact=612
         Buffers: shared hit=44 read=684 written=107
         ->  Bitmap Index Scan on iocm_activity_retryafter_status  (cost=0.00..793.21 rows=14411 width=0) (actual time=3.183..3.183
               Index Cond: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
               Buffers: shared hit=43 read=73
 Planning time: 0.304 ms
 Execution time: 36.017 ms
  • Deploy the rpm and restart IocmAgent. New index iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted is created 
    (cmdline@mst1) [iocmagent] > \d iocm_activity
                                  Table "iocmagent.iocm_activity"
       Column       |           Type           |                     Modifiers                      
--------------------+--------------------------+----------------------------------------------------
 activity_id        | bigint                   | not null default nextval('activity_seq'::regclass)
 study_uid          | character varying        | not null
 series_uid         | character varying        | 
 status             | character varying(20)    | not null default 'PENDING'::character varying
 operation          | character varying(40)    | not null
 retry_after        | timestamp with time zone | not null default now()
 num_executions     | integer                  | not null default 0
 last_failure       | character varying        | 
 timestamp_inserted | timestamp with time zone | not null default now()
 timestamp_updated  | timestamp with time zone | not null default now()
 triggered_time     | timestamp with time zone | not null
 identifier         | character varying        | 
 attributes         | jsonb                    | not null default '{}'::jsonb
Indexes:
    "iocm_activity_id" btree (activity_id)
    "iocm_activity_retryafter_status" btree (retry_after, status)
    "iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted" btree (timestamp_inserted)
    "iocm_activity_timestamp_updated" btree (timestamp_updated)
    "iocm_series" btree (series_uid)
    "iocm_study" btree (study_uid)
  • New query plan on same set of records 
    (sa@mst1) [iocmagent] # explain(analyze,buffers) select min(timestamp_inserted) from iocm_activity where status = 'PENDING';
                                                                             QUERY PLAN                                            
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Result  (cost=0.54..0.55 rows=1 width=0) (actual time=0.035..0.036 rows=1 loops=1)
   Buffers: shared hit=3
   InitPlan 1 (returns $0)
     ->  Limit  (cost=0.29..0.54 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=0.030..0.031 rows=1 loops=1)
           Buffers: shared hit=3
           ->  Index Scan using iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted on iocm_activity  (cost=0.29..3606.05 rows=14411 width=8) (actual 
                 Index Cond: (timestamp_inserted IS NOT NULL)
                 Filter: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
                 Buffers: shared hit=3
 Planning time: 0.529 ms
 Execution time: 0.075 ms

Looking at this more closely. Looks like the original query hits the iocm_activity_retryafter_status, because it is the only index that indexes status, but it isn't a perfect fit which results in the bitmap heap scan. The addition of the timstamp_inserted index helps for the min(timestamp_inserted) part of the query, but the WHERE clause uses status. I think that ideally we should have an index that includes timestamp_inserted and status

Here is the query plan with the timestamp_inserted index as proposed by Muwei

 Result  (cost=0.69..0.72 rows=1 width=4) (actual time=0.024..0.024 rows=1 loops=1)
   Buffers: shared hit=4
   InitPlan 2 (returns $1)
     ->  Result  (cost=0.68..0.69 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=0.019..0.019 rows=1 loops=1)
           Buffers: shared hit=4
           InitPlan 1 (returns $0)
             ->  Limit  (cost=0.27..0.68 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=0.018..0.018 rows=1 loops=1)
                   Buffers: shared hit=4
                   ->  Index Scan using timestampinsertedidx on iocm_activity  (cost=0.27..103.71 rows=251 width=8) (actual time=0.017..0.017 rows=1 loops=1)
                         Index Cond: (timestamp_inserted IS NOT NULL)
                         Filter: ((status)::text = 'PENDING'::text)
                         Rows Removed by Filter: 5
                         Buffers: shared hit=4
 Planning time: 0.383 ms
 Execution time: 0.052 ms

If we were to include status in the index we hit less buffers and the cost is also lower

 Result  (cost=0.37..0.40 rows=1 width=4) (actual time=0.029..0.029 rows=1 loops=1)
   Buffers: shared hit=3
   InitPlan 2 (returns $1)
     ->  Result  (cost=0.36..0.37 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=0.024..0.025 rows=1 loops=1)
           Buffers: shared hit=3
           InitPlan 1 (returns $0)
             ->  Limit  (cost=0.27..0.36 rows=1 width=8) (actual time=0.023..0.023 rows=1 loops=1)
                   Buffers: shared hit=3
                   ->  Index Only Scan using timestampinsertedstatusidx on iocm_activity  (cost=0.27..22.97 rows=251 width=8) (actual time=0.022..0.022 rows=1 loops=1)
                         Index Cond: ((timestamp_inserted IS NOT NULL) AND (status = 'PENDING'::text))
                         Heap Fetches: 0
                         Buffers: shared hit=3
 Planning time: 0.253 ms
 Execution time: 0.052 ms

Here is the index that I created:

CREATE INDEX concurrently timestampinsertedstatusidx ON iocm_activity  (timestamp_inserted,status);

Sending to dev for review.
Tried analyzing the query with multi column index on 11k records on my vm, but not seeing much of a difference. Assigning back to Max to continue testing.

I performed the analysis of the new query plan, and it looks fine. I installed the fix, and I see the new index show up. Note that if the index is deleted it does not get recreated, but none of the other indexes get recreated either so we can ignore this issue.
This fix is ready to be released.

Maximiano Francisco These are the only three indexes(including the new one) that are in the IocmAgent init tasks:

  • iocm_activity_id
  • iocm_activity_retryafter_status
  • iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted

Except the index iocm_activity_retryafter_status, the other two will get recreated once the app is restarted.

I tried restarting the app after dropping iocm_activity_retryafter_status index and it fails to startup. This is an existing bug and I've fixed it, please retest.

I installed the new rpm. Restarted IocmAgent, and I can see that the index is recreated

Indexes:
    "iocm_activity_id" btree (activity_id)
    "iocm_activity_retryafter_status" btree (retry_after, status)
    "iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted" btree (timestamp_inserted)
    "iocm_series" btree (series_uid)
    "iocm_study" btree (study_uid)

I dropped the new index

(sa@mst1) [iocmagent] # drop index iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted;
DROP INDEX
Time: 5260.037 ms

Restarted IocmAgent

[admin@mst1] {/usr/local/tools/src/PACSinstall/bin} kill_IocmAgent.sh ; run_IocmAgent.sh 

    Killing IocmAgent pid 19512...

And the index gets recreated

Indexes:
    "iocm_activity_id" btree (activity_id)
    "iocm_activity_retryafter_status" btree (retry_after, status)
    "iocm_activity_timestamp_inserted" btree (timestamp_inserted)
    "iocm_series" btree (series_uid)
    "iocm_study" btree (study_uid)

All is good. This issue is ready to be committed.

Released by agangadharan to master at 2019-02-12 10:29:41 (push 71430):
PACS-4-15-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-15-1-P239)
PACS-4-16-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-16-1-P326)
PACS-4-17-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-17-1-P147)
trunk (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-17-2-A160)

Relevant changesets in this release:
intelepacs:dd1020d8f506 agangadharan PACS-4-15-1 IP-97155 fix: Create timestamp_inserted index on iocm_activity table
intelepacs:6d29a7c52648 agangadharan PACS-4-16-1 IP-97155 fix: Create timestamp_inserted index on iocm_activity table
intelepacs:bc8b8410cdbb agangadharan PACS-4-17-1 IP-97155 fix: Create timestamp_inserted index on iocm_activity table
intelepacs:532b95b67a99 agangadharan trunk IP-97155 fix: Create timestamp_inserted index on iocm_activity table

item.title: [IP-97138] IocmAgent: Reduce the amount of memory required to be allocated to IocmAgent service
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P231-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

MINOR - Other mechanisms exist to work around this.

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Start IocmAgent service

Expected behaviour:

Service should be capable of running with a low max memory setting such as 128MB

What happened instead?:

Service can run out of memory when calling routeImage with a very large list of SOPs to send, requiring the max memory allocated to the service to be increased.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Reduce the amount of memory required to be allocated to IocmAgent service

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The memory runs out when loading routImage's output stream.
I recommend to simply pipe it to its own log file and not load it in Java.

Unable to reproduce the state where IocmAgent fails because of routeImage output logs. I reduced the memory for IocmAgent and it fails even before the point where it start printing routeImage logs.

[2019-01-28 12:00:57.564 IOCM_WORKER_9 mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG:Found DICOM file [%s])] /usr/local/PACS/images/20190128/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.19097.1548690517.546417/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.19098.1548690517.568963-v/1/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.346817280.29277.1548690570.230955.dcm

[2019-01-28 12:00:57.564 IOCM_WORKER_9 mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG:Found DICOM file [%s])] /usr/local/PACS/images/20190128/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.19097.1548690517.546417/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.19098.1548690517.568963-v/1/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.346817280.27001.1548690555.342916.dcm
[2019-01-28 12:00:57.564 IOCM_WORKER_9 mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG:Found DICOM file [%s])] /usr/local/PACS/images/20190128/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.346817280.19097.1548690517.546417/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.346817280.19098.1548690517.568963-v/1/1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.346817280.13267.1548690670.599908.dcm

ERROR: Failed to handle IOCM activity
*************************

Removing some sop level logging in IocmAgent and making routeImage write it's own log file will help IocmAgent to run with low memory.

routeImage writes it's log under:

[admin@mst1] {/var/log/PACS/RouteImage} ls -ltr
total 80
drwxr-xr-x. 2 admin imslogger  4096 Jan 29 15:30 filed_logs
-rw-rw-r--. 1 admin imslogger 77182 Jan 29 15:38 ROUTE_IMAGE.log

[2019-01-29 15:38:19.101 routeImage mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {5029}] Reading configuration file /usr/local/tools/control_files/ro
uteImage.cfg
[2019-01-29 15:38:19.101 routeImage mst1.intelerad.com (DatabaseInterface) {5029}] Connecting to sybase host (MST1), DB (GlobalCTNC
trl), with user (supportscripts)
[2019-01-29 15:38:19.107 routeImage mst1.intelerad.com (DatabaseInterface) {5029}] Successfully connected to sybase host (MST1), DB
 (GlobalCTNCtrl), with user (supportscripts)

[2019-01-29 15:38:19.645 routeImage mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {5029}] === (send_images) Completed sending images to destination AE [QATOOLS] (via AE [QATOOLS]) ===
[2019-01-29 15:38:19.645 routeImage mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {5029}] send_images() return value = 1
[2019-01-29 15:38:19.645 routeImage mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE) {5029}] send_images() Processed 10 file(s)

Upon testing I noticed that all the routeImage events were logged to the same log file

[admin@qa4151mod2] {/var/log/PACS/routeImage} ls
ROUTE_IMAGE.log  filed_logs

And although the process ID is written in the logs

[2019-01-31 16:37:18.444 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE) {26572}] (send_images)  [IMAGE]

The process ID is not written in the Iocm_Worker log; thus complicating tracing of events from IocmAgent to routeImage. Speaking with George we will endeavour to include the process ID of the routeImage call to be included in the Worker logs.

The other change that would be useful would be to include the destination AE title in the routeImage log file name.

Aswin checked in a new change which adds the routeImage PID and changes the log name to include the destination AE

So from the Worker logs we see:

[2019-02-01 11:37:37.749 IOCM_WORKER_0 qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Invoked routeImage with process pid: 23258

Unfortunately, the logs do not seem to append but overwrite

[admin@qa4151mod2] {/var/log/PACS/routeImage} head -1 ROUTEIMAGE_QA4161MOD1
[2019-02-01 11:41:02.163 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE) {32142}] Reading configuration file /usr/local/tools/control_files/routeImage.cfg
[admin@qa4151mod2] {/var/log/PACS/routeImage} head -1 ROUTEIMAGE_QA4161MOD1
[2019-02-01 11:42:37.808 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE) {3842}] Reading configuration file /usr/local/tools/control_files/routeImage.cfg
[admin@qa4151mod2] {/var/log/PACS/routeImage} head -1 ROUTEIMAGE_QA4161MOD1
[2019-02-01 11:44:18.316 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE) {8272}] Reading configuration file /usr/local/tools/control_files/routeImage.cfg

Aswin updated send_image. Testing again and I see the pid in the IocmAgent Worker log:

[2019-02-01 14:09:43.115 IOCM_WORKER_0 qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Invoked routeImage with process pid: 17896

and I find that pid in the routeImage logs

[admin@qa4151mod2] {/var/log/PACS/routeImage} grep 17896 ROUTEIMAGE_QA4161MOD1.log | head -3
[2019-02-01 14:09:38.689 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (TRACE) {17896}] Reading configuration file /usr/local/tools/control_files/routeImage.cfg
[2019-02-01 14:09:38.690 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (DatabaseInterface) {17896}] Connecting to sybase host (QA4151MOD2), DB (GlobalCTNCtrl), with user (supportscripts)
[2019-02-01 14:09:38.878 routeImage qa4151mod2.intelerad.com (DatabaseInterface) {17896}] Successfully connected to sybase host (QA4151MOD2), DB (GlobalCTNCtrl), with user (supportscripts)
Testing is complete.

item.title: [IP-97104] IocmAgent: Worker threads stop responding due to suspected OutOfMemory error

it seems fine so far, not seeing OOM since yesterday, probably need more time to confirm.
routeImage can use its own log file instead of the app reading its output into its own log.
Alioune suggested we register a handler for any thread that dies with an exception and isn't caught.

I suggest to look at something like this:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3821144/how-to-catch-outofmemoryerror-in-jvm-and-run-a-script-if-its-caught

a handler might also suffer from a OOM so it might not work.

From testing locally, it looks like the try-catch-finally block should be handling any Exceptions and Errors correctly.

From the logs below:

Does this issue need to be in the release notes?

Hi Kathleen Jette,
This is another bug that MNHHS might be interested in.

This bug addresses the issue where if the IocmAgent scheduler runs out of memory it stops scheduling new Iocm Activity.
Tested and confirmed that the JVM arg Brian suggested (-XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError) successfully stops the IocmAgent application once an OutOfMemory error is detected.

Description of the solution:

IocmAgent application may continue to run even if an OutOfMemory error has stopped its worker threads from being managed by the dispatcher. This keeps the application in a non-functional state and ipmon unaware that it should be restarted.

The solution is to add the JVM arg (-XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError) to run_IocmAgent.sh to configure the JVM to automatically stop itself when it detects that an OutOfMemory error has been thrown. This will allow ipmon to detect the stoppage and restart the app.

In case of a chronic error (ex: setting 60 worker threads to run with insufficient memory settings), we expect the frequency of restarts to come to the attention of support for eventual action.

Evolve branch containing fix:

PACS-4-14-1-bleung-oom

Please build IocmAgent rpm from master-pirates/components/iocmagent.

This fix may also apply to IP-97137 "IocmAgent: Service is not restarted by Ipmon when IocmAgent encounters OutOfMemory error". Should we test it also using this fix?

Tests executed:

  • Create dev-effectiveness environment.
  • Configure to enable IocmRelay server.
  • In run_IocmAgent.sh, set the JVM memory to a very low value.
 LOGMGR_CLASS=-Djava.util.logging.config.class=com.intelerad.db.intermediaries.lib.config.JavaLoggingConfigurator
 
-JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx128m \
+JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx8m \
            -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow \
            -Dsun.net.http.retryPost=false \
            $LOGMGR_CLASS"
  • Confirm that the fix is in run_IocmAgent.sh.
 JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx128m \
            -XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow \
+           -XX:+ExitOnOutOfMemoryError \
            -Dsun.net.http.retryPost=false \
            $LOGMGR_CLASS"
  • Send multiple sops for ingestion to force IocmAgent application to run out of memory.
#!/bin/bash

FILE=$1

PID=EBPID$RANDOM
ACC=EBACC$RANDOM

AE=EBELARDO
HOSTUP=MST1
HOSTLOW=mst1

dcmodify -gin -gse -gst -ma "AccessionNumber=$ACC" -ma "PatientID=$PID" -ma "PatientName=$PID" $FILE
send_image -a $AE -c $HOSTUP $HOSTLOW 5000 $FILE

for i in {1..100}
do
  dcmodify -gin $FILE
  send_image -a $AE -c $HOSTUP $HOSTLOW 5000 $FILE
  echo "$i"
  sleep 3
done

STUDYUID=`dcmdump $FILE  +P StudyInstanceUID | awk -F'[' '{print $2}' | awk -F']' '{print $1}'`
echo StudyUI = $STUDYUID

echo "Waiting..."
sleep 20
echo "listLocsforStudy.pl -s $STUDYUID"
listLocsforStudy.pl -s $STUDYUID
  • Monitor the Iocm logs (ex: run_IocmAgent.log) for when an OutOfMemory error is thrown.
  • Once OutOfMemory error appears in the logs, confirm that the IocmAgent has been stopped.
$ pidCheck IocmAgent.pid
PID 22266 NOT RUNNING [/usr/local/tools/pid/IocmAgent.pid]
  • Confirm that ipmon detects that IocmAgent is down and eventually restarts it.
$ less runIpmonLocal.log
[2019-02-06 10:09:15.011 runIpmonLocal mst1.intelerad.com {19303}]   IocmAgent: PID monitored process down - restarted

$ pidCheck IocmAgent.pid
PID 22266 RUNNING [/usr/local/tools/pid/IocmAgent.pid]

Unit tests added or modified:

  • None

Reproducing the original issue. I increased the number of threads to 60 and reduced the heap allocation to 8MB. I see the OOM

[2019-02-07 16:44:40.066 IOCM_WORKER_8 mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG)] Protocol negotiation URL: https://mst1.intelerad.com:5012/DicomMasterQueryService?protocol=ProtocolNegotiationProtocol1.0

        at com.intelerad.lib.hessian.client.InteleradHessianProxyFactory$1.invoke(InteleradHessianProxyFactory.java:120)

And we can see that nothing new has been dispatched to thread 8

[admin@mst1] {/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent} date; tail -1 IocmAgent_Worker_8.log
Thu Feb  7 16:53:42 EST 2019
[2019-02-07 16:44:52.299 IOCM_WORKER_8 mst1.intelerad.com (ThreadMonitor)] 5 thread(s) are currently being monitored.

The reason for that it is that the Dispatcher has also OOMd

[2019-02-07 16:44:52.490 IOCM_DISPATCHER_0 mst1.intelerad.com (WARNING)] Monitoring for thread 'IocmDispatcher_0' has not been removed
[2019-02-07 16:44:52.490 IOCM_DISPATCHER_0 mst1.intelerad.com] 
*************************
ERROR: Command failed due to error
*************************
[2019-02-07 16:44:52.552 IOCM_DISPATCHER_0 mst1.intelerad.com] Stack trace:
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded

I applied the fix and ran it with the same configurations, and what I see now is that once the OOM happens the run log shows the application being restarted

[2019-02-07 17:02:37.732 UNKNOWN mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Launching Iocm Agent version: PACS-development
[2019-02-07 17:02:37.809 UNKNOWN mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG:StateMachine)] Handling 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.IocmAgentApplication$6'
OK - Created lock with '/usr/local/tools/pid/IocmAgent.pid'
Terminating due to java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
Kill application 'IocmAgent' called at: Thu Feb  7 17:03:15 EST 2019

    Killing IocmAgent pid 17168...
Run application 'IocmAgent' called at: Thu Feb  7 17:03:16 EST 2019
[2019-02-07 17:03:17.849 UNKNOWN mst1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Launching Iocm Agent version: PACS-development
[2019-02-07 17:03:18.101 UNKNOWN mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG:StateMachine)] Handling 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.IocmAgentApplication$6'
OK - Created lock with '/usr/local/tools/pid/IocmAgent.pid'
Terminating due to java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
I was able to confirm that the new flags ensure that an OOM restarts the application. This issue can be released.

Brian Leung Thank you so much for the draft for the release notes. I am concerned that "it stops scheduling new Iocm Activity" is a little too developer-speak. Can we use something like:

item.title: [IP-95932] LDS: Does not notify IocmAgent when manually validating
item.description:
RPM Version

PACS-4-15-1-R22

ISP - MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

Images are not sent to the VNA

Minimal steps to reproduce:

  1. Set up a VNA
  2. Send a unvalidated study to the IocmRelay.
  3. Observe the SERIES_SEND activity queued up with isValid = false
  4. Manually validate the study

Expected behaviour:

  1. The STUDY_CORRECT should be queued up with isValid = true
  2. The study is sent to the VNA.

What happened instead?:

  1. The STUDY_CORRECT was not queued up
  2. Resulting in the study not being sent to the VNA at all.
item.summary: LDS: Does not notify IocmAgent when manually validating

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I am not 100% sure that the scenario is manual validation as I didn't know the admin password to login to the client server to check the logs.

My theory is that when LDS creates a request and immediately applies it and inserts it into the database as DONE status, the request processor does not pick it up and has no opportunity to create the Iocm deferred activity.

Hi George Laza,
cc Adam Griffith,

I have been asked by Nat today for a response in this question:

  • VALIDATION corrections do not trigger a STUDY_CORRECT iocmagent operation. Is this intentional behaviour?

The admin password for test1 should be OGUwZDU4Mz.

Thanks,
Honey
It is not intentional, it is exactly what this bug is for.

I am retesting this bug and it is not the manual validation that does not end up notifying, but the automatic validation instead.

As MAINT-8898 describes, the validation was a dummy one and only a SERIES_SEND activity was observed.

This use case was less important because the IocmRelay was not necessarily intended to be validating and the SERIES_SEND activity was flagged as being in a study that has already been validated. Since the deferred activity will inform the IocmAgent AFTER the validation correction is applied, there is no risk of sending an out-of-date series.

The side-effect of creating a STUDY_CORRECT at this stage is that the IocmAgent will immediately request a move to here for all series of this study. Although, it is very likely that they are already on their way.

Since there is no loss of functionality, I don't think that the fact that there is a missing STUDY_CORRECT activity warrant a change and result is duplicate sends.

I propose to close this issue as I misunderstood it for being for the manual validation case.

I still believe that the cause of this issue is that the automatic validation correction may be applied in place and saved as done. But I never confirmed this hypothesis.
Marking as won't fix as I don't think it is worth it.

Hi George Laza

If so, I believe that issue is a different scenario, as that behaviour shows we do have a STUDY_CORRECT operation created. The scenario I'm describing here, no SUDY_CORRECT is generated.

When I tried to reproduce this on my VM, I did get a STUDY_CORRECT when I manually validated. And since the original bug was mainly focused on the issue in IP-95931, I didn't have enough proof that manual validation was a problem.

Does this client have a test PACS where I can enable more logging and try to reproduce myself?

Here is my theory: I believe that the the manual correction that Adam Griffith created may not have gone through the code path that informs the IocmAgent.

Looking at the code, my above theory was correct. the log message: "No study corrections found or pending corrections are not changing current study." confirms that the ArchiveIntegrationClient was not informed.

I propose to change the guarding logic to include whether the batch of requests include a validation correction ( DicomCorrectorFacade.java:777 ).

In 4-15-1, IP-91331 caused this issue by no-longer notifying the IocmAgent of corrections that didn't end up changing any DICOM tags. This was needed to prevent a study that was imported as legacy from being resent to the VNA after the corrections were autogenerated for it.

Description of the solution

Enhanced the IocmAgent by adding hasChanged to the correctStudy hessian method.
This flag indicates whether the correction has effective changes or not.

If the study was previously sent to the VNA, the StudyCorrections that has not changed anything will sent. Otherwise it will be skipped.

SeriesSend will not be skipped if a non-changing StudyCorrect is queued up afterwards.

Tests executed

Sent study and repeatedly created corrections that either change a tag or not.

Unit tests added or modified

TestIocmActivityTransferObject1.java
TestIocmActivityTransferObject2.java
TestIocmActivityTransferObject3.java
TestIocmAgentProtocol4.java
TestIocmAttributesTransferObject2.java

As per the Manual Maintenance workflow, the Automation Integration tests passed for the build containing this fix. Marking Verified

Summary of tests done:
Please refer IP-95932 for the basic tests that were done. Summary on the other tests done can be found below.

Given the IOCM environment is setup with the satellite server sending images to the Central Server,

  • Test1: Disable the communicatin with the VNA (Central Server i.e QATOOLS) and send a study. Upon enabling the communication back, the study should be sent to the VNA
  • Test2: Disable communication with the VNA & send a study. Check the SERIES_SEND being stuck in iocm_activity and then do a study correction. Upon communication being enabled, the STUDY_CORRECT task sends the study along with the correction to the VNA
  • Test3: Disable communication with the VNA. Send a study and then send a requestCorrection with no changes. Upon communication being enabled back again, the STUDY_CORRECT activity is skipped since the correction does not have any changes, BUT the SERIES_SEND activity sends the study to the VNA
  • Test4 Disable communication with the VNA. Send a study and then send a requestCorrection with no changes. Wait for a while and send a correction again but this time, make a change in one of the tags. Upon communication being enabled back again, the last STUDY_CORRECT which made a change on the tag sends the study with the latest correction.
  • Test5 With the above scenario, makes various corrections on the study after the study is sent. With each correction, either make some change in the tag or don't make any change. If a change is made, it should reflect in the iocm_activity by having the value for the column "attributes" has "hasChanged": true. If no change is made, then the value in that column for the study for the STUDY_CORRECT activity will be "hasChanged": false showing that IOCM detected that no changes were made in the correction.
  • Test6 : Ensure that the value shows as "hasChanged: true" for a study for which we do a requestCorrection for 2 tags at the same time with changing the value of tag1 and not changing the value of tag2.

Result : All tests pass.

item.title: [IP-95931] IocmAgent: Images never sent when SEND_SERIES skipped for a CORRECT_STUDY.
item.description:
RPM Version

PACS-4-15-1-R22

ISP - MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

Images are not sent to the VNA

Minimal steps to reproduce:

  1. Set up a VNA with an invalid IP address or an unreachable host.
  2. Send a study to the IocmRelay
  3. Observe the SERIES_SEND activity queued up and fail.
  4. Perform a study correction
  5. Observe the STUDY_CORRECT

Expected behaviour:

Whatever the skipping logic is in IocmAgent, the study should be sent to the VNA (when it is up).

What happened instead?:

  1. The SERIES_SEND was skipped because the study is queued up for a resend in the STUDY_CORRECT activity.
  2. The STUDY_CORRECT activity was changed to only resend studies that have already been sent to the VNA. So in this case it is skipped because no VNA location exists for this study.
  3. Resulting in the study not being sent to the VNA at all.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Images never sent when SEND_SERIES skipped for a CORRECT_STUDY.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
We need to keep in mind that the IocmAgent receives all study corrections in the PACS but only needs to resend the ones that were originally routed to it. This is why STUDY_CORRECT checks the VNA location first.

The reason why the SERIES_SEND is skipped for the STUDY_CORRECT is because we didn't want to send the series twice for no reason.

When we combine both optimizations, a whole is exposed that skipping the SEND causes the skipping of the CORRECT.

Description of the solution

Added an extra test before skipping STUDY_CORRECT activities.
It used to only check whether the study has the VNA location or if the VNA successfully finds it in a C-FIND. Since this was not enough as a SERIES_SEND could have been skipped in favor of the STUDY_CORRECT. We added an additional check for the study to be present on the IocmRelay. If it is present, it was destined to be sent to the VNA and CORRECT_STUDY should not skip.

Tests executed

  1. Kill IocmAgent
  2. Send a new study
  3. Correct the study
  4. Run IocmAgent
  5. Study was sent to VNA.

Unit tests added or modified

None.

Verified with RPMs: IocmAgent-4.14.9.P000-ims99.noarch
Test env : QA4141, QATOOLS

Verification steps:

Test1

Study must reach the VNA after correction

  • Study must reach the VNA after correction
    • For that, go to MpiDicomDomains.cfg and enter the following
    • [IocmIntegration_QATOOLS]
vnaAeTitle                                       = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy                                = INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED
participatingAeTitles                            = QA4141MOD2
delayInHours                                     = 0
  • Change the host Ip of the QATOOLS so that connectivity is lost, or turn it off making it uncommunicable
  • Send a new study to QA4141MOD2
  • Go to QA4141MOD2 and observe the SERIES_SEND in PENDING state in iocmagent.iocm_activity because of the connectivity to QATOOLS is not happening.
  • Do a requestCorrection on the study
    • requestCorrection -s 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.1510629762.26607.1541630615.824688 --user adil --StuDes TOEPAIN
  • Make the VNA i.e (QATOOLS) communicable again
  • The study should go to the VNA even if VNA doesn’t already have the study location
  • Ensure that the VNA has the updated and corrected study
  • Check the iocm_activity table in QA4141MOD2 to ensure STUDY_CORRECT applied and shows correct info

Test 2

Study must be sent to the VNA after it is reachable again

  • Change the host Ip of the QATOOLS so that connectivity is lost, or turn it off making it uncommunicable
  • Send a new study to QA4141MOD2
  • Go to QA4141MOD2 and observe the SERIES_SEND in PENDING state in iocmagent.iocm_activity because of the connectivity to QATOOLS is not happening.
  • Make VNA communicable again
  • Ensure the study reaches the VNA after the VNA is communicable again

Test 3

Ensure multiple corrections are applied to the study sent to the VNA

  • Repeat the steps in Test 1 till the step where a new study was sent.
  • Send a study Correction
  • While the study is waiting for STUDY_CORRECT to be processing in iocm DB, Make a study correction again but to a different tag
  • Make VNA communicable again
  • Ensure, both corrections are applied to the study at VNA

Test 4

Ensure latest correction is applied when the study is sent to the VNA

  • Repeat the steps in Test 1 till the step where a new study was sent.
  • Apply multiple corrections on a tag i.e Study Description
  • Make the VNA communicable again
  • Verify that the VNA picks up the latest modification on that study tag.

End result: All tests pass

George Laza Can the rpm attached to the jira issue be used for testing at MNHHS client site?
CC: Adam Griffith Barry Nel Michael Palimaka

Testing was performed. See MAINT-8991 for results

I suspect we may also need a devrpm for LocalDicomService?

Adam Griffith George Laza : The fix for this has introduced a regression bug. The studies are NOT getting sent to the VNA even with the VNA being up and communicable. It happens only in v. 4-15-1. For details, Pls see https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/MAINT-8991

Tara Martyres Sujata Ghatpande

All tests pass on IOCM related https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-95931 functionality & https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-95932 functionality.

  • The studies are reachable to the VNA after it bcomes communicable again
  • The corrected studies are setn to the VNA after it becomes communicable again.
  • If the correction of the study is not having any changes, then the SEND_SERIES operation is done and correction is skipped since the correction didn't make any changes.
  • With multiple corrections applied to the study while the VNA is not reachable, all of those corrections with the study reach the VNA once it's communication is restored.
  • With multiple corrections applied on the study with some of the corrections not making any changes, only those corrections will be skipped and the other corrections will still be applied & will be sent to the VNA

All tests related to the bugfix pass.

Note : PatientName correction is not sent to the VNA but that well very could be not a regression but an existing bug from before.
Logs from the test of https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331 are unclear but the behavior is not different since the corrections done to a study with no changes in the corrected tag are skipped.

Will add detailed test steps on Monday.

Released by glaza to master at 2018-11-19 12:18:36 (push 70205):
PACS-4-14-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-14-1-P451)
PACS-4-15-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-15-1-P230)
PACS-4-16-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-16-1-P276)
PACS-4-17-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-17-1-P95)
trunk (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-17-2-A99)

Relevant changesets in this release:
intelepacs:b6cefdbec63f glaza PACS-4-14-1 IP-95931 fix: Add check for local study before skipping
intelepacs:0c9d5e2b6090 glaza PACS-4-15-1 IP-95931 fix: Add check for local study before skipping
intelepacs:0bff7d35d436 glaza PACS-4-16-1 IP-95931 fix: Add check for local study before skipping
intelepacs:78e2d075d504 glaza PACS-4-17-1 IP-95931 fix: Add check for local study before skipping
intelepacs:2510c1e12ee4 glaza trunk IP-95931 fix: Add check for local study before skipping

PatientName issue seems to have been specific to the DCM4CHEE3 installed on QATOOLS.
We were not able to reproduce it with another PACS server.

Update on testing :

Tests related to IP-95931 & IP-95932 are completed but except the scenario regarding the Import of the study from VNA to PACS which was the bug in https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331.
Since, the functionality of IOCM and LDS changed in IP-95931 & IP-95932 affects the previous fix done in https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331, the functionality of this ticket should be tested as well for regression.

The happy path test is done where the requestCorrection with changes / no changes made to the tags of the existing study are updated with appropriate flags and depending on that, the iocm_activity will either send the correction or skip it.

However, the scenario is still to be tested in which we do an import from the VNA to PACS so that the PACS to which the study is imported does not have the ingestion info of the series imported. And then after doing a requestCorrection with no changes made in any of the tags, autogeneration of checkpoints, corrections and validation happens which can be seen with the help of listDicomRequests on the study as below

The correction should not registered in iocm_activity table to be "hasChanged : true" in attributes since the correction did not change any tag.

Apart from the above scenario, all other tests pass. So, while the above scenario is being tested in the QA env, it can also be exercised in the client's env.

Thanks.

Tara Martyres Sujata Ghatpande
Update on the import scenario from VNA to PACS :

We tried the import scenario from VNA to PACS and instead of not generating any correction request, it assumed that something is changed bcoz the study doesn't have any ingestion related info locally and generated a correction request. Now, I showed it to George and he confirmed it's a bug.

So, the import scenario has a bug but it could be a bug from *https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331* & this particular scenario wasn't tested then. We caught it now & we're positive that it was never fixed in *https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331*. But, to confirm we have to investigate whether this bug existed by installing an LDS rpm without George's fix.., which is in progress by active communication with the DIT team to have help with one of their tools. If, after confirmation, it was never fixed from *https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331*, we can close the 2 IOCM bugs from George and RE-OPEN that ticket which had the import scenario's fix.

This ticket and IP-95932 can be closed since the bug in the DicomMasterImport functionality had not been fixed in https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331 and is thus not a regression of this ticket.

I have added a comment on https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-91331 and that ticket can be re-opened.
As per the Manual Maintenance workflow, the Automation Integration tests passed for the build containing this fix. Marking Verified

item.title: [IP-95322] IocmAgent: StorageCommit not being queued when SERIES_SEND is skipped for a STUDY_CORRECT.
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P193-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client : CS0046717 - MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

Series locations for the VNA are not getting updated in a timely manner

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Queue a series_send for IocmAgent, and while the series_send task is still in PENDING issue a correction for the study.

Expected behaviour:

When the series is sent to the VNA a StorageCommit is queued.

What happened instead?:

No StorageCommit is queued, because there is still a PENDING series_send due to the correction.

[2018-09-07 01:02:26.009 IOCM_WORKER_6 qhrbhdeppac01.local (DEBUG)] Checking if series [1.2.840.113619.2.411.3.118116417.461.1497391705.203] is scheduled to be sent in the future
[2018-09-07 01:02:26.009 IOCM_WORKER_6 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Not sending series [1.2.840.113619.2.411.3.118116417.461.1497391705.203] because this series is scheduled to be sent in activity 4405960
[2018-09-07 01:02:26.009 IOCM_WORKER_6 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Activity was sucessfully completed. Marking it as DONE.

What we are seeing is that the StorageCommit queue is actually empty right now because almost nothing is being queued.
item.summary: IocmAgent: StorageCommit not being queued when SERIES_SEND is skipped for a STUDY_CORRECT.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
To RnD Project Managers
Escalation priority:
Please note that IP-95192 is the new #1 priority for Client Code: MNHHS
Escalation summary:
StorageCommits are not being queued because IocmAgent has delayed StorageCommit updates because of Dicom Correction send. We are seeing studies that are missing series entries in DicomMaster.
Impact:
Occurrence: Each time images are sent to the VNA
Scope: DicomMaster hosts
Impact: Affects the pulling of priors. Client is providing DIT with lists weekly to perform DicomImports.
Urgency:
This is having a MAJOR impact on operations. They are not able to rely on our PACS to reliably send and track images to the VNA
Date client is expecting a solution:
1 week
Thanks,
Maximiano Francisco

Here is my theory:

The IOCM agent skips the SEND_SERIES operation because it has detected that this study will be corrected later on.
This is fine because we resent all the series of a corrected study, so skipping it saves us from sending duplicates.
The problem is that the correction handler does not inform the storage commitment handler.
Confirming as a bug.
On qhrbhdeppac01, we have 16k / 862k series that are in this scenario. Is this number similar to the amount of missing locations?

After discussing with Max, the problem is that the locations appear too late instead of not at all.
The following items may cause this slowdown:

  1. Resending the same series for multiple batches
    • Recommend to change the delay to a float and set it to 1m or 5m to absorb the LDS batches.
    • This item is not effecting this client because the large backlog is already absorbing the batches.
  2. Workers process one activity at time, if it is skipped, then they stop.
  3. IocmAgent forgets to inform StorageCommitmentHandler when a send is skipped by a correction.
    • We could have the worker continue in a skipped situation.
    • This may shave off a few seconds of processing per study.
  4. Cleanup thread to delete DONE activities and vacuum the tables
    • This is not that important at this moment as the table is not very large and is autovacuumed regularly; however, it is bloated quite badly.
  5. Optimize the dispatcher's query because it is taking > 1s (maybe due to bloat)
  6. Split the workload between multiple servers (new feature).

I believe that the biggest bottle neck is the network bandwith. If we are not able to sent faster than 25MB/s, then we may simply not be capable to keep up the sending. Definitely the above optimizations would help, but if the network is the largest bottleneck, then it may not be sufficient.

Hi Client Escalation, RnD Project Managers
Barry Nel

This has been previously escalated by Max, see first comment. I am re-escalating as this is now a TPCH blocker for go-live. We intend to go-live on the 22nd of October. We could not start receiving new TPCH studies given that the issue where we have massive backlog of studies in the depot to the VNA will happen again.

Thank you,
Honey

To Client EscalationTim LawDavid Conte
Escalation priority:
Please note that MAINT-8775/ IP-95192 is the HIGH priority for Client Code: for MNHHS and also noted as a blocker for the TPCH go-live part of the project.

Escalation summary: -* I am using details from Maximiano Francisco *
"To RnD Project Managers

Escalation summary:
StorageCommits are not being queued because IocmAgent has delayed StorageCommit updates because of Dicom Correction send. We are seeing studies that are missing series entries in DicomMaster.
Impact:
Occurrence: Each time images are sent to the VNA
Scope: DicomMaster hosts
Impact: Affects the pulling of priors. Client is providing DIT with lists weekly to perform DicomImports.
Urgency:
This is having a MAJOR impact on operations. They are not able to rely on our PACS to reliably send and track images to the VNA
Date client is expecting a solution:
1 week
Thanks,
"
Thanks,
Barry Nel

This bug will be refocused for only the following issue:

When a SERIES_SEND activity is queued up and is skipped for a STUDY_CORRECT activity, the storage commitment handler is not notified.
If this series was never sent before, there will be no location for this VNA.

Barry Nel cc:Laurence KrajewskiKam Lee Sujata Ghatpande

Hello Barry Nel ,

We understand the impact this issue is having and have prioritized IP-95322 and IP-95206 at the top of our backlog. Should the priority not change (given other issues), we expect to be able to start working on this issue within the coming sprint which starts today and is a 2-week window. Please watch this issue as you will be alerted once it is assigned (which means we have started working on it)

Please be advised that we cannot commit to resolving this issue within a week as you have requested but will do what we can to address them within this sprint given of course that another issue of higher importance does not bump it.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regards,
Tara

Context:

StorageCommitHandler is only invoked during a SERIES_SEND iocmagent activity. If a SERIES_SEND is skipped because a STUDY_CORRECTION would be done in a later activity then no StorageCommitHandler is ever invoked.

Changeset:

We moved the code that handles the queueing into StorageCommitHandler into a separate method. On a STUDY_CORRECTION, we loop over each series in the study and queue an StorageCommitHandler call for each.

The StorageCommitHandler will only be invoked if the remoteScp AeTitle has the proxySeriesLocation configuration set to true.

To Reproduce:

  1. Queue up a SEND_SERIES into IocmAgent, followed by a STUDY_CORRECTION. IocmAgent would need to be busy enough that SEND_SERIES and STUDY_CORRECTION as picked up together for the same StudyInstanceUid.
  2. The SEND_SERIES IocmActivity should be skipped and the STUDY_CORRECTION should be processed. No StorageCommitHandler activity will be queued.

Local Tests Performed:

For QA:

You may need to disable IocmAgent to have both the SERIES_SEND and the STUDY_CORRECTION to be run together. You could also insert the activities directly into the database.

Verification RPM: IocmAgent-4.14.1.P434-ims99

Description of the solution:

When IocmAgent receives a STUDY_CORRECTION, if the AeTitle is set to proxySeriesLocation, IocmAgent queue all the Series in the Study to StorageCommitHandler. This was changed because if a SERIES_SEND is skipped because a STUDY_CORRECTION would be done later, the StorageCommitHandler is never invoked.

Unit tests added or modified:

  • None.

item.title: [IP-95206] IocmAgent: Delays in sending because a correction queued another send
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P193-ims01.noarch

ISP - Client : CS0046717 - MNHHS

Clinical Impact:

Created a backlog of 600k tasks to send to the VNA

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Queue the sending of images through IocmAgent. While the task is still in PENDING queue a correction and see it queue another send task.

Expected behaviour:

IocmAgent will notice that there is a future task, send the images regardless and delete the future task from the queue.

What happened instead?:

We skip the older task because there is another task for the same series in the future.

[2018-09-07 01:02:26.009 IOCM_WORKER_6 qhrbhdeppac01.local (DEBUG)] Checking if series [1.2.840.113619.2.411.3.118116417.461.1497391705.203] is scheduled to be sent in the future
[2018-09-07 01:02:26.009 IOCM_WORKER_6 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Not sending series [1.2.840.113619.2.411.3.118116417.461.1497391705.203] because this series is scheduled to be sent in activity 4405960
[2018-09-07 01:02:26.009 IOCM_WORKER_6 qhrbhdeppac01.local (TRACE)] Activity was sucessfully completed. Marking it as DONE.

What this means is that we are wasting cycles skipping the duplicate tasks, and the queue continues to grow.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Delays in sending because a correction queued another send

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
It would not be safe to drop the newer activity just because we just sent the series now.
First, a correction is applicable to all series and the IocmAgent was simply sending one of them.
Second, the previously sent series may have been out of date and needs to be resent.

I do agree that skipping an activity causes wasted cycles. The dispatcher is sleeping for 1s and at this client, the dispatcher's DB query takes another 1s. When we have duplicate send_series that accumulated due to batching, it takes almost 2s to "skip" each one.

To Client Escalation Tim Law David Conte
Escalation priority:
Please note that IP-95206 is a HIGH priority for Client Code: for MNHHS
Escalation summary:
MNHHS is having daily backlogs of Queues to the VNA. We are having meeting with the CLient and VNA vendor couple of times a week to solve this issue.
Client is now looking to get formal response from Intelerad how we propose to fix this issue.
Support are also constantly involved in monitoring the Queues
Impact: Large Backlogs to the VNA using the IOCM agent
Occurrence:
Scope: Studies to be stored on VNA using IOCM
Impact: Causing huge IOCM Queues to the VNA ( wasting cycles skipping the duplicate tasks, and the queue continues to grow.)
Urgency:
This is having a MAJOR impact on MNHHS.
Date client is expecting a solution:

Thanks,
Barry Nel

This issue is being refocused for the following issues:

1) Time wasted skipping

When there are many SERIES_SEND duplicate activities generated by LDS batching mechanism, the scheduling mechanism wastes a large percentage of its time marking skipping activities.
The dispatcher sleeps for 1 second and at MNHHS, the query for the next study takes about 1 second as well, so we waste 2 seconds for every skip. We could have as many as 150 sends for the same series, this wastes 5 minutes to just skip duplicate send activities.

One option could be to have the worker process a skip and continue until is processes at least one, non-skipped, activity; or until it processed all activities for that study; ...

2) Allow a small delay

Use a small delay in seconds instead of hours, which is unacceptably long.
The current key, delayInHours, could be changed to a float to receive fractions of hours without too much trouble.

I'm thinking of a default of 1-5 minutes to absorb most of LDS's batches.

3) Optimize the dispatcher's query

At the moment, MNHHS takes about 1s to fetch the next study to work on, this is unacceptable.

Changeset is in branch: PACS-4-14-1-glaza-continue-skipping

Description of the solution

  1. Changed the skipping mechanism to continue working after the current activity was skipped. This prevents having a study with lots of duplicates to waste time skipping each one and doing the dispatcher scheduling round robin every time.
  2. Changed the delayInHours to float to allow more precise configuration.
  3. Added two indexes in a new Pre-Service Availability stop on a new admin DB queue:
    1. Merged RetryAfter with Status to improve the dispatcher's query for the next study
    2. Added an index for the activityId to improve the Worker's update to the current activity.

Tests executed

  1. Ensured that the Application starts up and goes through the proper start up steps and executes the pre-service availability tasks at the right time.
  2. Ensured that the delayInHours is read as a float.
  3. Ensured that the worker continued processing the study after a skipped send.

Unit tests added or modified

None

Suggestions for QA

  1. Ensure that the delayInHours works correctly for the correct number of minutes.
  2. Ensure that the dispatcher's query and worker's update are quick even with more than 1M rows in the iocm_activity table.
  3. Ensure that the new indexes are created and the old indexes are dropped.
  4. Ensure that the index creation is not redone once it has already been done once.
  5. Ensure that no regression has been introduced
  6. Ensure that the removal of the status and retry_after indexes did not cause a performance degradation.
  7. If LDS or DMS restart, ensure that IocmAgent can reconnect and resume working.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The following improvements were made to the IocmAgent peformance: delayInHours configuration accepts fractions of an hour; new database indexes are added; duplicate events are collapsed.

RPM Version

ISP - Client : xxxx - <client code>

Clinical Impact:

Minimal steps to reproduce:

Expected behaviour:

What happened instead?:

In MpiDicomDomains.cfg, the delayInHours has been changed from integer to a float. The following is the new documentation:

# delayInHours
# The time delay that every operation will be delayed by since it was received by the IocmAgent.
# This is intended to allow some jitter and have the corrections stabilize in the hopes that it
# will reduce the number of times we need to resend the study. This value will be applied to all
# operations equally (ex: send, correct, delete).

item.title: [IP-94524] Add new IOCM integration policies keys public in PACS-4-14-1 (RDS SATs)
item.description:
This is a formal request to have the IOCM Integration Policies keys public.

RDS want to use different setting for the keys in these policies and the only way right now to do so is to hack the /usr/local/tools/control_files/source/IocmAgent.cfg and therefore introducing a KB1190/KB1191.

For example, they want to use sendRisCorrections = false with sendUnvalidatedImages = false with dicomOperationLevel = SERIES

[IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED]

sendManualCorrections                            = true
sendValidationCorrections                        = true
sendRisCorrections                               = false
sendImages                                       = true
sendUnvalidatedImages                            = false
sendDeletions                                    = true
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName                    = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm
dicomOperationLevel                              = SERIES

Please make those keys public or configurable in MpiDicomDomains.cfg
item.summary: Add new IOCM integration policies keys public in PACS-4-14-1 (RDS SATs)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Mark Groves: Can you please review this request and if it should be done as per the architects. Thanks.
As per architects, at this point in time the config keys are to remain private and KB1190s need to be filed for each new configuration.

Description of the solution:
New IOCM policy INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED added to IocmAgent.cfg

Tests executed:
Tested the policy with two cases:
1. Send SOP without HL7 order - Not valid in this case and so SOP should not be sent.
2. Send SOP with HL7 order - SOP should be sent in this case.
*An invalid SOP is one without corresponding HL7 order

Unit tests added or modified: None

Verified with RPMs: IocmAgent-4.14.1.P428-ims99.noarch

Verification steps:

Pre-requisites :

  • Set up MpiDicomDomains.cfg with the following configuration 
    • [IocmIntegration_QATOOLS]
vnaAeTitle                                       = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy                                = INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_VALIDATED
participatingAeTitles                            = QA4141MOD2
delayInHours                                     = 0

Test1 : Verify that a Study sent to the Satellite server won't be forwarded to the Central server until the order for that study is available

  • Send a study without an order to qa4141mod2 which acts as a participatingAeTitle
  • Verify that the study is not sent to the central server.
  • Send the order for the study to rig1 for that dicom file
    • createOrderFromDcm.pl --hoursFromNow=-1 --host=qa4141rig1 --port=5008 --file=1.3.12.2.1107.5.1.4.43226.30000006101613313904600001756.dcm
  • Go to InteleBrowser and resolve manually validate the study in the Manual Study Validation page.

Test2 : Verify that the study is not sent to the Central server if the study is not validated with the order

Test3: Verify that study sent with an order is sent to the central server

End result: Tests passed

item.title: [IP-91926] IocmAgent has only one db work thread so hessian requests have great competition to perform an insert on the iocmagent db.
item.description:
RPM Version

LocalDicomService-4.15.1.P175-ims01.i386
IocmAgent-4.15.1.P175-ims01.noarch

EW/ISP - Client : PRB0041023 CS0031055 - MNHHS

Clinical Impact

Overall performance is affected.
large backlog is seen in localdicom.requests and localdicom.deferred_activity

Minimal steps to reproduce

Send lots of study to server which will create IocmTask deferred activity
check LDS/IocmAgent log

Expected behaviour

LDS can process the deferred_activity efficiently , unnecessary duplicated job can be avoided.

What happened instead?

duplicated job is executed.
large backlog is seen .

Here is a sample series, LDS made 8 duplicated SERIES_SEND requests to Iocm Agent 

 [admin@qhrbhdeppac01] {/var/log/PACS/LocalDicomService} seriesUID=1.3.12.2.1107.5.1.4.64403.30000018041213415971100080018
[admin@qhrbhdeppac01] {/var/log/PACS/LocalDicomService}  zgrep --no-filename -B2 "SeriesInstanceUid:.*$seriesUID" LocalDicomService_DeferredActivity_IocmTask.log filed_logs/LocalDicomService_DeferredActivity_IocmTask.log.* | egrep "^id:" | wc -l
8

item.summary: IocmAgent has only one db work thread so hessian requests have great competition to perform an insert on the iocmagent db.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Bruno created a devrpm for MNHHS that increased the number of threads for the DBQueue.
Their LDS DeferredActivity IocmTask has fallen back to a normal speed.
Refer to MAINT-8315 issue for more information.

Muwei Li Would it be possible to let us know if the dev RPM in place has made a difference? Please follow up with us.

Thanks,
Tara

CC: Mark Groves Luciano Di Lalla

The proposed fix is to make the config key maxWorkerThreads to also set the number of db threads for iocmagent db.
so it makes the requests from LDS much faster when IocmAgent is very active.

Verified with RPMs: IocmAgent-4.15.1.P186-ims99.noarch

Verification steps:

Test1

  • Give value as 10 for maxWorkerThreads in IocmAgent.cfg
  • Send many studies to PACS
  • Verify in /var/log/PACS/IocmAgent/IocmAgent_DbQueue.log that the number of Threads started are 10 
    • 2018-05-03 13:52:11.055 IOCM_DB_QUEUE_0 qa4151std1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmDbWorker_0' started
[2018-05-03 13:52:11.056 IOCM_DB_QUEUE_2 qa4151std1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmDbWorker_2' started
[2018-05-03 13:52:11.058 IOCM_DB_QUEUE_1 qa4151std1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmDbWorker_1' started
[2018-05-03 13:52:16.139 IOCM_DB_QUEUE_3 qa4151std1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmDbWorker_3' started
...
...
[2018-05-03 13:52:16.139 IOCM_DB_QUEUE_3 qa4151std1.intelerad.com (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmDbWorker_9' started
  • Performance seems to be improved a lot when executed the following query 
    psql-intelerad -c "select count(*),type, status from localdicom.deferred_activity where status <> 'Completed' group by 2,3;"
  • Since, VNA is configured in the environment i.e ( QA4151STD1 ) as specified in the mpiDicomDomains.cfg, verify that the studies that are sent are also forwarded to the destination specified ( in this case, QATOOLS ), below is the MpiDicomDomains.cfg file

participatingAeTitles                            = QA4151STD1

Test2

  • Give the value as 4 for the key maxWorkerThreads in IocmAgent.cfg
  • Verify in the /var/log/PACS/IocmAgent/IocmAgent_DbQueue.log that the number of DB Threads started are 4. The following is the content of the log

End result: Manual Tests passed. Have run the Automation on the dev rpm on rnd-testci.
Automation ran on the fix dev rpm but 34 tests failed. The components failing are totally unrelated to the fix but still have to investigate the failures to be sure.
Link on rnd-testci : https://rnd-testci.intelerad.com/job/IntelePACS_IntegrationTest_PACS-4-15-1/237/#showFailuresLink

The RPM only increased the number of DB Queue threads in IocmAgent.
Muwei Li how is the other deferred activities queues are doing on this mod server? my understanding is this mod have a more fundamental performance problem.

Bruno Da Silva
yes, I agree the server is suffering IO issue due to extreme hi volume traffic.
but no matter the traffic, what I thought is: unnecessary duplicated deferred activity better to be avoided, especially the high ratio of duplication, that should help the over all performance.

item.title: [IP-90185] KOS Messages are generated with the wrong tag values
item.description:
RPM Version

IocmAgent-4.15.1.P160-ims01.noarch

EW/ISP - Client : CHG0032478 - MNNHS

Clinical Impact

Minimal steps to reproduce

Create a rejection note.

Expected behaviour

It is created according to the IHE implementation

What happened instead?

Notes from the client:

One of the issues we encountered with the IOCM integration is that once Intelerad was generating KOS objects with a Current Requested Procedure Evidence Sequence (0040,a375), it is incorrectly mapping SOP Class UID and SOP Instance UID in the Referenced SOP Sequence(s) (0008,1199).

This sequence should provide SOP Class UID and SOP Instance UID in tags (0008,1150) and (0008,1155) respectively, however they're being provided in (0008,0016) and (0008,0018). I'll attach a screenshot of the sequence to help illustrate the issue. We're mapping these values to the correct tags in the VNA, but I think that this should be raised as a bug.

Confirmed in MAINT-8006 that the client is correct and we should open a bug.
item.summary: KOS Messages are generated with the wrong tag values

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: we should be careful when fixing this as we are both the sender and receiver of these messages for RDS and as well, would be changing the behavior when sending to MACH 7, our first integration for this feature

Hi Luciano Di Lalla,

Are we able to tell what are the impacts of the incorrect mapping for MNHHS? Or is this a question I should ask the client?

Thanks,
Honey
are we doing Lexmark?

In this case, we are not DICOM compliant and are addressing this issue because of that and not with the express goal of integrating with Lexmark VNA. What would be important here would be to ensure that once fixed this will work for our clients who are using MACH7 VNAs.

Note: The logic responsible for setting referenced SOP fields are invoked for Intele-VNA policies only, since those contain Content and RequestedProcedureEvidence sequences.

Prerequisites: IOCM agent enabled and configured to use VNA policy (IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED or IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED)

The change will not affect MACH7, since the corresponding template doesn't have sequences containing referenced SOP attributes. The fix doesn't remove the existing attribute setters, but adds the new ones for reference SOP fields (Intele-VNA only).

The issue was reproduced by executing integrations test (TestIocmSingleServer.sendRejectNoteAndRemoveArchiveLocation) and using IDE's debugging tools.

DICOM browser: Referenced SOP Sequence Attribute

QA is tested based on the dev rpm: IocmAgent-4.15.1.P174-ims99.noarch.rpm
Test result is Passed

Prerequisite refers to the testrail test case: C10886187

Test Steps:

  1. go to the image folder and create an order by:
    modifyAndSend -r -n 1 -g 1 -W 0 -w 0 -c $CTN_SYBASE_SERVER -a {your_scanner}

    -i hostname -p 5000 -f

    {your_user}
    # validate the status by:
    dbdump iocmagent iocm_activity -v
    It should contain below for the respective studyuid
    4 status ...........................[DONE]
    5 operation ........................[SERIES_SEND]

    # Delete an image
    requestDeletion -s {studyuid} -u {your_user}

    --global

  2. Validate the status by
    dbdump iocmagent iocm_activity -v
    It should contain below for the respective studyuid
    4 status ...........................[DONE]
    5 operation ........................[STUDY_DELETE]
  3. go the /tmp/IocmAgent folder (setup in debug mode) and validate the KOS message by
    dcmdump {file_generated}

    it should contain
    (0008,1199) SQ (Sequence with undefined length #=1) # u/l, 1 ReferencedSOPSequence
    (fffe,e000) na (Item with undefined length #=4) # u/l, 1 Item
    (0008,0016) UI =UltrasoundImageStorage # 28, 1 SOPClassUID
    (0008,0018) UI [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.8323328.23849.1523376199.761271] # 56, 1 SOPInstanceUID
    (0008,1150) UI =UltrasoundImageStorage # 28, 1 ReferencedSOPClassUID
    (0008,1155) UI [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.8323328.23849.1523376199.761271] # 56, 1 ReferencedSOPInstanceUID

where 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.4.8323328.23849.1523376199.761271 is an example of

{studyuid}

kos_message_fix.txt

item.title: [IP-89718] request to have a new IOCM integration policy
item.description:
SN CHG0032478 for MNHHS and MNHHSTEST1

This is a formal request to have the IOCM Integration Policies keys public.

Metro North (MNHHS) want to use different setting for the keys in these policies and the only way right now to do so is to hack the /usr/local/tools/control_files/source/IocmAgent.cfg and therefore introducing a KB1190/KB1191.

For example, they want to use sendRisCorrections to false with IMAGE level type of dicomOperationLevel.

Please make those keys public or configurable in MpiDicomDomains.cfg
item.summary: request to have a new IOCM integration policy

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
According to George Laza & Mathew Kanner, make those keys public is not a clean solution.
It would lead to multiple config combinations that we could not test/handle.

To address this issue we propose to add one (or more) new integrationPolicy block in IocmAgent.cfg.
For example, to set "sendRisCorrections to false with IMAGE level type of dicomOperationLevel" we could add to IocmAgent.cfg this new bloc (that will be used in MpiDicomDomains.cfg) :

[IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_AND_IMAGE_FEED]
sendManualCorrections                            = true
sendValidationCorrections                        = true
sendRisCorrections                               = false
sendImages                                       = true
sendUnvalidatedImages                            = true
sendDeletions                                    = true
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName                    = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm
dicomOperationLevel                              = IMAGE

Eric Deschamps, can we go ahead with this proposal ?
If yes, can you give me the list of combination required by MNHHS ?
Thanks !

Hi Francois Houillon,

This proposal is perfect.

Let me contact the customer to know exactly what would be the fields they want.

Thanks!

Tara Martyres

I think that for a one off case for Metro north it is acceptable, but this is really a workaround. Consider a scenario where we need to change one of these settings for a few weeks, or we uncover down the line a new requirement and a need to change another setting. This will need to go back to R&D to do another bug fix and potentially take a month to push out. Also consider new clients who will get IOCM over the upcoming years. These settings need to be configurable so we can tweak them as required.

Failure to do so, will not stop DIT/Support from changing the settings and will cause unwanted KB1190s

John Tournas the kb1190s is partially the point, we want to provide the tools you need but at the same time
control the variety of possible combinations (that variety makes it harder to make changes to the software in the future).
If indeed we need to have every possible combination supported, then that becomes part of the requirements
and we need to understand the uses cases via your feedback. Temporary changes should not drive the longer term
requirements.

Open to discussing this when you are free.

in discussions with John Tournas and Frederic Badin, they do need the flexibility of more public keys with different integrations.

sendManualCorrections = true
sendValidationCorrections = true
sendRisCorrections = true
sendUnvalidatedImages = true
sendDeletions = true

the other keys can live in 2 profiles setting one for image and one for series level
sendImages = true
dicomOperationLevel = SERIES
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm

Luciano Di Lalla

As discussed here are a few scenarios where we would want to change these.

sendRisCorrections, they may be sending their RIS feed to both us and the VNA and not require the extra network bandwidth of us resending all images that get a ris correction

sendValidationCorrections = same as above they may have their own validation going on on the VNA, or rely on the ris feed to fix this
sendUnvalidatedImages , I believe this should always be false (currently all true) but some clients may want the studies sent immidiately and reconciled from one of the above methods afterwards
Senddeletions , some VNA may have their own "age off" rules configured and maybe they dont want us to trigger deletes off their VNA

lets go ahead with what was agreed to on May 11 in this comment

We will have a discussion as to what else we can do to make things better in general

Ok, I will add the block given on May 11 in the comment
However Luciano Di Lalla can you confirm this is OK because the actual changed block in the MNHHS environment has this values :

IOCM_POLICY_DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED]
sendManualCorrections                            = true
sendValidationCorrections                        = true
sendRisCorrections                               = false
sendImages                                       = false
sendUnvalidatedImages                            = false
sendDeletions                                    = true
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName                    = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm
dicomOperationLevel                              = IMAGE

John Tournas, I assume you want the profile to match what is currently at Metro north?
so as Francois highlighted in the previous comment ?

Hi Luciano Di Lalla,

I had a chat with Francois Houillon this morning.

The customer wants to do more testing with IOCM before committing for this change. Can we wait a few days before doing anything?

I will follow-up with you when I know exactly the settings Metro North wants.

Thanks for your collaboration.
Hello Eric Deschamps, did you have any feedback from Metro North about this subject? Thanks!

No feedback yet. Let's wait, please.

Thanks!

Eric Deschamps

Have you heard back from the client with regards to how the profile needs to be configured?

Thanks,
Tara

Honey Lane Ante - I've been waiting for Nathaniel from Metro North to answer these questions related to this JIRA but I never got an answer. Do you mind taking this over since you are closely working with this customer? We need to know the IOCM settings they want to have hardcoded in the configuration. They have been running on a hack since the go-live. This is really important to sort out.

Tara Martyres - Still waiting for the customer to answer this one. I'm asking Honey to follow-up with the customer.

Thanks!

Hi Eric Deschamps, I am guessing you want to confirm with Nathaniel if the current settings are good enough ?
and we can then simply create a profile for it ?

thanks,
/L

Hi Francois Houillon,

Here is the response from Nat. They should be getting the PACS 4-15-1-R22 shortly in production. The change in setting described by Nat is because of the fix for IP-91331.

Nathaniel Dash
10:59 AM (10 minutes ago)
to me, Eric, Carlie, Kent

Hi Honey Lane,

Those settings are correct, except once the FRU to PACS 4.15.1 R22 is approved and performed, we will want to enable sendImages.

Regards,
Nat.

IOCM_POLICY_DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED]

Hello Honey Lane Ante

We will work on this Jira within the next sprint starting next week.

Thanks,
Tara
