[IOCM_POLICY_INTELE_VNA_WITH_RIS_FEED_AND_IMAGE_LEVEL]
sendManualCorrections                            = true
sendValidationCorrections                        = true
sendRisCorrections                               = false
sendImages                                       = true
sendUnvalidatedImages                            = false
sendDeletions                                    = true
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName                    = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm
dicomOperationLevel                              = IMAGE

Restart IocmAgent to check that it takes into account the new config.

item.title: [IP-89435] AutoMove2/IocmAgent does not use StorageCommitAeTitle value when inserting StorageCommitQueue record
item.description:
RPM Version

PACS-4-14-1-P314

Config: either setup stunnel on another pacs, or disable tsl on both storescp/commitscp service

Minimal steps to reproduce

1. have latest version of IntelePACS (el4141, PACS-4-14-1-P314 )
2. on IntelePACS, set up one AE for storescp on cloudstorage (AWSSTORE), another AE for commitscp on cloudstorage (AWSCOMMIT)
3. follow doc https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wK-s-VFsW2vt_FNvTDc52B4p3srwc0S1jGsbwTVfPe4/edit# to put AWSCOMMIT into the field of StorageCommitAeTitle in AWSSTORE:

19 StripPostFix .....................[0]
20 AccessTrackingMethod .............[NONE]
21 ValidationEnabled ................[0]

4. make an AutoRoute to route image to AWSSTORE
5. send a new study to the pacs
6. check DicomImage.StorageCommitQueue to see the record for the series has "AWSCOMMIT" as AE_Title
7. disable the AutoRoute and restart related services
8. send another new study to the pacs
9. use SeriesMover to send the study to AWSSTORE
10. check the DicomImage.StorageCommitQueue table for the new series

Expected behaviour

it should also have "AWSCOMMIT" as value for the "AE_Title" field

What happened instead?

it has "AWSSTORE" as value for the "AE_Title" field

I believe the issue also occurs on IocmAgent although I do not test it.

for AutoMove2, can use "seriesMover -s 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.13270.1517347586.576391 -d AWSSTORE" to invoke.

for IocmAgent, this needs to configure as https://testrail.intelerad.com/testrail/index.php?/cases/view/2125647&group_by=cases:section_id&group_order=asc&group_id=224980

feel free to use el4141.dyn.intelerad to reproduce.

item.title: [IP-86255] IocmAgent: Studies in ManualValidation are not sent to VNA after validation.
item.description:
RPM Version: IocmAgent-4.14.1.P251-ims01.noarch

EW - Client : EW562737 - RDS

Minimal steps to reproduce

  • With Iocm set up.
  • Have a Study in manual validation.
  • Validate the Study.

Expected behaviour

  • Validated Study is sent to VNA's after validation.

What happened instead?

  • Validated Study is missing from VNA after validation.

At RDS test server. The order was in manual validation and was not found on the other servers after the user validated the study.
LDS did create the DeferredActivity to have the series sent but because of the policy, and that the series was invalid, the series was never sent.

[2017-10-31 14:01:01.204 RE_3 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] IocmAgentService sendSeries invoked with studyInstanceUid [2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365] and SeriesInstanceUid [2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476408.419]
[2017-10-31 14:01:01.204 RE_3 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Skipping because this study was not validated and sending it is disabled by policy
....

The user then validated the series and the manual validation was marked as Done but was actually skipped because the study did not exist in the VNA. From manageIocm listActivities we have:

[admin@rdstest] {/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent} manageIocm --mode listActivities -s 2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365 -g -u bleung
IocmActivity 760
{
	Id                = 760
	StudyUID          = 2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365
	SeriesUID         = 
	Status            = DONE
	Operation         = STUDY_CORRECT
	RetryAfter        = 2017-10-31 14:01:46.46
	NumExecutions     = 1
	LastFailure       = Skipped because this series is not present on the VNA
	TimestampInserted = 2017-10-31 14:01:46.462
	TimestampUpdated  = 2017-10-31 14:01:48.814
}

In the IocmAgent_Worker logs we see that the STUDY_CORRECT from the manual validation was skipped because the study was never sent to the VNA:

[2017-10-31 14:01:48.276 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmActivityWorker_0' started
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.277 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] trying to acquire lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@98c99c[Unlocked]] for study [2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365]
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.277 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] got lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@98c99c[Locked by thread IocmActivityWorker_0]]
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.285 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Working on [IocmActivity 760
{
        Id                = 760
        StudyUID          = 2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365
        SeriesUID         = 
        Status            = PENDING
        Operation         = STUDY_CORRECT
        RetryAfter        = 2017-10-31 14:01:46.46
        NumExecutions     = 0
        LastFailure       = null
        TimestampInserted = 2017-10-31 14:01:46.462126
        TimestampUpdated  = 2017-10-31 14:01:46.462126
}]
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.294 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Connecting to [DicomMasterQueryService] on [[rdstest.rds.local]] using port [5012]
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.311 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Negotiating protocol '[0:com.intelerad.dicommasterservice.protocol.dicommasterquery.DicomMasterQueryProtocol5@1e6ce32]' with 'rdstest.rds.local:5012'
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.391 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Connecting to 'DicomMasterQueryService' on 'rdstest.rds.local:5012' with protocol 'DicomMasterQueryProtocol5.1' and session 'LTc2OTc4MjY0MjE1ZjczY2ZhMmUzNDY0OTZyZHN0ZXN0LnJkcy5sb2NhbA=='
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.398 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Service API 'com.intelerad.dicommasterservice.protocol.dicommasterquery.DicomMasterQuery4' will be served by service 'DicomMasterQueryService' on 'rdstest.rds.local:5012' using session 'LTc2OTc4MjY0MjE1ZjczY2ZhMmUzNDY0OTZyZHN0ZXN0LnJkcy5sb2NhbA=='
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.491 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Sending C-FIND request to [RDSTEST02] to get all SOP Instance UIDs: 
(0008,0052) CS #6 [SERIES] Query/Retrieve Level
(0010,0010) PN #0 [] Patient's Name
(0010,0020) LO #0 [] Patient ID
(0010,0040) CS #0 [] Patient's Sex
(0020,000D) UI #50 [2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365] Study Instance UID
(0020,000E) UI #0 [] Series Instance UID

[2017-10-31 14:01:48.812 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Deletion note for study [2.16.840.1.114523.2236650963.61056.1509476407.365] was not send because it was never sent to the VNA
[2017-10-31 14:01:48.812 IOCM_WORKER_0 rdstest.rds.local (TRACE)] Activity was sucessfully completed. Marking it as DONE.

-----------------------------------------

As an aside:
The logging in IocmActivityAnalyzer for isStudyPresentOnVna() should be corrected as it is misleading. 

DebugUtilities.printTrace( "Deletion note for study [" + mCurrentActivity.getStudyUid() + "]" +
                                   " was not send because it was never sent to the VNA" );
item.summary: IocmAgent: Studies in ManualValidation are not sent to VNA after validation.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi RnD Project Managers

Is there an ETA for this issue to be assigned and fixed?

Thanks

Hi Martin Villeneuve

We are currently looking at what we can do as we have other high priority issues currently being worked on. I have reached out to the Product Owner and will follow up with regards to when you can expect the issue to be assigned.

Thanks,
Tara

Nick Cabatoff, we probably need your input here

Actual behavior:

  1. The series is not sent to VNA because the study is stuck in (manual) validation and IOCM policy prevents SERIES_SEND activity creation.
  2. Once the study gets validated, the correction IOCM activity is ignored because the study cannot be found on VNA.

Suggested solutions:
1. A new IocmActivity state (aka IOCM state machine):

  • Create a new IOCM activity if SERIES_SEND type in a PENDING_VALIDATION state when a study is stuck in manual validation
  • Promote it to a pending state once the validation correction is received

2. A new "conditions" column in the iocmagent.iocm_activity table

  • Propagate policy info to the IocmActivity to have more control over the pending tasks
  • Store policy properties (conditions) as a JSON map
  • Enhance IocmActivityAnalyzer to use conditions to decide how the task has to be handled (processed, skipped, or postponed)

Hi RnD Project Managers

Is there a timeline for this fix? This functionality (IOCM on validated studies) was working with the DEV RPM, what are our options to get this working on RDS PROD sooner than later?
This is blocking the conversion of RDS satellites from their 4-3-4 environment to proper inteleONE connection to their 4-14 PACS and the server in the 4-3-4 are very close to full capacity without any option of expanding.

Thanks for your time and help

Martin

Hello Martin Villeneuve

As you can see the status of this issue is "assigned" meaning we have someone actively working on a solution. The developer commented on the solution he wants to implement 4 days ago. Please keep an eye on this issue for when we have the solution in testing. This is a very complex area of the code and I am sure you can appreciate that we would like to take the time it takes in order to have a robust fix in place. We are expecting that a solution may be ready for QA by Friday.

Regards,
Tara

Verification steps:
1. in "MpiDicomDomains.cfg" check what policy Iocm is using (in our case it's "DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED")

[IocmIntegration_QATOOLS]
vnaAeTitle                                       = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy                                = DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED
participatingAeTitles                            = QA4141MOD2
delayInHours                                     = 0

2. in "IocmAgent.cfg" setup sendUnvalidatedImages = false for the policy Iocm is using

[IOCM_POLICY_DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED]
sendManualCorrections                            = true
sendValidationCorrections                        = true
sendRisCorrections                               = true
sendUnvalidatedImages                            = false
sendValidatedImages                              = true
sendDeletions                                    = true
rejectionNoteTemplateFileName                    = /usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/dcm4cheRejectionNote.dcm
dicomOperationLevel                              = IMAGE

3. Send a study which would stuck in manual validation. The study is not sent to VNA

STUDYUID=`dcmdump image.dcm  +P StudyInstanceUID | awk -F'[' '{print $2}' | awk -F']' '{print $1}'`
echo StudyUI = $STUDYUID

item.title: [IP-86190] All Hessian clients expecting failover should go through linkerd
item.description: Over the course of Anjou we modified all callers to the constructors of SequentialAvailableHostsClientFactory and SequentialHostsClientFactory to instead call methods in ClientFactoryHelper. We did not deprecate the constructors or ask R&D not to use them, so unsurprisingly some new code has appeared that's not using ClientFactoryHelper, e.g. DmsClient, IocmActivityModule. I also found some users of SequentialAvailableHostsClientFactory and SequentialRetryAvailableHostsClientFactory that I somehow missed, which should also be going through ClientFactoryHelper.
item.summary: All Hessian clients expecting failover should go through linkerd

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

Description of the solution:
Addition to LocalDicomSeriesRequestsService and bump of protocol from 3 to 4.
LDS isn't supporting version 3. so all clients code were changed to use the new version.

    /**
     * Returns all Series Pending Deletion up to a limit of 5000.
     * 
     * @return A list of SeriesPendingDeletion
     * @throws ServiceException
     */
    List<SeriesPendingDeletion> seriesPendingDeletion() throws ServiceException;

Tests executed:

Tests using an eclipse hessian client and test using the integration test framework.

Unit tests added or modified: none besides hessian unit tests.

item.title: [IP-84259] IocmAgent: Update Iocm Database via a dbConfigurator script
item.description:
In IP-82552, we introduced a manual upgrade step for the iocmagent schema.

We should provide an automated way of upgrading the schema without the need for manual steps.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Update Iocm Database via a dbConfigurator script

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Description of the solution

Split the IocmAgent RPM into two RPMs, one for the app and one for the DB.
This satisfies the deployment procedures and triggers the needed workflows.

Tests executed

  1. Create old DB version using dbConfigurator --create
  2. Update DB rpm
  3. Run dbConfigurator --upgrade

Unit tests added or modified

None.

tested with the two attached rpms on el4141:

1. roll back my iocmagent to be old version
2. drop the original iocmagent schema
3. run dbConfigurator to create iocmagent db again, making sure that it only has iocm_activity table
4. restart iocmagent, making sure that it is up
5. install the two new rpms (need to install iocmagent first, then the Database one)
6. run dbConfigurator --upgrade
7. make sure that iocmagent db now has attr_dictionary and iocm_activity tables
8. restart iocmagent and make sure that it is up
9. send a new study to this pacs, make sure that the iocmagent activity is created and processed fine.
10. do a correction on the study and then a global deletion, make sure related iocm activities generated and processed fine.

send back to dev for commit.

item.title: [IP-84045] LDS: unwanted requests generated when receiving study from satellite with Referring physician ID value
item.description:
Hemmana found this on site.

RPM Version : LocalDicomService-4.14.1.P193-ims01.i386
EW - Client : EWxxxx - <client code>
Minimal steps to reproduce:
1. set up rds satellite/central pacs env as specified in TRC:2047850, where el4141 is satellite, qaload4141 is central pacs, and el4141 configured as validation-disabled on qaload4141
2. send a study with value in its Referring physician ID tag, for example, the study should have something similar as this:

(0008,0096) SQ (Sequence with undefined length #=1)     # u/l, 1 ReferringPhysicianIdentificationSequence
 (fffe,e000) na (Item with undefined length #=1)         # u/l, 1 Item
   (0040,1101) SQ (Sequence with undefined length #=1)     # u/l, 1 PersonIdentificationCodeSequence
     (fffe,e000) na (Item with undefined length #=1)         # u/l, 1 Item
       (0008,0100) SH [F61100]                                 #   6, 1 CodeValue
     (fffe,e00d) na (ItemDelimitationItem)                   #   0, 0 ItemDelimitationItem
   (fffe,e0dd) na (SequenceDelimitationItem)               #   0, 0 SequenceDelimitationItem
 (fffe,e00d) na (ItemDelimitationItem)                   #   0, 0 ItemDelimitationItem
(fffe,e0dd) na (SequenceDelimitationItem)               #   0, 0 SequenceDelimitationItem

3. make sure that the study is listed on qaload4141 pacs and have validation
4. listDicomRequests the study
Expected behaviour : should not have correction requests related to Referring physician ID
What happened instead? : there are duplicate requests related to Referring physician ID

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
=>Correction id : [1-486-1-838] (internal request_id : [2101])
  STUDY_CORRECTION [DONE]
  study : [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.65356.1504205926.10077]
  timestamp : 1504205932173 (epoch in millis)
  timestamp UTC: Aug/31/2017 18:58:52.173 UTC
  timestamp Local: Aug/31/2017 14:58:52.173 EDT **

==>Attributes :
    (Unknown DICOM Tag)                         CorrectionSubtype    = [VALIDATION]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
=>Correction id : [1-486-1-839] (internal request_id : [2102])
  STUDY_CORRECTION [DONE]
  study : [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.65356.1504205926.10077]
  timestamp : 1504205937962 (epoch in millis)
  timestamp UTC: Aug/31/2017 18:58:57.962 UTC
  timestamp Local: Aug/31/2017 14:58:57.962 EDT **

==>Attributes :
    (Unknown DICOM Tag)                         00080096,00401101,00080100 (Referring physician ID) = [F61100]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
=>Correction id : [1-486-1-840] (internal request_id : [2103])
  STUDY_CORRECTION [DONE]
  study : [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.65356.1504205926.10077]
  timestamp : 1504205938126 (epoch in millis)
  timestamp UTC: Aug/31/2017 18:58:58.126 UTC
  timestamp Local: Aug/31/2017 14:58:58.126 EDT **

==>Attributes :
    (Unknown DICOM Tag)                         00080096,00401101,00080100 (Referring physician ID) = [F61100]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Note:
1. this could be reproduced by sending this kind of study to central pacs directly, using the AE configured in AeTitleWithOverwrite as calling AE
2. if sending the same study using an AE not configured in AeTitleWithOverwrite, the issue does not occur.
item.summary: LDS: unwanted requests generated when receiving study from satellite with Referring physician ID value

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Error message that is causing this:


[2017-08-31 14:58:58.126 LDS_17 qaload4141mod1.intelerad.com (DEBUG)] Checking tag [Tag={(0008,0096) Referring Physician Identification Sequence.(0040,1101) Person Identification Code Sequence.(0008,0100) Code Value.}]: new value [F61100] old value [null]

So it seems to simply be that the IncomingFileCorrectionGenerator is having trouble getting the old value. Likely because this is a nested tag

item.title: [IP-83189] IocmAgent: failed to send image because of non-zero status code [141]
item.description:

Minimal steps to reproduce:
I am not sure how to repro this issue, but I encountered this issue several times during my testing (with build 4-14-1-P193 and up ):

the SERIES_SEND got this error:

8 last_failure .....................[Failed to send series [2.25.4157415123124436017286629352664185040] to archive

	at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.DicomCommunicatorImpl.sendImagesFromPathToArchive(DicomCommunicatorImpl.java:594)

]

while this happened, usually I found the run_IocmAgent.log has this NPE:

[2017-08-04 14:36:05.590 UNKNOWN mst1.intelerad.com (DEBUG:StateMachine)] Handling 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.IocmAgentAppl
ication$5'
OK - Created lock with '/usr/local/tools/pid/IocmAgent.pid'

Usually if the archive receiver is persistent, after several tries, the SERIES_SEND will work, but this could affect integration test running in Jenkins.

Restart IocmAgent will make that NPE go away.
item.summary: IocmAgent: failed to send image because of non-zero status code [141]

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I think this could be reproduced by using automation framework and a local pacs which is configured to be used for automation testing (i.e. AE created, user created..., ):

1. in eclipse, put the attached test class in the framework (this script will add on-fly config to enable Iocm feature, and then run iocm related test cases )
2. one the pacs, install IocmAgent, but do not enable it, i.e. not putting related config in MpiDicomDomains.cfg
3. run the attached test class against the pacs

in my case, the tests run in this order:
noKosForLocalDelete
iocmSendSeriesIfVnaHasLessImages
sendJpeg8BitBaseline
multiSopsSeries
sendJpegLossless
...

the first 3 cases passed, and it is stuck in multiSopsSeries which sends 15 sop series, since I put the time out to be 10 minutes, I got the series Uid to check it in the pacs, and see the errors

This is one of the reasons stopping us from enabling Iocm related test class.

There is another issue with the setting in IP-83376, we could see that IocmAgent also hung while the VNA is not repsonsive for a while, and then Ipmon restarted IocmAgent:

please see the attached iocmagent log.

The issue here plus IP-83376, Iocm related automated classes are not able to be enabled.

please note that removing the on the fly config change , let the class run on a iocm enabled pacs, it works fine.
PIL review: George Laza, could you please have a look at confirming this bug?

using dev IocmAgent rpm from Fouad, tested on a 3 pacs environment settings :

  • el4141 is satellite
  • qaload4141mst1/mod1/mod2 is central pacs
  • qa434mst1 is legacy central pacs
  • the dev IocmAgent rpm installed on el4141 and qaload4141

1. after installing/compiling/restarting IocmAgent on both satellite and central pacs, sent 5 studies with 3 series to satellite el4141:

2.25.113845631758381284318141077157927043336
images in the series: 10, 25, 30

2.25.237052669410503085101947377916708900369
images in the series: 10, 25, 30

2.25.121201116829354190047255077998475968442
images in the series: 50, 25, 30

2.25.231477681859292321891182494302045642040
images in the series: 50, 100, 30

2.25.137093226961436489864583441452209713080
images in the series: 50, 100, 30

waited until they were all stored in qa434mst1, checked the iocm activity for all of the studies on both el4141 and qaloadmod1/mod2, see that the num_executions for all the activities has 1 as value, which means there was not 141 errors

2. switched back to old IocmAgent on el4141 and compiled/restarted Iocmagnet, sent 2 studies with 3 series to satellite el4141:

2.25.209118621259495739025301638441605147005
images in the series: 20, 25, 30

2.25.301298237346180691477304546500963569691
images in the series: 20, 25, 30

did the same check of Iocm activity for the 2 studies, found the first one had one activity with num_executions = 4, checked the log for the activity, it was due to the 141 error; the second one had 2 activities num_executions = 2, checked the log for the activity, it was due to the 141 error.

3. switched to the dev IocmAgent from fouad again on el4141 and compiled/restarted Iocmagnet, sent 2 studies with 3 series to satellite el4141 with the same sop counts as that in step 2, did the same check of Iocm activity for the 2 studies, all have num_executions =1.

although the issue is hard to reproduce, based on the above testing, I think the issue is fixed, or at least much much better now.

item.title: [IP-82764] IocmAgent: Load-balancing sending of images
item.summary: IocmAgent: Load-balancing sending of images

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Description of the solution: Iocm supports load-balancing sending of images. The behavior is configurable by default it fallback to sending dcm to a single host. The configuration is in MpiDicomDomains.cfg under an IocmIntegration section.

Example of configuration:

[IocmIntegration_InteleVNA]
vnaAeTitle            = QALOAD4141MST1
integrationPolicy     = INTELE_VNA
participatingAeTitles = EL4141
delayInHours = 0
routingPolicyModule = com.intelerad.iocmagent.routingpolicy.RouteHashingModule
com.intelerad.iocmagent.routingpolicy.RouteHashing.vnaAeTitles = QALOAD4141MOD1, QALOAD4141M

item.title: [IP-82552] RDS: Keep old RDS PACS up-to-date with manual corrections and deletions.
item.description:
RDS will support both 4-3-4 and 4-14-1 PACSen until all satellites have been upgraded.

The radiologists will read using the old PACS until the end of the migration.

We need a way to forward the corrections from the new 4-14-1 PACS to the old 4-3-4 for the duration of the migration (which could be up-to a year).

Requirements:

  • A manual correction (including validation) from the satellite need to be sent to the Central PACS (VNA) and to the old 4-3-4 PACS (old RDS)
  • Ris driven correction do not need to be covered as we have a feed to the old PACS
  • A deletion from the new satellite should also delete on the Central PACS (VNA) and to the old 4-3-4 PACS (old RDS)
item.summary: RDS: Keep old RDS PACS up-to-date with manual corrections and deletions.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hello, my current idea is to add a step to LDS when applying corrections.

  1. Invoke the URI of the older 4-3-4 PACS and "forward" the correction.
  2. After a successful HTTP invocation will the request be marked as processed.
  3. For deletions, LDS would queue up a UMDB location removal for that location.

The reason I am not proposing to use the IocmAgent is that it does not have the contents of the correction and won't know which tags to forward to the URI unless we teach it about requests.
As per Roger S. This is only for manual corrections excluding validation

New requirement: As per Roger S. Ris corrections are also needed.
It seems that the 4-3-4 PACS is not able to keep up with the RIS feed.

Pushed to devel-im

glaza ~/repos/devel-im > hg log -r 188685
changeset:   188685:7839fcade3df
branch:      PACS-4-14-1
tag:         tip
parent:      188682:504ef147ce64
user:        George Laza <glaza@intelerad.com>
date:        2017-08-15 19:34:33 -0400
summary:     IP-82552 fix: Add support for RDS Legacy PACS sync

test has been done using IocmAgent-4.14.1.P216-ims99.noarch plus IocmAgent-4.14.1.P212-ims99.noarch:

feature is working as expected, related issues (IP-83493, IP-83539, IP-83189) have been fixed, except one edge case issue which was logged separately (IP-83834).

send back to dev to commit.

[admin@rromod1] {/usr/local/tools/control_files} 
[admin@rromod1] {/usr/local/tools/control_files} ps -ef  |grep  /usr/local/tools/image_server  | grep -v grep  
admin    13021     1  0 21:45 ?        00:00:00 /usr/local/tools/image_server -n -l /var/log/PACS/image_server

has to manually kill it. 

[admin@rromod1] {/usr/local/tools/control_files} kill 13021
[admin@rromod1] {/usr/local/tools/control_files} ps -ef  |grep  /usr/local/tools/image_server  | grep -v grep

the same behavior has been reported in EW￼F5944853 as well.

This bug exposed even more MAINT-5850.

Clients that have IP-72579:

IP-72579 release Clients
PACS-4-10-1-R56+ None
PACS-4-11-1-R51+ RRO
PACS-4-12-1-R36+ GDA
PACS-4-13-1-R19+ None
PACS-4-14-1-R12+ EMI, GRC, NSMI, RCI, TMRI, WRDI, WIN, AML, WCMIVAN, WDI, NZENU, BALRAT
item.summary: image_server: kill_image_server.sh doesn't clean all its child process

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
PIL review: Confirmed

My first reaction was to see whether this was a regression of IP-72579.

-I found no indication that this is the case. Prior to that fix, kill_image_server.sh did nothing special with regards to child processes — it simply did a kill followed by a kill -9 in a loop if the process was stubborn.-

-The child log for this orphan process would have been helpful here.-

This was indeed introduced by IP-72579, which broke the kill script's ability to kill the process tree.
RCI reported this in EW557966 and EW557978
Table moved to description

The following kill scripts also killed the children processes prior to IP-72579.

4-10-1+

  1. PACS/DICOM/workFlow/AutoMove/kill_AutoMove2.sh
  2. PACS/DICOM/workFlow/AutoRoute/kill_AutoRoute.sh
  3. PACS/DICOM/workFlow/AutoPF/kill_DICOMPrefetch.sh
  4. PACS/DICOM/workFlow/deleteConflictingSeries/kill_deleteConflictingSeries.sh
  5. PACS/DICOM/workFlow/do_auto_route/kill_do_auto_route.sh
  6. PACS/DICOM/CTN/image_server/kill_image_server.sh
  7. PACS/WorkflowCacheService/kill_WorkflowCacheService.sh
  8. Web/Utilities/webProxyController/kill_webProxyController.sh
  9. Web/WebMonitor/TomcatRequestMonitor/kill_tomcatRequestMonitor.sh
  10. RadiologistWorkstation/AudioServer/UploadAudioFiles/kill_replicateAudio.sh
  11. Support/Ipmon/Client/bin/kill_ipmonRemoteAdhoc.sh
  12. Install/Tools/kill_probeMonitor.sh
  13. Viewer/waveletConversionEventHandler/kill_waveletConversionEventHandler.sh
  14. Databases/Intermediaries/WorkflowQualityService/kill_WorkflowQualityService.sh
  15. Databases/Intermediaries/UserService/kill_UserService.sh

Additionally, on 4-12-1+:
+ components/integrationtestingservice/kill_IntegrationTestService.sh
+ Databases/Intermediaries/MultiMethodWorkflowService/kill_MultiMethodWorkflowService.sh
- Web/Utilities/webProxyController/kill_webProxyController.sh

Additionally, on 4-14-1+:
+ components/iocmagent/src/main/scripts/kill_IocmAgent.sh
+ components/audittrailservice/scripts/kill_AuditTrailService.sh
+ components/genericuserobjectservice/scripts/kill_GenericUserObjectService.sh
+ components/localauditservice/scripts/kill_LocalAuditService.sh

RPMs vs kill scripts

RPM kill scripts
AutoMove kill_AutoMove2.sh, kill_deleteConflictingSeries.sh
AutoRoute kill_AutoRoute.sh, kill_do_auto_route.sh

image_server kill_image_server.sh

IocmAgent kill_IocmAgent.sh
AuditTrailService kill_AuditTrailService.sh
GenericUserObjectService kill_GenericUserObjectService.sh
LocalAuditService kill_LocalAuditService.sh
Other clients also on PACS 4-14-1 R12 are NZENU and BALRAT

Description of the solution

Revert IP-72579 on kill scripts that used to kill the entire process tree.

item.title: [IP-81739] Register Hessian services in Consul
item.description:
Add protocols as tags.
Confirm primary tag.
item.summary: Register Hessian services in Consul

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hessian services register themselves to Consul

  • When hessian services start their HTTP server, they shortly after
    try to register themselves to Consul.
  • The hessian services specify tags to register themselves with: the
    protocols that they support and whether they are a primary or
    secondary service (based on if the host where they are running is
    the host with the primary database for that service, as defined in
    configuration).
  • When stopping, the hessian services deregister themselves from
    Consul.
Issue done.

item.title: [IP-81350] IocmAgent: NPE while processing a SERIES_SEND for a study not in local DicomImage
item.description:
RPM Version : IocmAgent-4.14.1.P151-ims99.noarch
EW - Client : EWxxxx - <client code>
Minimal steps to reproduce:
1. have a two server pacs, qaiocm4141mst1 and mst2, where mst1 is setup with iocmagent
2. send a study to mst2, which by expected will not be sent to send to VNA(InteleONE)
3. make sure the study is not present in mst1's DicomImage and not in VNA
4. manually insert a SEREIS_SEND with PENDING status record in IocmAgent db for the study:

(cmdline@qaiocm4141mst1) [iocmagent] > INSERT INTO iocm_activity (activity_id,study_uid,series_uid,status,operation,retry_after,num_executions,last_failure,timestamp_inserted,timestamp_updated,triggered_time,identifier) VALUES  (222, '2.25.215035751031490002970756109691934264168', '2.25.23179567724265456633004455509525143718', 'PENDING', 'SERIES_SEND', '2017-06-13 11:36:36.849949-04', 0, NULL, '2017-06-13 11:36:36.849949-04', '2017-06-13 11:36:36.849949-04', '2017-06-13 11:35:36.849949-04', NULL);
INSERT 0 1

5. check log/db to see how the SERIES_SEND activity processed
Expected behaviour : based on the SDS, if the study/series is not present in local DicomImage, the SERIES_SEND event will be ignored.
What happened instead? : the event is not ignored and marked done, instead, it failed and retried again and again with NPE

item.summary: IocmAgent: NPE while processing a SERIES_SEND for a study not in local DicomImage

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This could occur when diskmon deleted the series before the IocmAgent had the chance to run.

Some ideas:

  1. Update diskmon to also check the with the IocmAgent before deleting a series to see if it is queued up. (diskmon does this for StorageCommitmentHandler, AutoRoute, ...)
  2. Update IocmAgent to move this series back here. This is already done when a CORRECT_STUDY activity is received.

I think that when the SRS mentioned that this error can be ignored, we assumed that diskmon will not be deleting them. However, I coudn't find a bug or story for that.
Can just add a better exception if the query to DMS fails

Description of the solution:
Handle the case when the series is not known in DicomImage by deferring processing of the SERIES_SEND and requesting the series be moved to the IOCM host. This is similar to how corrections are handled when the study is not on the host.

Tests executed:
Created new entry for a fake Series Send in iocm_activity db. Ensured that it tried to route the images, rather than throwing an NPE

tested on el4141 with IocmAgent-4.14.1.P193-ims01.noarch, verified that when processing SERIES_SEND with non-existing fake series, there is not NPE and iocm agent will try to move the series locally:

item.title: [IP-80451] IocmAgent can send single KOS for study or series level delete
item.description: IocmAgent shouldn't have to send a seperate KOS for each SOP (or each series if we're working at the SERIES level)
item.summary: IocmAgent can send single KOS for study or series level delete

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Updated DicomnCommunicatorImpl to calculate the set of series and images for a delete message and input them all into a single KOS message.

Tests run:
Sent a STUDY DELETE for a study with multiple series and a SERIES DELETE for a series with multiple images. (for both series and image level dicom operations configuration). Confirmed that a single KOS message was generated with all of the series/images

item.title: [IP-80191] VNA location update could be discarded by DMS in some case
item.description:
RPM Version : DicomMasterService-4.14.1.P114-ims01.noarch, IocmAgent-4.14.1.P127-ims99.noarch, UpdateMasterDb-4.14.1.P114-ims01.noarch, LocalDicomService-4.14.1.P114-ims01.i386
EW - Client : EWxxxx - <client code>
Minimal steps to reproduce:

I am not very sure how to repro this issue, but it happened twice while I tested IocmAgent project recently. Basically, seems that this would happen when DeferredActivity_IocmTask is processed faster than DeferredActivity_UmdbUpdate.

the env is to install IocmAgent, set up related Mpi as following:

[IocmIntegration_Mach7]
vnaAeTitle = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy = DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED
participatingAeTitles = EMMA4141
delayInHours = 0
  • send a new study to the pacs, wait for a while, check that it only has the pacs as location, but not the vna QATOOLS:
[admin@emma4141] {~/1image/uncomp/US} listLocsforStudy.pl -s 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.41314.1494948438.141254

StuInsUID: 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.41314.1494948438.141254
StuDat: 20170516  StuTim: 11:27:18 ( 41238 ssm )
InsertDate: 20170516  InsertTime: 11:27:27 ( 41247.94921875 ssm )
PatNam: [EMMA241547^EMMA]  PatID: [EMMA241547]  AccNum: [EMMA241547]  ImsPostFix: []
RPId: [EMMA241547]  Owner: [EMMA4141]  Modality: [US]  Organization: []
StuDes: [CAROTID DUPLEX]  GroupName: [EMMA241547^EMMA]
TeachingFile: [false]  Tagged: [connection error]
   SerInsUID: 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830
   Owner: EMMA4141  Mod: US  SerNum: 1  NumSerRelIma: 1  isUpdated: F
   InsertDate: 20170516  InsertTime: 11:27:24 ( 41244 ssm )  SPSId: 008991171389883
   SeriesDate: 20170516  SeriesTime: 11:27:18  Source AE: SCANNER_NO_VALID
   SerDes: 
     Location: EMMA4141  Num: 1  Ingest Failures: 0  Pos: 0

basically, the way how the location updated with vna is like this:

  • LDS send a SERIES_SEND deferred activity to IocmAgent.
  • IocmAgent processed the event and send the image to vna.
  • IocmAgent inserted and woke up StorageCommitmentHandler for this series
  • StorageCommitmentHandler got the response from vna, then notified UMDB to update the vna location for the series

based on the log timestamp, we can see that the DeferredActivity_IocmTask is processed faster than DeferredActivity_UmdbUpdate for this series:

LocalDicomService_DeferredActivity_IocmTask.log:

[2017-05-16 11:27:24.194 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Going to run:IocmTask[
id: 917
StudyInstanceUid: 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.41314.1494948438.141254
SeriesInstanceUid: Optional.of(1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830)
Operation: SERIES_SEND
Timestamp: Tue May 16 11:27:23 EDT 2017
isValid: Optional.of(true)
Requestors:Optional.absent()]
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.195 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: Invoking 'sendSeries' from API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1'... (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948444195)
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.224 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.029 sec: Failed to invoke 'sendSeries' from API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1' (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948444195)
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.224 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (WARNING)] Invocation of method 'sendSeries' failed due to error [Session 'LTEwMDgwNDcyNjAxNWMxMWM3NDJlZTYwNjc0ZW1tYTQxNDEuZHluLmludGVsZXJhZA==' is unavailable]. Attempting renegotiation...
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.224 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Negotiating protocol '[0:com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentProtocol1@1635594]' with 'localhost:5136'
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.227 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Connecting to 'IocmAgentService1' on 'localhost:5136' with protocol 'IocmAgentProtocol1.0' and session 'LTY3MTk3MDM4OTE1YzExZGVmODQxNTY2ODZlbW1hNDE0MS5keW4uaW50ZWxlcmFk'
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.227 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Service API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1' will be served by service 'IocmAgentService1' on 'localhost:5136' using session 'LTY3MTk3MDM4OTE1YzExZGVmODQxNTY2ODZlbW1hNDE0MS5keW4uaW50ZWxlcmFk'
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.227 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: Invoking 'sendSeries' from API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1'... (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948444227)
[2017-05-16 11:27:24.242 TASK_917 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.015 sec: Successfully invoked 'sendSeries' from API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1'. Result is null. (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948444227)

LocalDicomService_DeferredActivity_UmdbUpdate.log

[2017-05-16 11:27:27.627 TASK_916 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Starting: UmdbUpdateTask{id=916, PatientId=EMMA241547, StudyInstanceUid=1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.41314.1494948438.141254, SeriesInstanceUid=1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830, AeTitle=EMMA4141}
[2017-05-16 11:27:27.685 TASK_916 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: DicomWorkQueueInsert (timer DicomWorkQueueInsert)
[2017-05-16 11:27:27.686 TASK_916 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Queuing Umdb SeriesLevel insert for aeTitle:EMMA4141
[2017-05-16 11:27:27.688 TASK_916 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.003 sec: DicomWorkQueueInsert (timer DicomWorkQueueInsert)
[2017-05-16 11:27:27.691 TASK_916 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] UmdbUpdateTask completed successfully.

based on STORAGE_COMMITMENT_HANDLER_USL.log, the notice of UMDB is still earlier than the LocalDicomService_DeferredActivity_UmdbUpdate.log

[2017-05-16 11:27:26.072 SCH:USL emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] UMDB notified for series 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830, organization IMS, series location QATOOLS, 1 images
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.089 SCH:USL emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Removed 1 events in state 'com.intelerad.db.dicomimage.lib.StorageCommitQueueTable$EventType@19431ca' for the following rollup:
series '1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830' on 'QATOOLS' ('IMS') has '1' images
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.097 SCH:USL emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] No items found in state RequiresSeriesLocationUpdate or UpdatingSeriesLocation
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.098 SCH:USL emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.036 sec: Loop completed (timer mainTimer)

see the UPDATE_MASTER_DB_WORKER_emma4141.dyn.intelerad.log, the one from StorageCommitmentHandler is ealier than the one from LDS umdb update:

[2017-05-16 11:27:26.128 UMDB:WORKER emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] UpdateMasterDbWorker (emma4141.dyn.intelerad) fetche
d 1 events from Work Queue
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.128 UMDB:WORKER emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Updating SeriesLocation for SerInsUID [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830] and loc [QATOOLS]
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.128 UMDB:WORKER emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Setting Image ingestion failure count = 0 for archive location for SerInsUID [1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.41315.1494948438.170830] and loc [QATOOLS]
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.128 UMDB:WORKER emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: Invoking 'updateSeriesLocations' from API 'com.intelerad.dicommasterservice.protocol.dicommasterupdate.DicomMasterUpdateApi7'... (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948446128)
[2017-05-16 11:27:26.138 UMDB:WORKER emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.01 sec: Successfully invoked 'updateSeriesLocations' from API 'com.intelerad.dicommasterservice.protocol.dicommasterupdate.DicomMasterUpdateApi7'. Result is null. (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948446128)

8.41315.1494948438.170830]
[2017-05-16 11:27:27.767 UMDB:WORKER emma4141.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] No entries for series[1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.832332
8.41315.1494948438.170830] were found in incoming_files queue. Query Time: 6

and failure count of 0

7767)

teAll' from API 'com.intelerad.dicommasterservice.protocol.dicommasterupdate.DicomMasterUpdateApi7'. Result is null. (tim
er ProfilingInvocationHandler_1494948447767)

UPD     SER     : 1

so in DMS_DicomMasterUpdateProtocol7.2_emma4141.dyn.intelerad.log, the update of QATOOLS is discarded as there is not DicomMaster information:

[2017-05-16 11:27:26.136 RE_128188 emma4141.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: Invoking a method from protocol 'DicomMas
terUpdateProtocol7.2'... (timer ProfilingSkeleton_1494948446136)

item.summary: VNA location update could be discarded by DMS in some case

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Confirming this bug as DMS clearly logs the fact that it is discarding this location update because the series is not yet in DicomMaster.

looks like this happens quite easy with action in series editor, for example, i split a two images series into 2 one image series using series editor TRC:1354109, the two new generated series do not have locations for InteleONE:

ok, the second time I could not repro with the series editor..so still a race condition thing.

2 Possible fixes:

1. Have DMS throw an exception and force a retry. This would allow UMDB to catch up.
2. Add the location anyway. Which might be odd if the series never gets added.

The same problem was encountered when automating cases TRC:15612 and TRC:15613 in which the series is locally deleted right after it was moved to a Dicom Archive: the series is sometimes removed from DMS before the archive could be added to the locations.
Option 1 seems like the better choice, though we will need to test what happens if the series is never added for some reason.

Patch to review: http://ssilva.mtl.intelerad.com:8000/r/54/

Prerequisites:
Iocm enabled and configured

Reproduction steps:

  • install attached LDS rpm to introduce an UmdbUpdateTask 10 sec time delay
  • send and image and verify Iocm's worker logs (see attached screenshots)
  • you may also look at the DMS update logs to make sure the location update is discarded
    result: VNA location is never updated

The fix:
Defers Iocm task processing until at least one series location is available globally (DMS)

Reproduced with RPMs: IocmAgent-4.14.1.P237-ims01.noarch

Verified with dev RPMs: IocmAgent-4.14.1.P272-ims99.noarch

Verification steps:
1. having IOCM configured, send an image to the server where IocmAgent is installed and verify that the Series has two locations one local and another for IOCM

comments.comment: actually, this also happened to one image series.

After discussion with Mark, I did some more investigation, the reason seems that on my workstation using dcmqrscp as VNA, this VNA only can return patientId and patient name (those stored in DICOMDIR), but not patient's sex. So IocmAgent errored out with NPE while trying to creating rejection note based on the template which has patient gender.

since this seems to be a limitation on dcmqrscp, I change the VNA to be qatools vna (which is a kind of more standard vna using dcm4che and db ), and did the following testing:
1. send a new study to pacs
2. wait until the location db updated with QATOOLS vna
3. do a c-find to see that it returns all related patient info including patient's sex:

I could not test currently either by manual using qatools vna, or automate using dcmqrscp vna.

I was able to use another pacs as vna (InteleONE in RDS's case) to receive the KOS from satellite. but for current automation framework, we do not support 2 pacs. the framework's vna failed on C-FIND, but I am not sure with some adjustment, such as we only use patient name, patient id in C-FIND, but not patient sex, it is able to receive this KOS or not ( qatools's vna failed on receiving KOS part).

still leaving this issue open, but change it to internal. will close it later when needed.

Description of the solution:
Set the function that builds the KOS messages to insert NULL values for the patient fields if no information is present for them.

tested with IocmAgent-4.14.1.P137-ims99.noarch and send_image-4.14.1.P138-ims99.i386 on emma4141 with dcmqrscp from dcm4che as vna, now it is able to receive the kos message. the issue has been fixed.

create a new script: send_image2. It will be deployed right beside send_image. type send_image2 will print help.

It only requires optionally setting calling /called ae, then provide list of images.

IocmAgent is also updated to use send_image2 to send images.

A detailed test result can be found here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R1X-AaivovUVk_XjjIWGlqWHr3OJKxO-tOp1kUAJ2JU/edit#heading=h.tr6y6ix00pr5

item.title: [IP-79400] Update SEND_SERIES Processing logic
item.description:
Problem here is that InteleVNA works at a series level. So if ingestion is slow, then the images for a new series will be processed as separate batches in the satellite LDS, which will result in multiple SEND_SERIES notifications to IocmAgent.

Then, when IocmAgent trys to send the second batch to the central PACS, it would check to see if there is already a series with that Uid present. But since the CFIND is at the series level, it would be present and the second batch doesn't get sent.
item.summary: Update SEND_SERIES Processing logic

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
notice two things beside the series level C-FIND issue mentioned in the description:

1. LDS seems to always send SEND_SERIES activity to IocmAgent per SOP, so it does not matter if the two images ingestion slow or fast..

2. when I send the first image of the series and wait for VNA location in location db, then send the second image of the same series, IocmAgent will drop its SEND_SERIES activity as it see the location of VNA while contacting DMS (it even has not reached the state of C-FIND yet).

Description of the solution: Only send series when VNA has less images than locally ingested.

Tests executed: n/a

Unit tests added or modified: n/a

item.title: [IP-79075] IOCMAgent sends series-level KOS messages
item.description: Using a dummy SOP
item.summary: IOCMAgent sends series-level KOS messages

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Description of the solution:
Updated the KOS template and logic for the INTELE_VNA policy.

Now, the Series and SOP Inst Uid are random uids, and the "Referenced" series and SOPs are the results of the CFIND request.

Currently, there is still one KOS sent per series or SOP, depending on the policy's DicomOperationLevel

item.title: [IP-79074] IOCMAgent can perform series level CFIND
item.summary: IOCMAgent can perform series level CFIND

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Description of the solution:
Updated DicomCommunicatorImpl to check the DicomOperationLevel of the policy. If the level is "IMAGE", it will perform a cfind query at the SOP level, otherwise the cfind will be a series-level cfind

item.description:

DMS will create a new

  3. correct the association time.

item.title: [IP-78506] IocmAgent: Support properly formatted Rejection Notes with referenced UIDs.
item.description:
RPM Version : IocmAgent-4.14.1.P70-ims01.src.rpm
EW - Client : WRDI
Minimal steps to reproduce:

  1. Send an image to the IocmRelay
  2. The image gets sent to the VNA
  3. Request a series deletion.

Expected behaviour :

  1. The image should no longer be present on the VNA.
  2. Any attempts to C-FIND it should result in an empty result set.

What happened instead? :

  1. IocmAgent successfuly sent the rejection note but the image is still findable.

I didn't actually test this scenario with the IocmAgent.
I performed manual DICOM commands to discover that M7TEST accepts the old style KOS but no longer hides the image from C-FIND.
When I send a properly formatted KOS to the VNA (one with referenced uids),
The image gets successfully hidden from C-FINDS.

This seems to be a change in the behaviour. I don't know if the VNA was upgraded or had its settings updated.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Support properly formatted Rejection Notes with referenced UIDs.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Since the IocmAgent is using a dynamic DICOM file template that is configurable in the IocmPolicy, we would simply need to add a new policy with a template of a KOS with reference UID. Then, modify the code that fills in the template to generate new Series and SOP UIDs for the KOS and insert the SOP ones into the references.
Depends on IP-74256, which prevents the IocmAgent to process (remove) a series that belongs to a globally deleted study.
fixed by Mark Groves here: https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-79075
fixed here: https://jira.intelerad.com/browse/IP-79075
Closed as per comment above.
Re-opening because while the logic required was commited in IP-79075, the template file for Mach7 has not been updated, so the issue remains.

Mark GrovesPer your comment above, who should update the template for Mach7? How does it get done? Thanks.
CC: Shane Kuan

Mark Groves we probably should update rejectionNoteTemplateFileName in both [IOCM_POLICY_M7_WITH_RIS_FEED] and [IOCM_POLICY_DCM4CHE_WITHOUT_RIS_FEED] to use "/usr/local/tools/IocmAgent/inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm", since this is standard?
Set story points to 3, guided by the "original time estimate" of 3 days.

I have been looking into this issue and this is a summary of the investigation.

I first talked to Mark G., who agreed with Emma's suggestion of using the inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm for all policies. He said we should just verify that the generated DICOM objects were properly filled out. Marked suggested that QA had a dcm4che system we could test against.

I asked Adron N. about IOCM testing and he said that he has never done any testing of it, but he pointed me to the automated integration tests TestIocmSingleServer and TestIocmMultiServer. Both of these test classes are currently disabled. TestIocmSingleServer has an ignore annotation with the message Missing IOCM Capability, and TestIocmMultiServer has an ignore annotation with the message blocked by IP-84489 (which, by the way, has already been fixed).

I set up a two-server automation testing system using the dev-effectiveness pipeline to run the tests from my workstation. So far I have only tried to run TestIocmSingleServer, but doing the changes to MpiDicomDomains.cfg myself. The test was not working, but George L. pointed out that in addition to IocmAgent I also had to restart LDS. After this I was able to run the tests, with several of them failing.

George also explained what he thought the problem was, and that is captured in this bug description. Basically, he though that the DICOM template file was using the wrong tags for the referenced series and SOP in the referenced SOP series sequence. As will be seen below, this is not acutally the case.

We have three rejection note DICOM templates: mach7, dcm4che and inteleVna. The mach7 and dcm4che templates are identical except for the fact that the dcm4che template adds the tags PatientName and PatientID. The inteleVna template is more complete, since it specifies the CurrentRequestedProcedureEvidenceSequence which includes the ReferencedSOPSequence. It also adds the ReferencedPerformedProcedureStepSequence, but it is empty.

I compared the inteleVna template against the standard and determined that the CurrentRequestedProcedureEvidenceSequence looks to be correct. I then tweaked the configuration on my test system to use the inteleVna template rather than the dcm4che one, and with this change all the tests in TestIocmSingleServer ran successfully. I have not tried to run the TestIocmMultiServer tests.

George helped me again, the goal being to test against WRDI's test system. However, it looks like the VNA test system is no longer available and currently WRDI has no VNA set up on its production system. We took a look at another customer site, MNHHS: they have a VNA set up and working properly using the dcm4che policy, but the configuration has been modified to use the inteleVna template rather than the dcm4che template.

My conclusion then is that Emma's suggestion is correct and the we should use the inteleVna template for the three policies.

My plan is:

  • Remove the dcm4che and mach7 template files
  • Update the configuration so that the three policies use the inteleVna template
  • Try to enable TestIocmMultiServer.
I have attached a fix for this issue on this slip for safe keeping (ip-78506-fix.patch) as commits to the repository are currently blocked pending solving IP-94472.

TestIocmMultiServer.

  * Rename inteleVnaRejectionNote.dcm to rejectionNote.dcm.
  * Remove files dcm4cheRejectionNote.dcm and mach7RejectionNote.

item.title: [IP-76764] IocmAgent: Clean old activities that were marked as DONE.
item.description:
At the moment, the IocmAgent simply marks the activities as DONE and forgets about them.
A cleanup mechanism would be needed to ensure that we don't use too much diskspace and risk slowing down our queries.

There is no other reason why the activities are kept other than for troubleshooting.
item.summary: IocmAgent: Clean old activities that were marked as DONE.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Released by padumas to master at 2017-06-12 13:43:22 (push 59381):
PACS-4-14-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-14-1-P151)
PACS-4-15-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-15-1-P15)
trunk (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-15-2-A16)

Relevant changesets in this release:
intelepacs:33d173e79c9a padumas PACS-4-14-1 IP-76764 fix: Cleanup old completed activities on a regular basis.
intelepacs:e3d460ccf3a2 padumas PACS-4-15-1 IP-76764 fix: Cleanup old completed activities on a regular basis.
intelepacs:6c773bf81a95 padumas trunk IP-76764 fix: Cleanup old completed activities on a regular basis.

Description of the solution:

Cleanup old completed activities on a regular basis:

  • Schedule a new task in the IocmAgentApplication whose purpose is to
    delete old and completed activities from the database.
  • Add private config to control: how often the cleanup task runs, how
    big the delete batch is and the age of completed activities (when
    compared to the timestamp_updated of the activity) for which we
    consider an activity 'old'.

Tests executed:

Generated 1 million activities in 'DONE' state and set their timestamp_update to a very old date. Also generated a few other activities in other states. Restarted the IocmApplication. Verified that all the 'DONE' activities were deleted in a reasonable amount of time (< 2 min). Verified the presence of a log file for the cleanup scheduler (IocmAgent_CleanupTask.log). Verified that the cleanup task ran every 24 hours (as per config) by leaving the app run overnight and checking the next day.

Unit tests added or modified: TestIocmDatabaseOperations

item.title: [IP-74516] IocmAgent: All worker threads hang when sending many large series
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. With the VNA down,
  2. Send multiple series with more than 50 sops each.
  3. Monitor Grafana to see the queue grow.
  4. Run the integration tests from time to time.

Expected outcome:

  1. IocmAgent should be able to keep up with a volume of 200K studies / year.
  2. IocmAgent should never get blocked.

What happened instead:

  1. At one point, all worker threads got blocked by a large "send_image" invocation.
  2. The dispatcher was no longer scheduling work as all workers were busy.
  3. The JVM stopped responding after a few minutes.
  4. Ipmon did catch this problem correctly.
item.summary: IocmAgent: All worker threads hang when sending many large series

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Luciano Di LallaA blocker bug that George filed, will need to work on it first thing in the new year.

The circumstances around which I reproduced this issue are very artificial. My computer was acting as a test-runner, which started and stopped the DICOM listener very frequently.
In the client's environment, it may not be likely that the VNA goes up and down in such manner.
If the worker threads do end up stuck if the VNA goes down and Ipmon manages to restart the process, then it will resume without any loss.

I will verify that Ipmon catches and successfully restarts the IocmAgent. If yes, we can delay this bug as it is not that likely and not that critical.

intelepacs:e5a789e5caf8 glaza trunk IP-74516 fix: Account for empty ThreadMonitor

Prevent this situation by adding Thread monitoring to the IocmAgent.
When Ipmon detects that a thread has hung, it will restart the app.

I tested this feature by replacing send_image script with a fake script that simply slept for an hour.
When the IocmAgent invoked it, it blocked a worker thread waiting for ipmon to restart the app.
Closing this one since the bug was performance related, and that George Laza had done the testing himself
Included in PACS-4-14-1-R5 (atlas 1.10.P9)

item.title: [IP-74450] IOCM: Add manageIocm command-line tool
item.description:
A command-line tool for managing the IocmAgent will be useful for the following use cases:

  1. Listing the status of activities related to a given study/series
  2. Resending a series/study
  3. Resending a deletion note for a given series/study
item.summary: IOCM: Add manageIocm command-line tool

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Proposed approach:

  1. Command-line tool framework ( 1 day )
  2. Listing the status of activities related to a given study/series ( 1 day )
    1. Requires a new hessian interface
    2. Requires a new database query
  3. Resending a series/study ( 1/2 day )
    1. Can be done by simply calling the existing hessian API.
  4. Resending a deletion note for a given series/study ( 1/2 day )
    1. Can be done by simply calling the existing hessian API.
  5. Other potential features:
    1. Listing the studies currently queued up
    2. Checking the queue depth

Hi Jason Bechervaise, should we squeeze this issue now and invest the couple of days implementing it?
Can you think of other use cases than the 3 mentioned in the description?
George Laza would it be useful to have an option to report on the count per state ?

Added manageIocm command-line tool.

The following operations should to be tested:

  1. sendStudy with a series present locally
    1. Should try to send the series to the VNA
  2. sendStudy with a series on a different location
    1. Will move the series that are not present locally to here.
    2. LDS should queue up a sendSeries when it is ingested locally
  3. sendSeries (present locally)
  4. deleteStudy present on the VNA
    1. Will delete the entire study from the VNA.
  5. deleteStudy NOT present on the VNA but available locally
    1. Hmmm... I don't remenber.
  6. deleteStudy NOT present on the VNA and NOT available locally
    1. Will skip deletion
  7. deleteSeries present on the VNA
    1. Will delete only that series from the study
  8. deleteSeries NOT present on the VNA but available locally
    1. Will delete only that series from the study
  9. deleteSeries NOT present on the VNA and NOT available locally
    1. Will skip deletion
  10. listActivities
  11. missing arguments in various modes

Successfuly invoked IocmAgent

End result: List activities Veriifed

Spoke to George Laza about the use case for deleting series from the VNA, and the logging suggests that deletions at the study and series level may be different an may need to be addressed separately, as the result of a series deletion on a series that doesn't exist on the VNA leaves the request in a PENDING state permanently, only to be retried again and again.

The problem is that when we delete the series, we:

  1. Check if it has a VNA location
  2. Check if it is in DicomImage
  3. Check whether the VNA has the images.

When we perform study deletions, we don't check # 3, only the first two.
The problem is that the method that checks the VNA content throws when no results are returned.
This causes the activity to fail, even though it is expecting 0 results.

As a solution, I don't see a reason why we would check the VNA.
The first two are sufficient to determine that we sent it.
So maybe we could simply not check the VNA (like we do in study deletions).

An additional test case would be for the skipping mechanism:
An activity should be skipped when the same action is scheduled to be done in the future.
For example:

  1. SendSeries followed by (SendStudy|SendSeries|CorrectStudy)
  2. SendStudy followed by (SendStudy|CorrectStudy)
  3. CorrectStudy followed by CorrectStudy

An activity is also skipped if its work will be undone by an activity scheduled in the future.
For example:

  1. SendSeries followed by (DeleteSeries|DeleteStudy)
  2. SendStudy followed by (DeleteStudy)
  3. CorrectStudy followed by (DeleteStudy)
  4. DeleteSeries followed by (SendSeries|SendStudy|CorrectStudy)
  5. DeleteStudy followed by (SendStudy|CorrectStudy)

The activity that is skipped does not need to be directly followed by its replacement.
The activities can be chained and only the last one will be processed as the rest can be skipped.

      • We see that activities are skipped because actions that override it after are scheduled, so we won't perform the activity. This was achieved using iptables to block the IP of the VNA configured, and then once the activities are registered, flush the iptables.

End result: Bug is verified
Included in PACS-4-14-1-R5 (atlas 1.10.P9)

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
RPM Version :
EW - Client : EWxxxx - <client code>
Minimal steps to reproduce:
Expected behaviour :
What happened instead? :

item.title: [IP-74256] DMS: Failed to return pending delete series locations after study deletion was processed
item.description:
DicomMasterQuery4.getAllStudyLocations() is documented to return all series locations for a given study, including those that are pending deleteion.

Expected result: getAllStudyLocations should return all locations all the time.

What happened instead: After the study deletion was processed, DMS was unable to find all the Series UID for that study and thus could not query locations DB.

I switched the IocmAgent to use DicomMasterQuery2.getAllSeriesLocations(), which works for series deletions, but was deprecated in favor of getSeriesLocationsForStudies(), which probably suffers from the same problem.
The IocmAgent has no way of retrieving the location after a study deletion.
item.summary: DMS: Failed to return pending delete series locations after study deletion was processed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
One idea would be that DMS would load all the requests for that study and enumerate the series checkpoints to obtain the series_uids. This way, it could look up all the series locations properly.

Unfortunately this does not work for legacy studies, but if a dummy series checkpoint is generated right before the deletion request is created, then we have no problems.
Marking this bug as blocks GA because it is preventing the IocmAgent from correctly finding the locations of a study that was deleted on the PACS.

A workaround could be that the IocmAgent does a C-FIND on the VNA instead of checking the locations.
Checking the locations was an optimization that we made not to invoke the VNA too many times for things we never sent to it.

A deeper analysis (George Laza, Fouad Zaryouh) discovered unforeseen scenario when a deleted series UUID can be reused by another series that belongs to a different study. This makes the "C-FIND on VNA" workaround more appropriate (safer) compared to querying globaldicom.requests table to determine the study ID for a given series. The issue will be fixed and documented in another project (Fouad Zaryouh).
Moving to the backlog for now.
Description of the solution: Fetch series location from the VNA using C-FIND.

Description of the solution: Perform a C-FIND to the VNA instead of querying DicomMasterService for series location list.

Tests executed:
1. send series to the VNA.
2. Delete series globally
3. ensure IOCM queries the VNA via a C-FIND

Unit tests added or modified:

The main reason we went with checking both DicomImage and LocationsDB was because it covered all the cases:

  1. Sent to VNA, location updated, C-FIND not yet available
    1. It may take a few minutes for the VNA to "ingest" the images. Only after that period they will be available through C-FIND.
  2. Sent to VNA, location not yet updated, C-FIND not yet available
  3. Not yet sent, already ingested locally

Please ensure that the first case will still work.

for case 1 mentioned by George:

1. Sent to VNA, location updated, C-FIND not yet available
It may take a few minutes for the VNA to "ingest" the images. Only after that period they will be available through C-FIND.

I tested it by using the following steps:
1. have a new study both in pacs and vna
2. lock the locations:series_location table with read only
3. server the connection between the pacs and the vna
4. delete the study globally
5. check the IocmAgent log for the deletion, we could see that it found the location of QATOOLS from DMS, but failed to send rejection note to VNA:

George Laza Fouad Zaryouh: It seems to me that for now, It does not matter if the return of DMS location has vna or not, it always goes to do CFIND to get the sops anyway. In this case, do we still need to do the query of DMS for the location?

item.title: [IP-73573] IOCM: Add collapsing logic
item.description:
If we are trying to insert a SENT_SERIES, but there is already a SEND_SERIES in a pending state, we could skip the new request as the old one will be retried.

Or, if we get a deletion following a non-failed send, remove both.

We should consider doing this in either in the hessian service or in the worker...
item.summary: IOCM: Add collapsing logic

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Increasing the priority to "Blocker" as IP-72691 will be handled by the collapsing logic.

Added Prometheus metrics for the IocmAgent Dispatcher and Worker.
Also integrated Nick's metrics for DefaultScheduler.

Reopening to add more RPMs

  1. analytics
  2. bringonlinequeuebuilder
  3. centricity
  4. dicomretrievalservice
  5. Hl7GatewayServer
  6. iocmagent
  7. DicomExternService
  8. DatabasesIntermediariesProxy
  9. DicomMasterService
  10. LocalDicomService
  11. PacsGlobals
  12. RegionalArchiveIntegrationService
  13. UserService
  14. DicomAgent
  15. PacsAuditing
  16. UpdateMasterDb
  17. seriesrouter
  18. ReportWorkflowService
  19. workflowqualityservice
Marking this task as fixed to allow Igor to perform some regression testing on the qa machines.

Additional use case:

  1. Continuously send series to IocmAgent.
  2. Monitor the number of insertions and number of completed activities.
  3. Restart the IocmAgent
  4. Continue to send series to IocmAgent.
  5. These counters should have no spikes and should not decrease.

Verified with RPMs:
*IocmAgent-4.14.1.P53-ims99.noarch

Verification steps:

  • Ensured that IocmAgent was installed, restarted it
  • Ensured that prometheus was running
  • Here's the output: 
    (admin) {qaiocm4141mst2} [conf.d] $ curl -fs localhost:20075|grep iocm
ims_db_connection_opened_total{engine="postgres",hostname="qaiocm4141mst2.intelerad.com",database="iocmagent",app_version="PACS-development",} 1.0
# HELP ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_attempt_total number of fetch attempts executed by the IocmAgent's Dispatcher
# TYPE ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_attempt_total counter
ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_attempt_total{app_version="PACS-development",} 5.0
# HELP ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_assign_attempt_total number of assignment attempts executed by the IocmAgent's Dispatcher
# TYPE ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_assign_attempt_total counter
ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_assign_attempt_total{app_version="PACS-development",} 0.0
# HELP ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_dispatch_total number of dispatching execution by outcome done by the IocmAgent's Dispatcher
# TYPE ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_dispatch_total counter
ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_dispatch_total{outcome="empty",app_version="PACS-development",} 5.0
# HELP ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_error_total number of failed fetch attempts executed by the IocmAgent's Dispatcher
# TYPE ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_error_total counter
ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_error_total{app_version="PACS-development",} 0.0
# HELP ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_assign_error_total number of failed assignment attempts executed by the IocmAgent's Dispatcher
# TYPE ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_assign_error_total counter
ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_assign_error_total{app_version="PACS-development",} 0.0

    • ims_iocmagent_dispatcher_work_fetch_attempt_total

item.title: [IP-72797] Iocm: sendRisCorrections option is not honored
item.description:
env: qastag4132mst1/mst2, IocmAgent-4.14.1.P16-ims99.noarch, LocalDicomService-4.14.1.P16-ims01.i386

repro steps:
1. has the M7_WITH_RIS_FEED as iocm policy which has sendRisCorrections = false
2. send a new order and then its matching study to pacs
3. make sure the study is sent to vna
4. make a ris correction on the order to change the patientname
5. check that the study on the pacs has its patient name changed
6. check vna for the corrected data

expected result: the corrected data is not sent to vna since sendRisCorrections = false
result: the corrected data is sent to vna

expected result: the study is not resent to vna
result: the study is resent to vna

note: this might be resolved while IP-72650 is fixed
item.summary: Iocm: sendRisCorrections option is not honored

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [IP-72695] Iocm: wrong retry of STUDY_CORRECT Iocm Acitivity
item.description:
env: qastag4132mst1/mst2, IocmAgent-4.14.1.P16-ims99.noarch, LocalDicomService-4.14.1.P16-ims01.i386

  • issue: for STUDY_CORRECT type iocm_activity, when it fails, it retries crazily, almost 1 second a time? and does not respect the retry_after value set in the iocm_activity table, or we can say the value set there is wrong?

steps:
1. make a STUDY_CORRECT iocm activity in the table which will fail (for example, get one like that in IP-72691 )
2. check its table after several seconds/minutes

expected result: it should retry after 5 minutes after first time failing, 10 minutes after second time, and 15 minutes..and so on
result: it retried almost almost every second?

item.summary: Iocm: wrong retry of STUDY_CORRECT Iocm Acitivity

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The problem is that the Dispatcher gets the activity that needs to be processed next (oldest retry_after date).
Once this activity is picked, the study instance UID is passed to the worker.
The Worker loads all activities for this study and sorts them by trigger time.
Then works on the first activity (which was not the same one that the dispatcher picked).
If this activity fails, the dispatcher would still pick up the same one immediately.

Ideas:

  1. Postpone all activities of the study equaly
  2. Change the Dispatcher's query to order by trigger time and pick the same activity as the worker.
