item.title: [IP-72579] Ipmon: check.process should verify the PID file before terminating
item.description:
RPM Version : IpmonLocal-4.12.1.P133-ims01.i386
EW - Client : EW509177 - CDHB
Minimal steps to reproduce: Have a stale PID file whose contents have the same PID as another application. In the case of CDHB the ReplicateUsersDB.pid contained the PID of the AUX tomcat instance and IpMon sent a termination to it.
Expected behaviour : check.process notices that the PID in the PID file does not correspond to the same application
What happened instead? : In the case of CDHB the ReplicateUsersDB.pid contained the PID of the AUX tomcat instance and IpMon sent a termination to it.

We could see in the catalina logs that tomcat was stopped suddenly without warning

21-Oct-2016 08:58:08.361 INFO [Thread-28] org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol.pause Pausing ProtocolHandler ["ajp-nio-127.0.0.1-8019"]
21-Oct-2016 08:58:08.418 INFO [Thread-28] org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol.pause Pausing ProtocolHandler ["http-nio-127.0.0.1-8190"]
21-Oct-2016 08:58:08.469 INFO [Thread-28] org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.stopInternal Stopping service Tomcat

And that time corresponds with when check.process tried to restart ReplicateUsersDB

[2016-10-21 08:58:08.301 check_process database1.chhlth.govt.nz (TRACE) {5698}] (mySystem) About to exec (/bin/sh -c /usr/local/tools/kill_ReplicateUsersDB.sh &> /dev/null)
[2016-10-21 08:58:10.305 check_process database1.chhlth.govt.nz (TRACE) {5696}] Exited normally with status code: 0
item.summary: Ipmon: check.process should verify the PID file before terminating

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Notification contained "Oct 22, 2016 09:45:06 ReplicateUsersDB PID monitored process down - restarted"
Spoke with John Mason about this issue and he worked around it by running lsof on the pid file's contents and the pid file should show up in the list.

check.process.ReplicateUsersDB delegates to 

/usr/local/tools/Ipmon/Lib/check_process --process ReplicateUsersDB --type 'pid,timestamp'

That then first performs the pid check (not the timestamp check) and invokes kill_ReplicateUsersDB.sh, which simply kills the content of /usr/local/tools/pid/ReplicateUsersDB.pid.

./components/policy/ProcessLock/src/main/java/com/intelerad/lib/processlock/ProcessLock.java invokes processRunningIsRightOne by comparing the timestamp of the pid file with the one in /proc.

That check is missing in the Ipmon plugin.
check_process.cpp has access to ProcessLock::processRunningIsRightOne but I'm not sure if it's using it here.

I checked the possibility that ReplicateUsersDB is writing the wrong PID to its file. The PID is obtained from ProcessLock by Pid.getPid(), which comes from ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getName().split( "@" )[ 0 ], a possibly unreliable way of getting the PID, but worked fine for me for few thousand iterations of comparisons with /proc/self.
Similar issue at QLD - EW485496
QLD EW485496 happened about 6 months ago, and have no remaining evidence of ipmon killings. The behavior is acceptably similar however.

Luciano Di Lalla Louis Bisson

Hi,

This issue was flagged as RCA for Code Blue at CDHB - would it be something for the IM team?

Thanks,
Tara

CC:RnD Project Managers

The most reliable way we've implemented (for which I'm aware of) is to create update the timestamp of the PID file after the process started, by using the one found in /proc, and have the kill script check that the currently-running PID's timestamp in /proc matches the timestamp of the PID file before killing the PID.

It may already exist in a library, but we need to make that available to "kill scripts". There appear to be many of such scripts that blindly kill a PID file. Modifying them has to be done in tandem with ensuring the application is already creating the PID file with the correct timestamp (many may already use ProcessLock).

If the application doesn't update the timestamp of the PID file, then a FRU where the kill script is updated won't be able to kill the application if it was started earlier. Depending on the FRU procedure and what application we're updating, this may not be an issue, if the application is shutdown before the upgrade.

For the record, I haven't yet seen evidence that Tomcat's PID got into ReplicateUsersDB.pid. For now, we see a coincidence: Tomcat stopped while check_process was invoking kill_ReplicateUsersDB.sh, but no explanation for how Tomcat's PID could have got there.
Marking BFIF as Requirement Change since this behaviour has been this way since the beginning.

I discussed with Luciano and we agreed that Image Management has more experience with C++ tools like check.process.
Reassigned to Image Management

Adding to IM backlog. Will need prioritization.

Luciano Di LallaLouis Bisson CC:RnD Project Managers

Estimation Meeting

Based on Bill's memory the problem is that check_process isn't trying very hard to determine that the PID from the file matches the actual running process. There's a better call it could use (in ProcessLock.cpp, I think). Or, perhaps we could use the existing Perl library that does a more thorough check.

No integration tests can be written because we cannot restart processes.

JRAD - EW526619

In this instance it looked like atrsender's pidfile contained the PID of the main instance, and restarted Tomcat. This ended u p causing a Code Blue for them.
Saulo Silva Please note that JRAD is on PACS 4-6-1 and QLD / CDHB are on PACS 4-12-1

Meeting minutes

Attendees: Jason Bechervaise, Luciano Di Lalla, Saulo Silva, Nicolas Marchildon, Maximiano Francisco, Nick Cabatoff

  • Kill scripts should be one line delegating to a function that kills only if the PID file is locked. Most applications already do this.
  • Action: Nicolas Marchildon to create a Best Practices document for kill scripts.
  • As part of this (IP-72579), we should make an inventory of kill scripts and their strategies, and assess which needs to change.
  • Nick mentioned the desire to have Atlas RuntimeMonitor manage applications. This is not in scope at the moment.
  • Nicolas notes that Tomcat does not have a PID file, and thus cannot use the regular kill scripts. A long-term goal is to replace Tomcat entirely. Aligning Tomcat's kill script is therefore out of scope here.
  • This should be done on trunk.
  • A separate issue will be created to improve check.process' logging to print the PID it is about to kill through the kill script.
    • That should also include a new check for unlocked PID files, with a logged warning or notification.
    • We should stop redirecting the output of the kill script to /dev/null.
  • Nicolas will re-asses whether Tomcat was kill -9'ed at JRAD, as there is disagreement between his memory and Max's claim.

IP-76194 has been created for point #7 above:
to improve check.process' logging to print the PID it is about to kill through the kill script.
That should also include a new check for unlocked PID files, with a logged warning or notification.
We should stop redirecting the output of the kill script to /dev/null.

kill script inventory
kill script strategies

EW528691 AIS
highly possible, Ipmon killed tomcat aux instead of StudyReportStatusStats which is indicated in check_process.log, because after that action, StudyReportStatusStats was not affected, but tomcat aux was stopped.
and, I do have proof that StudyReportStatusStats.pid is pointing to an non-existing process right now,
See EWF5598057

Muwei Li, we know pidfiles may contain non-existent processes, but the proof I'm really looking for is seeing Tomcat's PID in an other process' pidfile. From memory, the evidence is that Tomcat had been running for a longer period than the one being killed by ipmon, and we can't explain how Tomcat's PID file could theorically end up there.

Kill scripts should be one line delegating to a function that kills only if the PID file is locked. Most applications already do this.

I do not believe that this line from our meeting minutes is true. After glancing over all kills scripts, I did not find any that does what is described above.

The solution I am currently exploring is to have kill scripts invoke a new tool (written in C++, Perl or Python) that would kill a running process if its .pid file is locked. We could go even further and check if the PID of the process that locked the .pid file matches its content.
Posted https://oscar.intelerad.com/questions/5111/what-is-the-right-way-to-write-an-application-kill-script as a best-practices-documentation, as per Feb 3 meeting action item.
Side note: Saw in EWF5562358 that the while-loop of kill_by_pid_and_die appears to have piled-up to cause a code blue.

The inventory I've collected above indicates there are 91 kill scripts to update, with at least 4 and at most 43 different strategies.

I have re-evaluated the effort estimation; I am adding 5 days to it: 1 per strategy and an extra one as I am the main hotseater (interrupted often).

Client Version
AIS PACS-4-10-1-R51
CDHB PACS-4-12-1-R26
JRAD PACS-4-6-1-R96
QLD PACS-4-12-1-R16
Set "Fix Version" to 4-10-1 as JRAD is soon getting and FPU.

Bruno just brought to my attention IP-75628, which means we will have to backport this fix to 4-9-1 for VANTP.

The backporting to 4-9-1 will be done under IP-77234.

Description of the solution:

Created a new script, killimsproc, which safely kills a process. Updated kill scripts to delegate to it.

A process is now only killed if its .pid file is locked and its process ID is in it.

Some kill scripts were deemed out of scope; see this doc for an inventory.

As an additional benefit, the time it takes the PACS to stop has been reduced:

`time PACS stop` on a 4-12-1 VM
Run Without fix With fix
--- ----------- --------
1   2m4.341s    1m0.138s
2   2m5.349s    0m57.248s
3   2m5.719s    0m58.588s
4   2m3.741s    1m0.057s
Tests executed:

Unit tests + smoked tested 70% of affected kill scripts (to find out which ones were not tested, see the "Tested?" column of the inventory doc)

The script below was used to smoke test:

#!/usr/bin/bash

APPNAME=`echo $1 | sed -e 's/^.*kill_\(.*\)\.sh$/\1/'`
PIDFILE="/usr/local/tools/pid/${APPNAME}.pid"

if [ -e $PIDFILE ]; then
        pidCheck $PIDFILE
        eval "kill_${APPNAME}.sh --verbose"
        pidCheck $PIDFILE
        eval "run_${APPNAME}.sh"
        sleep 1
        pidCheck $PIDFILE
fi

ssilva4121:~$ ./kill-verbose-and-run.sh kill_RISPFd.sh
PID 18966 RUNNING [/usr/local/tools/pid/RISPFd.pid]
[2017-03-10 11:41:22.827  INFO] /usr/local/tools/pid/RISPFd.pid is locked and contains the PID of the process locking it: [18966]. Killing that process.
[2017-03-10 11:41:22.827 DEBUG] kill 18966 signal 15 (killer=<built-in function kill>)
[2017-03-10 11:41:22.927  INFO] killed 1 process
PID 18966 NOT RUNNING [/usr/local/tools/pid/RISPFd.pid]
Starting up RISPFd...
PID 19315 RUNNING [/usr/local/tools/pid/RISPFd.pid]
Unit tests added or modified:

Scenarios covered:

  1. no file
  2. bogus pid
  3. correct pid, but file is not locked
  4. correct pid, file is locked
  5. correct pid, file is locked (stubborn process)

See TestFunctions.test_killimsproc() in intelebase/python/ims/processlock/test_processlock.py.

To run unit tests:

ssilva:~/repos/trunk/intelebase$ ./bin/build/runPythonTests.py python/ims/processlock/test_processlock.py

:wq

Duke Vu: I suggest that the testing be done with 4-14-1 RPMs, with the exception of DMS, which should be done with 4-10-1 ones.

Reason: see the "Comments" column of the inventory doc.

I will now generate the RPMs accordingly and copy them to qa4141mst1:/home/admin/IP-72579/.

If you disagree with the strategy above, please let me know.

The RPMs were copied to qa4141mst1.

There are 74 4-14-1 RPMs and 1 4-10-1 RPM.

The following kill scripts were also copied but are currently not deployed/included in any RPMs: kill_DicomResourceProvider.sh, kill_UniversalViewerService.sh, kill_genericMirror.sh.

The following script was used for this:

#!/bin/sh
# Ad-hoc script to build and identify only RPMs that had a kill script updated as part of IP-72579

function buildrpms
{
    # rpm-dirs.txt was generated with
    #     hg qdiff --stat | grep -Eo ".*kill_[^ ]+" | grep -Po ".+?(?=kill_)" | sort | uniq > ~/rpm-dirs.txt
    # and manually updated as kill scripts are not always in the same dir as the scons file
    for i in $(cat /home/ssilva/rpm-dirs.txt); do
        cd $i
        echo -e "\e[93m\e[1mBuilding RPM: $i\033[0m"
        scons -u --make-rpms > /dev/null
        found=false
        # Copy the ones that have modified kill scripts in them
        for j in $(hg qdiff --stat | grep -Eo "kill_[^ ]+"); do
            rpmfile=$(grep -ls $j *.rpm)
            if [ -n "$rpmfile" ]; then
                found=true
                cp $rpmfile /tmp/IP-72579/RPMS
            fi
        done
        if [ $found == "false" ]; then
            echo "Could not locate the RPM under $i"
        fi
        cd - > /dev/null
    done
}

buildrpms
Saulo Silva, would you mind doing a quick assessment of IP-71571, which is in the same area?

EW535735 NWR
no direct proof , but Ipmon kill action timestamp is almost the same as the tomcat stop, which is 2017-03-15 19:32:43.xxx
see EWF￼5686339
Nicolas Marchildon: it looks like IP-71571 was caused by an empty .pid file and therefore would not be covered by this fix (as it does not attempt to heal a corrupted .pid file).

Listed as a reason for release in wiki:QaHome/ReleasePlanning. Marking as ReleaseNotes+.

I have completed my tests with Dev RPMs for PACS-4-14-1- and PACS-4-10-1. The "RPM Upgrade List" field is an exhaustive list; it includes all RPMs from all branches. However, some RPMs do not exist or are not applicable on certain branches. Here they are:

Only on 4-12-1+
  • IntegrationTestService
  • MultiMethodWorkflowService
Only on 4-13-1+
  • DicomRetrievalService
  • DicomMover
  • WorkflowQualityService
Only on 4-14-1+
  • IocmAgent
  • AuditTrailService
  • GenericUserObjectService
  • LocalAuditService

DicomMasterService is only applicable on 4-10-1 and 4-11-1.

Source: this spreadsheet

Verification RPMs: All the RPMs in the spreadsheet for PACS-4-10-1-P289 and Dev RPMs for 4-14-1

Verification steps:

1. Install the all the mentioned RPMs.
2. Perform the full restarts. Monitor the log to ensure that there is no error and all services stop and start successfully.
3. Using the Kill-verbose-and-run.sh for all the available services and ensure all services stop and start successfully. In addition, verify that A process is now only killed if its .pid file is locked and its process ID is in it.
4. Following step #3, verify that tomcat is still running for each of service was killed.
5. Following step#3, verify the log that there is no stack trace or error for each of the service was killed and started
6. Kill some services and verify the Ipmon will restart them automatically

Currently, a kill_* script needs to look like this:

#!/bin/sh

SCRIPTNAME="${0##*/}"
BASE=${SCRIPTNAME%%.*}
APPNAME=${BASE##kill_}
VERBOSE="" && [ "$1" == "--verbose" ] && VERBOSE="--verbose"

LOGDIR="/var/log/PACS/${APPNAME}"
[ -d $LOGDIR ] || mkdir -p $LOGDIR
RUNLOG="$LOGDIR/run_${APPNAME}.log"

killimsproc $APPNAME $VERBOSE >> $RUNLOG

This means that every script needs to parse its own name, find its own runlog, parse the verbose argument, ...

It would be better if the killimsproc script could do this. For compatibility, I suggest adding a new flag such as "--originalcommand" to identify the new behaviour.
Then new scripts could be written like this:

#!/bin/sh
killimsproc --originalcommand "$0" "$@"
As per the Manual Maintenance workflow, the Automation Integration tests passed for the build containing this fix. Marking Verified
Included in PACS-4-14-1-R12 (atlas 1.10.P17)
Added to the Resolved Issues section of the PACS-4-14-1-R12 Release Notes (#IPEN4.14.1RN-O, issue 11).
Included in PACS-4-12-1-R36 (atlas 1.8.P88)
In PACS-4-12-1-R36 Release Notes (IPEN4.12.1RN-O Issue 037), Resolved Issues.
Included in PACS-4-13-1-R19 (atlas 1.9.P32)
Added to the Resolved Issues section of the PACS-4-13-1-R19 Release Notes (#IPEN4.13.1RN-O, issue 18).

AIS affected by this again in EW572943

item.title: [IP-71863] wrong retry_after update for iocm_activity
item.description:
env: el4132, 4-14-1-P6

due to issue in IP-71862, the iocm agent currently failed to process STUDY_DELETE activity, it will retry and retry, but the retry_after column in iocm_activity seems to be updated with wrong time, for example, at 2016-10-18 17:45:45.379139-04, i got this:

com.intelerad.lib.vnaclient.DicomClientException: Failed to send DICOM Object. Received response with status [43264] and error comment [Missing SOP Class UID (0008,0016)]

	at com.intelerad.lib.vnaclient.DicomStoreClient.store(DicomStoreClient.java:110)

]

item.title: [IP-71856] split each iocm activity worker into its own log file and other issues
item.description:
evn: el4132, 4-14-1-P6

currently, look at the IocmAgent_IOCM_ACTIVITY_QUEUE log, we could see that all workers are logged in the one log file:

[2016-10-18 15:48:28.948 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_0 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmActivityWorker_0' started
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_0 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] trying to acquire lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@1cd8b4c[Unlocked]] for study [2.25.326033613801214986256473382453765865163]
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM el4132.dyn.intelerad (DEBUG:CustomizeDebug)] Redirected logging for thread 'IocmActivityWorker_1' from file '/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent/IocmAgent.log' to this file
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_1 el4132.dyn.intelerad (DEBUG:CustomizeDebug)] Modified debug component for thread 'IocmActivityWorker_1' from 'IOCM' to 'IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_1'
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_0 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] got lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@1cd8b4c[Locked by thread IocmActivityWorker_0]]
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_1 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmActivityWorker_1' started
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM el4132.dyn.intelerad (DEBUG:CustomizeDebug)] Redirected logging for thread 'IocmActivityWorker_2' from file '/var/log/PACS/IocmAgent/IocmAgent.log' to this file
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (DEBUG:CustomizeDebug)] Modified debug component for thread 'IocmActivityWorker_2' from 'IOCM' to 'IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2'
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.957 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Thread 'IocmActivityWorker_2' started
[2016-10-18 15:48:28.958 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_0 el4132.dyn.intelerad (DEBUG)] Getting activities for locked study [2.25.326033613801214986256473382453765865163]

It might be nice to split them into their own log file, to make trouble shoot easier.

also it seems that DISPATCHER related log are put in the main log:

[2016-10-18 15:50:38.859 IOCM el4132.dyn.intelerad (ThreadMonitor)] Starting to monitor Thread [IocmDbWorker_0]
[2016-10-18 15:50:38.859 IOCM el4132.dyn.intelerad (SQL:iocmagent)] null (on connection: 'el4132.dyn.intelerad:5483'):
select 1
[2016-10-18 15:50:38.861 IOCM el4132.dyn.intelerad (SQL:iocmagent)] get studyInstanceUid for the next activity (on connection: 'el4132.dyn.intelerad:5483'):
SELECT  /* 2077263c-7aad-11e6-92dd-989096df763e */ study_uid FROM iocm_activity WHERE status = 'PENDING' ORDER BY retry_after LIMIT 1 
[2016-10-18 15:50:38.861 IOCM el4132.dyn.intelerad (DEBUG)] Failed to find any study to work on
item.summary: split each iocm activity worker into its own log file and other issues

item.title: [IP-71855] missing a lot of details in IocmAgent_IOCM_ACTIVITY_QUEUE log
item.description:
env: el4132, PACS-4-14-1-P6

issue: missing a lot of details in IocmAgent_IOCM_ACTIVITY_QUEUE log

steps:

1. config vna in mpi:
[IocmIntegration_Mach7]
vnaAeTitle = DCMQRSCP
integrationPolicy = M7_WITH_RIS_FEED
participatingAeTitles = EL4132

2. set the DEBUG_LEVEL = ALL in IocmAgent.cfg

3. send a study to make it route to DCMQRSCP

4. make a global study on this study

5. check IocmAgent_IOCM_ACTIVITY_QUEUE for the study deletion activity

expected result: should see details of the processing of the study deletion activity (sending reject note in this case)

result: basically, nothing really.

[2016-10-18 15:52:26.892 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Loading rejection note template Dicom file
[2016-10-18 15:52:26.959 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (ThreadMonitor)] Starting to monitor Thread [IocmDbWorker_0]
[2016-10-18 15:52:26.959 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (SQL:iocmagent)] null (on connection: 'el4132.dyn.intelerad:5483'):
select 1
[2016-10-18 15:52:26.959 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (SQL:iocmagent)] mark activity as done (on connection: 'el4132.dyn.intelerad:5483'):
UPDATE iocm_activity SET status = 'DONE' WHERE activity_id = 30
[2016-10-18 15:52:26.962 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (ThreadMonitor)] Thread [IocmDbWorker_0] is being removed.
[2016-10-18 15:52:26.962 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (ThreadMonitor)] 1 thread(s) are currently being monitored.

and actually, iocm agent did not send reject note at all to DCMQRSCP, because it could not get c-find response from dcmqrscp when only providing studyuid, but not seriesuid (a limitation of dcmqrscp? ), here is the error in dcmqrscp output:

DCMQRSCP<-EL4132(3): processing 1:C-FIND-RQ[pcid=1, prior=0
  cuid=1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.2.2.1 - Study Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - FIND
  tsuid=1.2.840.10008.1.2 - Implicit VR Little Endian failed. Caused by:	
org.dcm4che3.net.service.DicomServiceException: Missing Value of Attribute: (0020,000E)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.service.QueryRetrieveLevel.check(QueryRetrieveLevel.java:143)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.service.QueryRetrieveLevel.validateQueryKeys(QueryRetrieveLevel.java:90)
	at org.dcm4che3.tool.dcmqrscp.DcmQRSCP$CFindSCPImpl.calculateMatches(DcmQRSCP.java:237)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.service.BasicCFindSCP.onDimseRQ(BasicCFindSCP.java:65)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.service.AbstractDicomService.onDimseRQ(AbstractDicomService.java:74)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.service.DicomServiceRegistry.onDimseRQ(DicomServiceRegistry.java:86)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.ApplicationEntity.onDimseRQ(ApplicationEntity.java:461)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.Association.onDimseRQ(Association.java:648)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.PDUDecoder.decodeDIMSE(PDUDecoder.java:459)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.Association.handlePDataTF(Association.java:632)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.State$4.onPDataTF(State.java:103)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.Association.onPDataTF(Association.java:628)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.PDUDecoder.nextPDU(PDUDecoder.java:177)
	at org.dcm4che3.net.Association$2.run(Association.java:478)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

I put this is a sub-task. I know this is about log file, but I consider it as a blocking issue for this feature, with this kind of log, it is impossible to debug/troubleshoot any issues in the feature.

item.title: [IP-71852] missing DATABASE_GLOBALCTNCTRL section in IocmAgent.cfg
item.description:
env: el4132, PACS-4-14-1-P6

    • issue: due to missing DATABASE_GLOBALCTNCTRL section in IocmAgent.cfg, iocm could not process its activity

steps:

1. config vna in mpi:
[IocmIntegration_Mach7]
vnaAeTitle = QATOOLS
integrationPolicy = M7_WITH_RIS_FEED
participatingAeTitles = EL4132

2. send a study to make it route to QATOOLS

3. make a global study on this study

4. check IocmAgent_IOCM_ACTIVITY_QUEUE for the study deletion activity

expected result: should not have npe in the log

result: see this error and the study deletion activity is not processed:

[2016-10-18 10:56:29.863 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Updating AE title information
[2016-10-18 10:56:29.869 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad] 
*************************
ERROR: Exception while getting list of all PACS servers: java.lang.NullPointerException
*************************
[2016-10-18 10:56:29.870 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad] Stack trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at Databases.InterfaceManager.getPrioritizedHostnames(InterfaceManager.java:526)
        at Databases.InterfaceManager.getBestInterface(InterfaceManager.java:210)
        at Databases.InterfaceManager.getAnyInterface(InterfaceManager.java:368)
        at com.intelerad.db.globalctnctrl.lib.GlobalCtnCtrlInterface.getAnyInterface(GlobalCtnCtrlInterface.java:81)
        at com.intelerad.db.globalctnctrl.lib.AeTitleInfoCache.createAeTitleInfoMap(AeTitleInfoCache.java:727)
        at com.intelerad.db.globalctnctrl.lib.AeTitleInfoCache.refreshCache(AeTitleInfoCache.java:425)
        at com.intelerad.db.globalctnctrl.lib.AeTitleInfoCache.refreshCache(AeTitleInfoCache.java:376)
        at com.intelerad.db.globalctnctrl.lib.AeTitleInfoCache.getAeTitleInfo(AeTitleInfoCache.java:208)
        at com.intelerad.db.globalctnctrl.lib.AeTitleInfoCacheWithIpLookup.getAeTitleInfo(AeTitleInfoCacheWithIpLookup.java:359)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.getAeTitleDescriptor(IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.java:118)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.getStoredSopUids(IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.java:78)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.deleteStudyFromArchive(IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.java:67)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.db.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:81)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.db.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:26)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.runCommand(LoggingThreadFactory.java:134)
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.access$000(LoggingThreadFactory.java:19)
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory$2.run(LoggingThreadFactory.java:98)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

[2016-10-18 10:56:29.871 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad] 
*************************
ERROR: Failed to handle IOCM activity
*************************
[2016-10-18 10:56:29.871 IOCM_ACTIVITY_WORKER_2 el4132.dyn.intelerad] Stack trace:
com.intelerad.vnasearchservice.protocol.VnaSearchServiceException: AeTitle DCMQRSCP is not in AeTitleCache, possibly missing in DICOM configuration.
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.getAeTitleDescriptor(IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.java:122)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.getStoredSopUids(IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.java:78)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.activities.IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.deleteStudyFromArchive(IocmCommunicatorHelperImpl.java:67)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.db.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:81)
        at com.intelerad.iocmagent.db.IocmWorker.call(IocmWorker.java:26)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.runCommand(LoggingThreadFactory.java:134)
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory.access$000(LoggingThreadFactory.java:19)
        at com.intelerad.tools.lib.scheduling.LoggingThreadFactory$2.run(LoggingThreadFactory.java:98)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)

we then checked the IocmAgent.cfg, found that compared with lds and hl7gs cfg, it seems to lack this section:

[DATABASE_GLOBALCTNCTRL]
DATABASE_NAME = GlobalCTNCtrl
POSTGRES_SERVER_HOSTS =
SYBASE_SERVER_HOSTS = el4132.dyn.intelerad
DATABASE_HOST_NAME = el4132.dyn.intelerad
PRIMARY_HOST =

add that in the cdcf iocm agent cfg file, and restart iocm agent, the npe error at least gone.
item.summary: missing DATABASE_GLOBALCTNCTRL section in IocmAgent.cfg

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I just checked, it looks like indeed the IocmAgent.cfg in cdcf/source has this line missing:

[DATABASE_GLOBALCTNCTRL = </usr/local/tools/control_files/source/GlobalDatabases.cfg:DATABASE_GLOBALCTNCTRL>]

although it has:

[SYBASE_ACCESS = </usr/local/tools/control_files/source/GlobalDatabases.cfg:SYBASE_ACCESS>]

closing this issue.
really closing.

item.title: [IP-71461] LDS fails to process IOCM type deferred activities after some minutes' idle (HessianFieldException)
item.description:
env: PACS-4-13-2-A95, el4132
issue: LDS fails to process IOCM type deferred activities after some minutes' idle (HessianFieldException)

steps to repro:
1. with default settings (iocmAgentServiceConnectionTimeoutMillis = 60000, iocmAgentServiceReadTimeoutMillis = 120000)
2. send a new study to pacs, make sure the study has iocm type deferred activity and the deferred activity is processed ok
3. wait for around 1 or 2 minutes
4. send another new study to pacs, see that the study has iocm type deferred activity
5. check LocalDicomService_DeferredActivity_IocmTask.log for the new study

expected results: the new study's IOCM type deferred activity is processed fine
result: it is errored out with HessianFieldException, saying unexpected object (session unavailable), only after restarting lds, this will be processed, but wait for another 1 or 2 minutes, send another new study, its iocm type will be stuck again with same error

note: if I change the default settings to be the followings and restart lds:

iocmAgentServiceConnectionTimeoutMillis = 600000,
iocmAgentServiceReadTimeoutMillis = 1200000

and repeat the same testing, but waiting for 5 minutes or so (still not reaching the 10 minutes timeout) to send new study, still get error in deferred activity processing:

see the following logs for the time when the session is created:

[2016-10-05 13:36:06.107 TASK_927 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Connecting to 'IocmAgentService1' on 'localhost:5136' wit
h protocol 'IocmAgentProtocol1.0' and session 'LTQ3MTA4MTY0ODE1Nzk1ZWFhN2NlNTk4MzhlbDQxMzIuZHluLmludGVsZXJhZA=='
[2016-10-05 13:36:06.109 TASK_927 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Service API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentSe
rvice1' will be served by service 'IocmAgentService1' on 'localhost:5136' using session 'LTQ3MTA4MTY0ODE1Nzk1ZWFhN2NlNTk4
MzhlbDQxMzIuZHluLmludGVsZXJhZA=='

see the following log for the time when the first iocm type deferred activity is processed after the session is created:

[2016-10-05 13:40:56.514 DFA_Fetcher_0 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Fetching next task in [5000] ms.
[2016-10-05 13:41:01.533 TASK_937 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] ===== Processing task 937 =====
[2016-10-05 13:41:01.533 TASK_937 el4132.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Going to run:IocmTask[
id: 937
StudyInstanceUid: 1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.2.8323328.5314.1475689250.933968
SeriesInstanceUid: Optional.of(1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.5318.1475689251.18759)
Operation: SERIES_SEND]
[2016-10-05 13:41:01.533 TASK_937 el4132.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: Invoking 'sendSeries' from API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1'... (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1475689261533)
[2016-10-05 13:41:01.607 TASK_937 el4132.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.074 sec: Failed to invoke 'sendSeries' from API 'com.intelerad.iocmagent.protocol.IocmAgentService1' (timer ProfilingInvocationHandler_1475689261533)
[2016-10-05 13:41:01.607 TASK_937 el4132.dyn.intelerad] 
*************************
ERROR: Unable to notify IocmAgent service about series [ Optional.of(1.2.276.0.7230010.3.1.3.8323328.5318.1475689251.18759)] sending
*************************
[2016-10-05 13:41:01.607 TASK_937 el4132.dyn.intelerad] Stack trace:
com.intelerad.lib.serialization.exception.CommunicationException: com.intelerad.lib.serialization.exception.ServiceException: com.caucho.hessian.client.HessianRuntimeException: com.caucho.hessian.io.HessianFieldException: java.lang.Throwable.cause: Class com.intelerad.lib.serialization.exception.ProtocolException is not a basic type and is not known by protocol IocmAgentProtocol1.0, unexpected object: com.intelerad.lib.serialization.exception.ProtocolException: Session 'LTQ3MTA4MTY0ODE1Nzk1ZWFhN2NlNTk4MzhlbDQxMzIuZHluLmludGVsZXJhZA==' is unavailable
        at com.intelerad.lib.hessian.client.InteleradHessianProxyFactory$1.invoke(InteleradHessianProxyFactory.java:103)
        at com.intelerad.db.intermediaries.lib.ProfilingInvocationHandler.invoke(ProfilingInvocationHandler.java:71)
        at com.intelerad.db.intermediaries.lib.SingleHostClientFactory$RenegotiatingInvocationHandler.invoke(SingleHostClientFactory.java:316)

I am not sure if this is the same cause of IP-71076, I am creating the issue here in case they are not the same.
item.summary: LDS fails to process IOCM type deferred activities after some minutes' idle (HessianFieldException)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [IP-70598] Add an image receiver using dcm4che
item.description:
When dcm4che is added into Automation Framework( IP-70597), we need related APIs using tools from this package to make an image receiver, so that we can automate the cases for this project.

The steps to manually test the image receiver functions are as following:

1. make a folder /tmp/disk
2. under /tmp/disk, make another folder DICOM
3. create a DICOMDIR file to be used by dcmqrscp:

./dcmdir -c /tmp/disk/DICOMDIR  /tmp/disk/DICOM

4. add the PACS server you test against to the ae.properties file (you can get this from the tooklit's etc folder), for example:

EL4132 = el4132.dyn.intelerad:5000

5. run the dcmqrscp on your workstation, in my case, on 10.93.4.96:

./dcmqrscp -b TESTSCP@10.93.4.96:5000 --dicomdir /tmp/disk/DICOMDIR --ae-config /tmp/disk/ae.properties

6. on the PACS,create an ae TESTSCP for the workstation, check "Update SeriesLocation for this AE" option for the AE.

7. make an AutoRoute rule to route study from your PACS to your workstation, in my case, from el4132 to 10.93.4.96

8. send a study to the pacs which meet the autoroute rule

9. you can see that the study is received and stored in workstations's /tmp/disk/DICOM folder, with this structure:

[elao@elao disk]$ tree DICOM
DICOM
├── 571D864E
│   └── 1AC54A24
│       └── 8F048284
├── BD1CEB07
│   └── 84318BC4
│       └── 9E194051
└── D391E9B5
    └── 1F2FB791
        └── 3BD61CB0

10. on the pacs, run c-find for the study on the workstation, works fine
11. on the pacs, check SCH log to see the series shown in STORAGE_COMMITMENT_HANDLER_USL.log
12. check that the location db is updated with TESTSCP for the study

We also need to the capability to use deactivate the folder of a study in order to received its corrected version, the command line tool to do so is as following:

For example, use the following to get the sop is located in which directory:
 ./dcmdir -l  /tmp/disk/DICOMDIR

 if the sop is inside this folder:
/tmp/disk/DICOM/5830BF51

use the following two commands to deactivate the folder:

./dcmdir -d /tmp/disk/DICOMDIR /tmp/disk/DICOM/5830BF51

./dcmdir -p /tmp/disk/DICOMDIR

after this, the dcmqrscp can receive the corrected study from PACS and save it as a separate file in /tmp/disk/DICOM/5830BF51 folder.
item.summary: Add an image receiver using dcm4che

item.summary: Query archive for SOP Instance UIDs for given study/series

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Released by mgroves to master at 2016-10-14 13:54:21 (push 52244):
PACS-4-14-1 (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-14-1-P2)
trunk (fix) (previous build: PACS-4-14-2-A3)

Relevant changesets in this release:
intelepacs:d045be4408f1 mgroves PACS-4-14-1 IP-19818 fix: add framework for sending rejection notes to VNA
intelepacs:2d869417fe44 mgroves trunk IP-19818 fix: add framework for sending rejection notes to VNA

Description of the solution:

  • Added basic guice infrastructure.
  • created dispatcher to get the next study for processing
  • created worker task to :
    1. lock the study
    2. get the tasks for a study
    3. send a cfind to get the SOPs for a study or series
    4. send a set of rejection notes (one per SOP) to delete the images
    5. mark the iocm activity as completed

Tests executed: ran against DCM4CHEE archive on QATOOLS.

1 - Added new images, then manually created a task in the iocmactivity table to delete the series. Ensured the series was successfully marked as "Rejected for quality reasons"

2 - Changed the remote VNA to an AE title that does not exist, then manually created a task in the iocmactivity table to delete the series. Ensured that it failed trying to connect to the VNA and that the error count and failure message were present in the table
